title: Capacity Planner, DoD - Defense Health Agency
description:
ASRC Federal Data Network Technologies has an immediate position for a Capacity Planner/Data Architect to join our growing team in support of a DoD customer. We offer an excellent work-life balance, competitive salaries and benefit packages and a professional development program that will keep you cutting edge. 
 
*  Providing senior technical leadership and guidance to junior engineers where applicable 
*  Hands-on capacity planning modeling of complex applications/systems 
*  Provide modeling that will integrate five customer-built defense health systems, multiple COTS products and a growing number of interfaces with external systems to ensure seamless and reliable flow of health data 
*  Analyze and model complex system requirements and provide recommendations to client leadership on new requirements, technologies and processes to consider in future system development efforts 
*  Provide multiple models using industry leading tools such as Idera and Solar  
*  Provide performance monitoring, trending workload stacking, simulation modeling and analytical modeling using industry leading tools 
*  Support performance testing using Load Runner 
*  Capacity Planning and/or Cloud Capacity Management Certification is a plus                                                          
 
ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, gender, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, religion, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor prohibited by applicable law. 
WORLD  
 
Capacity Planners with a passion for System Behavior, Performance and Modeling:  If you are seeking your next challenge and place to call "home",  we have a position that where you can truly leave a "footprint" and make a difference.  Do you have experience with  HP Load Runner,  Idera or Solar Winds? Join our growing team and apply on-line and then connect with your recruiter at trthomas@asrcfederal.com.   
 
*  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline (MIS, IT, etc.) 
*  Modeling skills experience including Performance monitoring, Trending, Workload stacking, Simulation modeling, and Analytical modeling a plus 
*  Seven (7) plus years of experience in systems administration, system engineering or software development 
*  Proficiency with Jira, Java EE, JBoss EA, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, WM Frameworks, SOAP, REST, Oracle or SQL server and WebSphere 
*  Deep desire and willingness to learn new technologies 
*  Experience with Idera, Solar Winds or other modeling tools and HP's Load Runner is a must 
*   Secret clearance or US Citizenship  and eligibility to obtain a DoD clearance 
*  Ability to obtain a Security+ certification and an OS Certification within 6 months of employment is required (We pay for certifications)   
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Global Network Planning Manager
description:
A career with MilliporeSigma is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 57,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in healthcare, life science and performance materials. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others. MilliporeSigma is a business of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany. 
 
 
 
 At MilliporeSigma this position is part of the Process Solutions Global Supply Network Planning Team managing critical product portfolios across global regions. The Network Planning Team works closely with Demand Planning, Production Planning and Customer Service Teams to ensure we have "the right products, at the right quantity, in the right place" to meet our Customers' demand. 
The major responsibility of the Global Supply Network Planning team is the strategic inventory management and the intercompany replenishment to assure a high customer service level for all our global customers. 
The position will encompass management of critical initiatives including portfolio segmentation, Business Continuity Planning, and portfolio automation initiatives. The position requires a high level of collaboration with a variety of interfaces globally as well as keeping a close link to local functions in the Supply Planning and Demand Planning teams. 
 Responsibilities include: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 RSRMS 
 
 
 With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life! 
 
 
Apply and find more information at https://jobs.vibrantm.com

title: System Operations Supervisor
description:
Requisition ID:  62484  
Job Function/Category:  Operations  
Employment Type:  Exempt Full Time  
 
 
Supervise and guide the on-shift operation of the Gas Delivery System during normal and emergency conditions. Perform day-ahead load forecasting. Provide leadership and direction to the System Operators to ensure the system is operated in a safe, reliable, and efficient manner. Follow procedures to ensure PSE&G maintains compliance with PHMSA, FERC, NERC Mandatory Standards. Analyze disturbances on the Gas Delivery System to determine proper corrective action and appropriate agency reporting. Maintain and apply knowledge of PSEG Standards for Business Controls and meet management's expectations for effective internal business controls, integrity and corporate policies. Evaluate and prepare performance & accountability partnerships for the associates on your shift. Demonstrated ability to instruct, lead, train and assist associates and customers. Establish a sense of urgency to complete tasks in a safe and efficient manner. 
 
• Bachelor degree in Engineering, Business or Computer Science or a related field experience with minimum of 9 years in the gas or pipeline industry. 
• Minimum 5 years' in Gas Control, Gas Regulation, Measurement, Gas Operations, pipeline safety and /or related mechanical skills 
• Must have 5 years or more of extensive experience with operating natural gas pipeline systems 
• Experience performing daily gas sendout estimating. 
• Ability to manage, direct train and motivate employees 
• Must be decisive 
• Must have the ability to communicate effectively; exercise independent action, judgement and risk management; act decisively and interact effectively with all gas control peers and gas pipeline stakeholders. 
• Knowledge of Control Room Management (CRM) Plan and completion of mandatory annual PHMSA CRM training including; Operator Qualification, Fatigue Education and Team Training 
• Have a thorough understanding of company Gas emergency procedures, safety rules and regulations. 
• Must be adept at reading maps, blueprints and piping schematics and have the ability to identify and respond to all audio and visual alarms. 
• Must be available to respond for emergency and relief assignments 
• Must possess a valid driver's license. 
Desired Qualifications: 
• BA/BS in Business or Engineering 
• 5 Years of technical knowledge of PSE&G Gas Distribution System 
• 7 Years or more experience as a Gas System Operator 
• Experience supervising and managing personnel 
• Advanced Knowledge of Gas System Operations 
 
5 years of experience

title: Cattle Breeding Tech and Ranch Manager
Content Manager/Attorney Editor (Corporate and Merger & Acquisition)
description:
LexisNexis seeks a recently practicing Merger & Acquisition attorney with 5+ years of experience to help develop online legal products, tools, and solutions for attorneys. We are seeking someone with recent and intimate knowledge of the Merger & Acquisition market and trends, as well as familiarity with Merger & Acquisition attorney workflow. The person in this role will use their practical legal knowledge to inform content development and assist in developing the strategic direction for the product.
The person in this role will help deliver a compelling and all-purpose practical guidance legal product across targeted markets as a member of a multi-disciplined team of content developers, product planners, external consultants, IT specialists, and marketing and sales representatives. This person will:
• Develop, write and edit practical guidance on a variety of merger & acquisition topics and trends
• Draft, review, and annotate forms and checklists
• Monitor trends in Merger & Acquisition law
• Recruit and manage external authors to ensure timely delivery of content
• Make recommendations concerning overall content strategy and expansion, and assist in product design
• Monitor competitiveness of the product offering
• Support sales efforts via product demonstrations and contribute to sales and customer trainings
• 5+ years of recent experience (preferably at an Am Law 100/200 firm) practicing mergers and acquisitions law.
 
•Significant experience drafting and negotiating merger agreements, purchase agreements, stockholders’ agreements, LLC agreements and other documentation in connection with Merger & Acquisition transactions and related corporate matters.
•Deep knowledge of Merger & Acquisition trends and workflow.
•Strong professional network of Merger & Acquisition attorneys.
• Excellent writing, editing, and research skills; strong practical writer; experience drafting client alerts and/or composing and delivering CLE presentations.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills.
• Organized, self-motivated, and detail-oriented.
• Experience leading associate training programs.
• Active bar membership in good standing.

title: Implementation Project Manager
description:
Fidelity TalentSource is looking for an Implementation Project Manager at Fidelity Investments located at Westlake TX, Salt Lake City UT, Merrimack NH, Covington KY or Raleigh NC. It can also be remote.
This is a contract role that pays $40.00 an hour.
The 
 is the leader of Fidelity’s conversion team that is responsible for the transition of 401(k) plans from point of sale to handoff to ongoing service teams.
As a dedicated member of our team in Workplace Investing, you will manage and influence internal partners including the Plan Consultant, Sales, Data Conversion Consultant and Conversion Analyst to ensure the success of the project. Additionally, you will work with external partners such as Prior Recordkeepers, Clients, Advisors and other Fund Companies regarding project status and execution of Client owned activities. This role coordinates the completion of tasks by these internal and external partners in order to complete the project in the agreed upon timeline.
The Implementation Project Management team is responsible for all conversions and corporate actions for all plans with assets less than $100M and on the Volume Submitter Document. We support the Sales team by participating in some prospect meetings, but our main role is to act as a bridge between the Sales team and the ongoing Service teams. We take 401(k) plans from various different providers and standardize them so that they fit on both Fidelity’s document and Service Model. Our success leads to stronger new plan sales and acquisitions which are the life blood of Fidelity.
Fidelity TalentSource, formerly Veritude, is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. We recruit individuals from a variety of backgrounds, including technology and customer service, to fill assignments across Fidelity’s U.S.-based regional and investor center locations. If you would like to experience Fidelity’s diverse and inclusive workplace while expanding your skill set and developing your professional network, consider a role with Fidelity TalentSource. For information about working at Fidelity TalentSource, visit 
.
At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit 
.
Fidelity Investments and Fidelity TalentSource are equal opportunity employers.

title: IT Project Manager
description:
Title: IT Project Manager
 
 
Mandatory skills:
project management,
data center, data center operations, 
Active Directory, 
Information Technology Infrastructure Library, ITIL,
customer requirements, technical resource, 
project delivery, project documentation, procurement, resource acquisition, 
validation testing, budget, deployment, user acceptance testing, 
change Management, release management, 
IT projects, IT operations,
data center relocation, migration, virtual server
 
Description:
Project Manager needed with previous experience with complex IT projects, including data center relocation, migration from a physical to virtual server environment, and moving to enterprise Active Directory solutions.
Candidates will be allowed to work remotely but will be required to come onto the office for occasional meetings.
The client has a need for an experienced IT Technical Project Manager.
This position will be responsible for managing two complex, interdependent projects to migrate mission critical services to managed enterprise solutions.
The first involves migrating from a local Active Directory service and the second is the migration and consolidation of mission critical data center assets.
The Technical Project Manager is needed to aid and support the Agency in planning and managing several mission critical, time sensitive projects.
Candidates must have previous experience with complex IT projects, including data center relocation, migration from a physical to virtual server environment, and moving to enterprise Active Directory solutions.
This position will interact at all levels and across multiple organizations, including agency business, IT executives. IT operations, and private sector vendors.
The Project Manager will:
Manage and direct a project to move servers/systems from a local agency data center to a hosted solution in an enterprise data center managed by the client.
Provide technical leadership for the project team comprised of vendor & state technical resources.
Work on complex problems where analysis of situation or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors to achieve best results.
Work effectively with internal and external clients, third party vendors, and senior management in accomplishing project objectives.
Evaluate complex situations accurately and identify viable solutions that create successful outcomes for the customer.
Work closely with the Project Sponsor(s) and to facilitate decisions necessary for project delivery.
Manage effective project oversight and reviews to affect project success.
Participating in the requirements, design, development, validation testing and implementation phases of the project and minimize the impact on the client department.
Develop and maintain detailed project plans that provides the necessary oversight to manage and monitor project schedules, procurement, resource acquisition, budget, deployment, user acceptance testing, open issues, change and release management.
Develop and maintain project documentation including schedules/timelines and various detailed plans for Communication, Risk Management, Deployment, design, engineering, and others as required.
Develop and maintain "lessons-learned" for utilization on future projects.
Communicate and Resolve resource, budgeting, and change issues affecting the project.
Oversee change requests associated with the project.
Oversee vendor relations and procurement related to the project
Develop and maintain status reports, decision, and issue logs.
Participating in the acceptance of deliverables
Skills :
Strong understanding of project management principles, tools, and templates.

5
Years

title: Infrastructure Manager
description:
?             Working knowledge of Converged and Hyper Converged technologies such as Cisco UCS, Dell VXRail, or Nutanix
?             Experience with On-prem cloud management platforms such as VMWare Cloud Foundations
?             Experience working and integrating operational processes and capabilities into a Service now framework
?             Experience designing and implementing solutions under a Cloud DevOps or Agile Development model and proc
The Infrastructure Integration Lead is a senior technology leader that will function as an enabler across IT Architecture, Engineering, Operations, Security, Strategic partners, Technology vendors and Project management teams to facilitate the successful delivery of complex Client’s initiatives and priorities.  The Infrastructure Integration Leader will have a diverse and deep background in all aspects of Infrastructure solution delivery including architecture and design, engineering and operations, project planning and coordination, quality control and cross team facilitation. The Infrastructure Integration Lead will report to the Director of Global Compute platforms
. 
As a core member of the Client’s Multi-Cloud team, the Infrastructure Integration Lead will be responsible for helping direct and guide the delivery of key priorities across multiple stakeholders, with the assistance of the Project Manager and Technical Support teams. While being predominantly internally focused, this position will require strong communication to bridge between various Infrastructure and Application teams as well as an excellent ability to navigate within a background of relative ambiguity.
Key responsibilities:
?             Supports IT project start up though technical consultation, charter definition, benefit and analysis, requirements gathering and formal PMO approval.
?             Provides technical leadership and support to project managers; including building detailed migration plans, measuring and tracking progress, managing key       risks & issues, and reporting out status.
?             Partners with all members of project team as a technical lead in the planning, design, coordination and execution of comprehensive, realistic and effective work plans.
?             In partnership with Client’s architecture, helps gather requirements, define options and develop holistic integrated solutions to complex business challenges.
?             Establishes standards, policies & guidelines for the Compute Platform in collaboration with service line owner and technology teams
?             Leads matrixed teams in the design and operational delivery of technology solutions in support of key business priorities across the company.
?             Partners with IT Leaders, Infrastructure specialists, and technology suppliers in the evaluation, piloting and delivery of new technology for the organization
?             Improves service and cost efficiency though continuous assessment of technology and operational processes
?             Helps promote a consistent vision and strategy throughout the organization
?             Builds relationships that foster collaboration and partnerships to drive better strategies, priorities, and service to the customer
?             Helps build and maintain documentation repositories associated with project efforts
?             Assists and oversees quality change control according to Client’s Change Management Methodology
?             Mentors members of the Infrastructure team on architectural, engineering and operational best practices
?             Provides escalated support for Business-Critical problems
 
Qualifications / Experience:
?             10+ years’ experience in a production IT environment managing enterprise IT infrastructure, hardware, hosting services and cloud infrastructure.
?             Minimum 10 years’ experience engineering, building, and supporting a global heterogeneous multi-data center computing environment of at least 1000 servers
?             A holistic understanding of IT infrastructure inclusive of server, storage, network, virtualization, database, DR/business recovery and continuity practices, etc.
?             A foundational understanding of public cloud models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and providers (AWS, Azure, Google)
?             Demonstrated experience leading complex infrastructure projects such as Infrastructure currency, Application and data center consolidation, Identity Management and O365 migrations (Mail, Lync, One Drive, SharePoint)
?             Proven ability to facilitate the gathering and translation of business requirements into quality infrastructure solutions, reflecting security, scalability, availability, performance, manageability constructs
?             Demonstrated expertise driving operational improvement and excellence under an ITIL based service management model.
?             Proven ability to influence and interact effectively with peers and IT leaders
?             Strong crisis management
 
Leadership Skills:
?             Professional, big picture thinker, accountable, committed and well respected by team; can contributes significantly to Mission, Vision and Strategy of the organization; shows strong alignment of work and priorities to vision and strategy; exhibits excellent financial controllership.
?             Exhibits a wide breath of technical, operational and team leadership skills; excellent command and control; develops strong talent through good situational management skills; possesses a passion for excellence; consistently strives for excellence and stretches both self and team; well organized and structured.
?             Creative and innovative; challenges mediocrity, status quo; establishes aggressive but obtainable goals; forward thinker and capable of contributing to the development of roadmaps aligned with organizational vision & strategy; methodical and very process focused.
?             Consistently achieves quality results on a timely basis; challenges and pushes his team; high “Say-Do” factor (i.e. delivers on commitments); superior follow through.
Thanks & Regards

title: Space Data Management Project Manager I (S3)*
description:
Space Data Management Project Manager
  Peterson AFB, Colorado Springs, CO
The Space Domain Awareness Division (USSF SMC/SPG) executes system acquisition, modernization, and sustainment for ground- and space-based Space Domain Awareness (SDA) sensors and command and control (C2) systems. Activities include acquisition program management, system and subsystem engineering, maintenance and supply support, and fielding.
Odyssey Systems provides support to the Government in five areas: Product Support, Sustainment Engineering & Sustainment Management, Technical Order Management, Technical User Interface, and System Design, Engineering and Integration.  These tasks are executed laterally with USSF SMC/SPG depot and development contractors and with SDA stakeholders.
Odyssey Systems is an innovative small business committed to providing world class technical, management, and training support services to government and public sector clients. We focus on people, processes, and performance to deliver superior results. Since our inception in 1997, our commitment to mission success and customer satisfaction has been recognized with exponential growth and exceptional past performance ratings. We accept challenging assignments and drive projects from the planning stages, through implementation, and into operations and support.
The Space Data Management Project Manager provides software engineering and data management support in the acquisition, design, and development of software and system capabilities for the sustainment of USSF data enterprise requirements and supports the Government during planning, design, and implementation of system modifications and upgrades required to address current and emerging threats.
Project Managers are responsible for the technical management of project-level cost, schedule, and performance at contractor or customer locations.  Program Managers direct the efforts of administrative and professional staff in carrying out the tasks necessary to meet program milestones.   Project Managers manage resources to accomplish the tasks necessary to complete the project, or function, on time and within the specified cost parameters.  Project Managers identify potential risks which might disrupt or delay performance or increase costs, develop and implement sound risk mitigation strategies, and monitor overall risk levels.  Project Managers communicate orally and in writing with the Lead Space Data Management Program Manager, preparing and delivering high quality oral presentations and briefings and clear, concise and accurate written reports.  Project Managers participate in various performance improvement programs and initiatives consistent with the customer’s objectives.
The Space Data Management Project Manager provides support for project management, data integration, systems/sustaining engineering, and implementation of complex space data systems.  Duties include, but are not limited to:
This position is located in Colorado Springs, CO.  Work is performed at Peterson Air Force Base with up to 25% travel.

title: Configuration Manager
description:
Our client is in need of a Configuration Manager for a contract-to-hire opportunity in Fort Collins, CO.
LRS Consulting Services has been delivering the highest quality consultants to our clients since 1979. We've built a solid reputation for dealing with our clients and our consultants with honesty, integrity, and respect. We work hard every day to maintain that reputation, and we're very interested in candidates who can help us. If you're that candidate, this opportunity is made for you!
Day to Day responsibilities include:
The successful candidate will be part of an operations team responsible for ensuring that custom-developed enterprise web applications and commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products are successfully deployed and properly managed in an enterprise web environment.
Apply Configuration Management (CM) methodologies during the software lifecycle from initial requirements to system end-of-life.
Coordinates Application Configuration Management activities among program staff.
Able to suggest application best practices for incorporating configuration in .Net Framework and .Net Core applications.
Develops and implements processes to support functional testing feature validation across multiple environments.
Develop and modify CM plans, policies, and procedures tailored to the complexity and scope of the developmental or operational system.
Execute the CM process which includes operating the defined and agreed process, ensuring it interfaces with all other relevant processes, reviewing the effectiveness and efficiency of the process, performing process audits and managing the process improvement cycle.
Use and recommend automated CM tools to implement CM policies and procedures.
Participate and lead continuous improvement for Configuration Management.
Qualifications:
Experience developing and implementing Configuration Management principles, processes, and training in the areas of configuration identification, control, data management (to include library/repository management), product release and delivery, and configuration audits.
Experience with .Net or IIS applications
Experience with a CM System (change management, source control, data management, etc.).
Experience collaborating across the Program Management Office to proactively manage CM risks, opportunities, and overall deliverables.
Familiar with SQL and/or noSQL data models
Experience with multi-environment application and data Software Development Lift Cycle (SDLC)
Experience with Agile DevOps principles, tools, and practices.
-Corp to corp candidates will not be considered
-Candidate must be able to effectively communicate in English (written & verbal)
To apply go to jobs.lrs.com.

title: IT Project Manager/Site Lead
description:
Project Manager Level-III shall assist in all areas of IM/IT Program and Project Management. This includes all related projects and associated work efforts – individual project schedules, milestones, deliverables and related requirements.  Weekly updates required on each of the assigned activities, build project plans utilizing the Program Management Book of Knowledge (PMBOK) and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) methodologies, report on milestones as appropriate, report whether resources are being allocated correctly, complete risk assessments and work forecasts, and ensure all tasks and deliverables are being met. Employee shall be required to manage, coordinate, facilitate, oversee, and track initiatives and projects with varying timelines and scopes using PM techniques for risk assessment and abatement and Program Knowledge Management (PKM). The employee shall provide recommendations for software and/or hardware based on technical requirements and will provide updated documentation through Standard Operating Procedures which will be approved by the designated government representative.  Additional task as Site Lead representing the Contractor company to the Government and providing oversight/management to 13 other IT professionals on contract.
Proven project management experience in a broad, multi-organizational environment. Personnel will have CompTIA Project+ or PMI’s Project Management Professional certification. Minimum of 5 years’ experience in IM/IT clinical environment with impact to clinical systems.
Must be able to pass a standard government background investigation consisting of a National Agency Check with Inquiries (NACI) or an equivalent or higher investigation.

:

title: Database Manager - Entry to Experienced Level
description:
NSA is in search of Computer Science professionals to solve complex problems, test innovative approaches and research new solutions to storing, manipulating, and presenting information. We are looking for you to apply your computer science expertise to projects that seek to create new standards for the transformation of information. If you want to develop technologies and tools and be a part of cutting edge innovations; join our team of experts! Help protect national security interests as part of the world's most advanced team of computer science professionals!
NSA is in search of Computer Science professionals to solve complex problems, test innovative approaches and research new solutions to storing, manipulating, and presenting information. We are looking for you to apply your computer science expertise to projects that seek to create new standards for the transformation of information. If you want to develop technologies and tools and be a part of cutting edge innovations; join our team of experts! Help protect national security interests as part of the world's most advanced team of computer science professionals!
NSA Overview
The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation.  The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense.  The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes.  The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. The need to maintain our core Computer Science group is vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. 
Description of Position
Database Managers at the NSA design, develop, test, and deliver database systems. They manage life cycle support of database systems. Typical tasks include applying patches and upgrades, diagnosing and resolving problems, monitoring and improving performance. Database Managers at the NSA migrate data from legacy systems to modern systems and design and manage backup and recovery processes and continuity of operations plans. 
Database Managers select appropriate database technologies for specific requirements, such as online transaction processing systems (OLTP), decision support systems (DSS), data warehouses, object-oriented or other non-relational data stores, real-time systems, and mass storage systems. They acquire data, coordinate data flow, and promote data quality.
The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS).  All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.
To apply for this position, please click the 'Apply' button located at the top right of this posting. After completing the application for the first time, or reviewing previously entered information, and clicking the 'Submit' button, you will receive a confirmation email. Please ensure your spam filters are configured to accept emails from noreply@intelligencecareers.gov. 
***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph. 
This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.
Please note that you may be asked a series of questions depending on the position you apply for. Your responses will be used as part of the screening process of your application and will assist in determining your eligibility for the position. Be sure to elaborate on experiences in your resume. Failure to provide the required information or providing inaccurate information will result in your application not being considered for this position. Only those applicants who meet the qualifications for the position will be contacted to begin employment processing. 
Please Note: Job Posting could close earlier than the closing date due to sufficient number of applicants or position no longer available. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
On-the job training, Internal NSA courses, and external training will be made available based on the need and experience of the selectee.
Monday - Friday, with basic 8hr/day work requirements between 0600 and 1800 (flexible).  
Applicants should be aware that some of these jobs support 24/7 operations on 12 hour rotating shifts, based on mission requirements. Shift schedules may vary to include night shift.
The ideal candidate is someone with a desire for experiential learning and strong problem-solving, analytic and interpersonal skills who is:
-	willing to take the initiative 
-	innovative
-	able to work effectively across several different functional areas in a collaborative environment
-	able to communicate effectively (both orally and written)
-	well-organized and able to handle multiple assignments

title: Configuration Manager
description:
Credence Management Solutions, LLC (Credence) is seeking a Configuration Manager at the Journeyman level to support our
U-2 Intelligence, Surveillance, Reconnaissance/ Special Operations Forces (U-2 ISR/SOF). The U-2 Branch (AFLCMC/HBGA) is comprised of Government civilian, military, and Contractor personnel which support three Sections: Airframe, Sensors and Systems, of which multiple IPT's provide full sustainment of cradle-to-grave support to the U-2 program.
The U-2 aircraft delivers high-altitude, all-weather surveillance and reconnaissance, day or night, in direct support of U.S. and allied forces. It delivers critical imagery and signals intelligence to decision makers throughout all phases of conflict, including peacetime indications and warnings, low-intensity conflict, and large-scale hostilities.
The Configuration Manager will
provide Configuration Management, Quality Assurance, Program/Project, Requirements Analysis, Risk Management, and Software Engineering support services in accordance with the program’s Configuration Management Plan, AF System Engineering Assessment Model (SEAM) Configuration Management (CM) processes, program development/sustainment contracts, and PMO practices. Support activities will range across the CM, Quality Assurance (QA), PP, RA, RM, and SE activities.
Activities will vary depending upon the current activities of the program/system, scope of the current development/sustainment cycle, and other corporate and program initiatives. Contractor personnel must have progressive experience in managing configuration of software, engineering documents, design drawings, engineering changes and notices, and planning/conducting design audits to enable Government ownership of the program technical baseline.

to ensure projects progress on schedule and within budget.
plans and monitor the progress status of teams and individual members.
and strategic initiatives.

change management processes; and established standards for risk management.

Ability to: comprehend, analyze, and interpret organizational and procedural problems and recommend solutions; comprehend and use new technology; establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders; prepare and present reports clearly and concisely in both oral and written form; facilitate communication within teams and extended project teams; provide leadership, motivation, and mentoring to project team members; coordinate actions of team members and resolve conflicts; and obtain and maintain project commitment from team members and stakeholders.

title: Manager, Applications Development, Data & Analytics
description:
At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. Manager, Applications Development, Data & Analytics will work closely with multiple teams across Business and IT to deliver enterprise data architecture to achieve enterprise strategic goals for data governance and data analytics, as well as provide support to the functions of the Data Governance Office. 
#LI-JS1
 Our employees are collaborative, self-aware, and ethical. It is our expectation to do the right thing and follow through on commitments.

If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!
 
Delta Dental covers more Americans than any other dental benefits provider. Our Enterprise Strategy focuses on pillars of Growth and Diversification, supported by the platforms of Culture and People, Process and Technology. Our employees take pride working for a purpose-driven organization and live our values of Trust, Service, Excellence and Innovation.

title: Digital Content Manager - Technical Training
description:
At Dräger, it is our passion and dedication to protect, support and save lives. Our dedication to life naturally extends to the quality of our employees’ lives. They are the essence of our company, and without them, we would not be what we are today – a world leader in medical and safety technology.  We are searching for people who want to join us in building “Technology for Life”.
You will act as primary point of contact for the development of all technical E-Learning, Digital Media (Video, Modules, Webinars, Podcasts) within Technical Training Department. Manage all aspects of digital content creation from conception to delivery, assessments and updates. Collaborate with product Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) to define scope, length and level of content for wide array of technical learners in a dynamic multi-modality group, and with Technical Instructors to advise on a proposed blended learning approach to Draeger’s current technical training offerings. Support and develop the existing refresher training program and other efforts to augment and increase the viability of distance learning with technical training in both Safety and Medical business divisions. 
Research and develop digital (E-Learning, Videos, Webinars, Podcasts) seminar content from technical documentation, information provided from company directives and through consultation with R & D and product experts. Development is conducted in compliance with DI SOP/WI’s and in line with the accrediting agencies standards and guidelines (if applicable).
Review service documentation releases from BU’s / Competency Center and incorporate information and the practical application into the seminar content as deemed necessary.
With a professional attitude and appearance, and a high level of motivation and initiative, closely collaborate with technical training staff to allow for proper scope and depth of service related digital content.
Identify different learning needs of the targeted participants and adjust to the appropriate digital venue (E-Learning, Video, Webinar, Podcast) to support the desired outcome as required.
Facilitate the development of support system digital training outside the product silos with other personnel including Field Service, Back Office Administration, Technical Support, Customer Support and BU Engineering through whichever means available and deemed appropriate by Supplemental Learning program.
Assist instructional staff with the development and implementation of Web Based Training Modules for use as augmentation of existing ILT engagements.
Serve as regional Digital Learning expert and will provide guidance on how to approach E-Learning as a solution to the customer or internal candidates. Integrate with Global Academy to leverage existing LMS as a means to provide E-Learning content to the North American region. 
Performs other duties as needed and assigned.
Bachelors’ degree in E-Learning, Digital Media Development or the equivalent in education, training and experience; Master’s preferred.
Minimum of 5 years working in a professional environment with a focus on either manufacturing or service related organization. E-Learning module development using relevant software and practices in a corporate or academic setting (portfolio or examples of work would be ideal).
Proven technical skill with developing online digital content of various venues.
Demonstrates aptitude for learning new technologies and/or working with others.

title: Incident Manager
description:
Mindtree [NSE: MINDTREE] is a global technology consulting and services company, helping enterprises marry scale with agility to achieve competitive advantage. “Born digital,” in 1999 and now a Larsen & Toubro Group Company, Mindtree applies its deep domain knowledge to 300+ enterprise client engagements to break down silos, make sense of digital complexity and bring new initiatives to market faster. We enable IT to move at the speed of business, leveraging emerging technologies and the efficiencies of Continuous Delivery to spur business innovation. Operating in 18 countries and over 40 offices across the world, we’re consistently regarded as one of the best places to work, embodied every day by our winning culture made up of over 21,000 entrepreneurial, collaborative and dedicated “Mindtree Minds.”
 
Should have had operational exposure to technologies from an infrastructure and application standpoint
Operational knowledge of servers, storage, databases, virtualization and networking technologies on the infrastructure side with an exposure to ECOMMERCE and retail applications would be strongly preferred

Investigating and escalating any and all alerts or warnings within the monitoring and alerting toolset
Comfortable with starting and stopping applications or application components upon direction and approval from authorized personnel

align incidents with technology
Should have sound knowledge in ITIL, service operations and service transition modules from an incident management and change management perspective
Must have had the experience of leading, tracking and managing bridge calls for P1 and P2 INCs cutting across technologies
Must have excellent stakeholder management skills with exemplary verbal and written communication skills in parallel
Record details of issues, and as necessary, escalate appropriately to support groups & defined levels of management
Oversee a written turnover log and handoff of shift events
Work on projects as assigned by Operations Management
Communicate and effectively work with vendors
Support IT Operations management in the deployment, design, and general efforts of ITIL processes across the enterprise and under close supervision of the IT Operations leadership team
Act as a critical incident manager during critical incidents with an ability to learn and understand network, application, and infrastructure topographical schematics and leverage this data to identify collateral impacts and resolving teams.
Identify and record gaps in process and/ or Runbook and report such gaps to IT Operations leadership
Willing to work in a 24/7/365 environment and adapt to a fluctuating schedule as workload demands arise

title: Technical Java Project manager
description:
Irving, TX
Direct hire consulting opportunity
Full time work week
**No C2C for this role
We are looking for candidates that share our passion for tackling complexity head-on, to help build platforms that can scale through multiple orders of magnitude. As a Technical Project Manager, you will play a key role within engineering, driving huge projects that span the organization. You contribute to the technical strategy, design choices, and decisions for a product or service. You are accountable for the planning, execution, and delivery of projects from inception to completion, related to an existing technology product or project. You proactively manage the end-to-end delivery of engineering work through the engineering organization and all dependent organizations, reporting out progress, ensuring dependencies are covered. You operate between teams and architectures overseeing the gaps between teams, processes, and systems, while removing all blocking issues leading to a successful delivery. You should be comfortable with ambiguity with a desire to create, iterate and improve.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate your technical chops, while defining and driving project initiatives and using your technical knowledge to work with the engineering teams to deliver. Thinking strategically and tactically along with being innovative, an exemplary leader, an excellent communicator, influencer, and working with a premier team will help you be successful in the role. Leading and navigating cross-functional efforts should come naturally, along with having tried and true experience partnering with marketing and engineering teams to synthesize a variety of technologies and capabilities into high quality simple products and features that customers love. You will need to be a smart risk taker, who can deliver big ideas as well as transform them into scalable projects. This position has exposure to senior members of the organization, where you would be preparing documentation for senior executives and align roadmaps with organizational objectives.

title: Database Administration Manager
description:
Database Administration Manager
 
The Manager of Database Administration is a member of the Enterprise Data Services team and reports to the Director of that unit. The position has responsibility for directing the efforts of the database administrators within that group. Responsibilities include oversight and administration of the Universities database platforms both on premise and in the cloud.
Details of responsibility include but are not limited to knowledge and expertise with Oracle, MySQL, MSSQL, and relational database concepts as well as Cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure or GCP. The manager should have sufficient expertise to be an effective owner of tasks related to the integration of local, cloud or hosted services (PaaS, IaaS), monitoring, analysis, security and application tools. This person is responsible for identifying security vulnerabilities and must understand how to communicate effectively to the team in order to remediate any threats. The Manager must be able to produce clear documentation of the systems being managed for all levels of leadership (peer through executive).
Security of data is the most critical aspect of this position, thus the candidate must be well versed in database security measures, literature and other sources for information regarding securing data.
This position is integral to the strategic planning and priority setting for the Division of Information Technology and the campus enterprise strategic initiatives. The manager oversees projects to successful completion, ensuring prompt customer service, staff management and staff skill development. The position includes responsibility for instituting the appropriate security controls, processes, and best practices to ensure compliance with State and University System audit requirements. The Manager must be able to communicate clearly both orally and in writing and must be a strong leader.

description:
In exchange for your expertise, we offer a competitive salary along with a comprehensive benefit package of health, dental, vision, STD, LTD, AD&D, life and 401k with match.
Amphenol Advanced Sensors, with its portfolio of industry-leading brands - Thermometrics, NovaSensor, Telaire, Protimeter and Kaye - is an innovator in advanced sensing technologies and innovative embedded measurement solutions customized for regulatory and industry driven applications, creating value by providing critical information for real time data decisions.
We offer domain expertise, rapid customization, world-class manufacturing capability and lasting customer relationships - To deliver the greatest value in cost of ownership to their customers.
Amphenol Advanced Sensors is a member of the USA-based Amphenol Corporation. With our own global presence we offer our customers exceptional technical support and service in the areas of development, production and distribution.
Amphenol is one of the largest manufacturers of interconnect products in the world. The Company designs, manufactures and markets electrical, electronic and fiber optic connectors, coaxial and flat-ribbon cable, and interconnect systems.
The primary end markets for the Company's products are communications and information processing markets, including cable television, cellular telephone and data communication and information processing systems; aerospace and military electronics; and automotive, rail and other transportation and industrial applications.

title: Technical Program Manager - Cleantech / Greentech
description:
Skyrocket Ventures is a recruiting firm for hundreds of high growth technology companies that range from industry leaders to top-tier startups.  This opportunity is with one of our client companies for a full-time permanent hire.  Please only apply if you are authorized to work in the U.S.
Please note that even if this job is not a perfect match, we encourage you to apply as long as it is in the ballpark.  Companies are often flexible in hiring candidates who do not perfectly fit their written job description, as long as the most important qualifications are there and the candidate is good in general.
Most of the jobs we are recruiting for are not posted online, so if you would like to know of all the opportunities we have that match your interests and qualifications, then please get in touch with us.
Thank you!
Matthew Strassberg
Recruiting Director
Skyrocket Ventures
Feel free to check out testimonials from some of our many candidates/clients here:
This company is making a positive impact on the environment while also building a highly lucrative business.
The company's product is in the realms of Robotics, AI, Industrial Automation, Cleantech/Greentech, and Sustainability.
The company's team and revenues are rapidly growing.
The company will pay competitive salary, plus equity which could be very lucrative.
- Working as an Engineering Program Manager for about 25 engineers (which at any given time could be split into 1 to 9 different teams). The size of the engineering organization is expected to double in size every year.
- Doing both software and hardware program management. About 60% of the work will be on the hardware team, and 40% on the software team.
- Working across the organization to help everyone move in the same direction, remove blockages, stay on schedule and meet timelines.
- Scoping the work and coming up with the work plan of how to accomplish objectives.
- Holding weekly meetings to drive the execution of projects.
- Using project management software such as Asana or similar.
- Communicating with everyone all the time.
- Managing risk constantly by foreseeing risks, coming up with plans to mitigate risks and working with teams to do that.
- Within 1 year you could have 1-2 ppl working under you who are engineering program managers or project managers, depending on how you want to build out your team.
- At least 5 years (preferably 7-15 years) as an Engineering / Technical Program Manager.
- Experience as a Program Manager for a 10+ person engineering team.
- Experience working as a Program Manager for a hardware + software product (even if it was just for the hardware or the software side of the product). Given a choice, experience on the hardware side is slightly preferred over experience on the software side.
- Understanding of all the integration points between hardware and software.
- Exceptional communication, with a great ability to form and maintain relationships.
- Skill in conflict resolution, working well with different kinds of personalities, and bringing everyone together.
- Experience as an engineer or engineering leader prior to becoming a Program Manager.
- Experience with both software and hardware engineering program management.
- Experience having done program management for a large scale product.
- Experience as a Program Manager for a 25+ person engineering team.
- Experience as a Program Manager at a startup.
- Experience as a Program Manager for well known products at a large tech company.

title: Agile Project Manager
description:
The Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) requires the assistance of a contract resource to serve as an Agile Project Manager for the North Carolina NCFAST Program to support the development and implementation of North Carolina Families Accessing Services through Technology (NC FAST) projects.
 
This Agile Project Manager must be very well organized and able to manage multiple technical, business, test and training teams. The Project Manager is responsible for managing project timelines, resources, quality and risk; including, milestone planning and reporting, project budget tracking, budget analysis, project staffing, status reporting, change requests, and other basic project administration activities. Project duties include requirements gathering, guiding internal customers through the project life cycle, and supporting go-live and post-implementation support.
 
The position requires a strong blend of Project Management business analysis and technical experience and the ability to work well in a team environment, as well as skills to facilitate communication, team focus, influence, service oriented, problem solving, analytic thinking, planning, personal development and decisiveness. Using these attributes, the candidate will communicate individual roles and project/program expectations for both internal and external teams, develop detailed project plans and schedules, provide work direction and leadership to assigned projects or programs including sub projects and at times, individual project members; including scheduling, assignment of work and review of project efforts.
 
This position also monitors and audits project or program milestones and critical dates to identify potential jeopardy of project schedule and identifies ways to resolve schedule issues, provides required project status reporting, assesses variances from the project plan, gathers metrics, and develops and implements changes as necessary to ensure that the project remains within specified scope and is within time, cost, and quality objectives.

title: Sr Product Manager, Technical
description:
This Role is responsible for the full product lifecycle for SyncUP PETS, with extra focus on the iOS and Android Mobile Apps. Ongoing research, roadmap iteration, and delivery, with support from software dev and hardware teams.
Job Summary:
Senior Product Manager, Technical is a visionary, strategist, analyst, customer evangelist, respected leader of business and technology execution, and professional relationship builder all rolled into a single dynamic package. At a high level this means identifying the intersection of customer problems/unmet needs (an opportunity), technical feasibility, business objectives, securing funding, and leading a cross-functional business and technical team, as well as key stakeholders to deliver against the opportunity (all via influence).
The ultimate "jack (or jill)-of-all-trades," this role leverages deep customer empathy, strategic thinking, commercial, analytical, technical capability and knowledge, and leadership prowess to successfully deliver delightful and differentiated products that drive growth and positively impact customers lives.
No day is the same for this role. Day to day activities or responsibilities include: conducting market research; writing features or user stories; determining specifications; defining long-term strategy of the product; creating the product road map; driving technical delivery end to end; defining scope for releases/product increments; partnering with development, project/program management, marketing, and other key stakeholders to define release schedule; and support/drive go-to-market activities as needed.

title: Document Configuration Manager
description:
:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Architecture or related field.   Minimum of eight (8) years of ‘hands on' experience in development and review of construction documents (construction specifications, drawings and technical documentation) which should include four (4) years of supervision.
Or, an equivalent combination of post high school education and a minimum of twelve (12) years of ‘hands on' experience in development and review of construction documents (construction specifications, drawings and technical documentation) which should include four (4) years of supervision.
          
        
Possession of or ability to acquire CSI, Master Specification or similar certification for specification and technical writing within one year of hire.
A District of Columbia, Maryland or Virginia motor vehicle operator’s license issued from jurisdiction of residence preferred.
          
        
Ability to satisfactorily complete the medical examination for this position.  Must be able to perform the essential functions of this job either with or without reasonable accommodation(s).
          
          
        
Under general supervision of the Deputy Chief Engineer, this position reviews, evaluates and screens drawings, reports, specifications and design criteria for incorporation into WMATA official document repository.  Incumbent controls, distributes and maintains configuration of these documents in accordance with established Policies, Instructions and Procedures. 
Manages Specification Writers, CAD Technicians and Consultants to develop and maintain all technical records, criteria, specifications, standard drawings for the facilities and systems controlled by the Chief Engineer and the Deputy Chiefs. 
Prepares guide and standard specifications, coordinating these internally and with external agencies, making amendments as needed to ensure that they meet Jurisdictional requirements and WMATA policy.
Manages development and maintenance of all design drawings, standard drawings, and As-Built & As-Is drawings in accordance with the CAD and BIM Manuals.  Archives the As-Built drawings delivered by contractors and edits as required by discipline manager to reflect the As-Is condition of the facilities and systems. 
Manages the storage of all contract documents, drawings, manuals and other materials in a manner that is traceable, easily retrievable and available to all authorized staff. 
Maintains access rights and responsibilities to the records to ensure necessary documents for project implementation are available to WMATA project staff. 
Reviews specifications, drawings and other technical documents prepared for specific contracts by Section Design Builders (D/B's), On-Call consultants, Contractors for conformance with published manuals, procedures and recommends acceptance for storage in WMATA repository.
Compiles specifications for special projects designed by WMATA Staff.
Prepares and disseminates instructional manuals for use by D/B's in preparing and amending specifications as needed.
The above duties are general and not intended to determine specific duties of the position. They are not intended to limit in any way the right of supervisors to assign, direct and control the work of employees under his or her supervision.
          
        
Consideration will be given to applicants whose resumes demonstrate the required education and experience. Applicants should include all relevant education and work experience.
Evaluation criteria may include one or more of the following:
          
:

title: Lead Cybersecurity Operations Engineer
description:
Lead Cybersecurity Operations Engineer       -       INF001381      
The U.S. Cellular Security Operations team is responsible for operational management of all Security tools, executing the Security Incident Response process for any alerts or events found within their tools set or from additional sources as well as identifying and scoring risk related to the Enterprise. Supports the strategic and tactical deployment of security tools and initiatives that safeguards the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the enterprise infrastructure and information assets across US Cellular. The scope of the position involves proactively identifying and recommending and leading in the implementation and continuous support of key security technologies.           
The Lead Cybersecurity Operations Engineer is responsible for providing technical security domain expertise and project leadership for maintaining and configuring key security tool such as Web Application Firewalls, WIPS, DLP, File Integrity monitor, Firewall Rule Auditor, Forensics Tools, Vulnerability Scanning Tools, Key Encryption as well as other security devices and operations.

title: Technology Construction Manager
description:
This position is responsible for the IT design and construction of Office Move activities for the firm. The successful candidate will be expected to coordinate efforts of subcontractors and or employees to complete specific work tasks in a project-based environment. The Technology Construction Managers main role is to ensure a timely IT office build-out to meet customer expectations and manage timelines of specific work packages in line with the project goals.
 
REQUIRED SKILLS
 
Minimum of 5 years recent experience providing hands-on Technology Construction project management, matrix managing both internal staff and external vendor contract teams
Minimum of 5 years recent experience performing Project Management for Real Estate technology, including designing and building out new offices and moving office locations, office connectivity, networking, hardware procurement and installation with aggressive delivery goals
Minimum of 5 years of direct experience directing and managing wired and wireless construction or project builds
Demonstrated attention to quality construction practices and ensuring timely close out and delivery of the project schedule
 Prior use of JIRA software for project and task management is a plus
Understanding the project scope and capabilities and sourcing appropriate local vendors
Strong time management and construction quality and safety experience
Exceptional composition, verbal, presentation, and interpersonal skills
Multi-tasker with ability to successfully manage numerous projects and tasks concurrently
Solution-oriented with strong leadership skills and a passion for excellence
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in a Computer Science or related field
Prior industry experience in Professional Services/Management Consulting, Construction or Law firms a plus
RESPONSIBILITIES
 
Conduct on-site real estate/construction site assessments for requirements gathering at beginning of a project
Perform on-site hands-on office technology build-outs including LAN/IDF room build and desktop installations
Directly responsible for the overall success of IT construction projects.  Must have the ability to forecast construction start and completion dates, understand dependencies and identify issues that will cause delays.    Candidate will report issues or challenges to the supervisor and propose solutions to keep projects on track
Design and implementation services for wide area network/carriers, Wi-Fi, LAN, data center, electric, low voltage cabling, A/V, video conferencing, desktops, printers/copiers, IDF closet buildouts, voice/phones, HVAC, office space/furniture, office security, hoteling, and other technology related construction activities
Collaborate with vendors working in the new space, including architects, security, low voltage, cabling, hoteling, furniture installers, and property management
Coordinate and/or perform technical aspects of building out new offices or moving office locations, including office connectivity, networking, hardware procurement and installation of servers, desktops, phones and printers
Create third party RFPs, Statements of Work, while adhering to in-house standards for product/vendor evaluation and selection
Cross team management with other departments and entities will be needed to ensure the timely build schedule
Provide on-site report to office personnel during and after the move
Maintain a safe environment and ensure all safety standards are met
Approximately 60-70% domestic travel required

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
ECS is seeking a
to work in our 
office.
 ECS is seeking a Technical Project Manager to support the development and integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) into autonomous aerial vehicle prototypes for the Joint Artificial Intelligence Center.
 We are a rapidly growing company that considers our employees to be our most important asset. People truly are number one at ECS. We are situated in Fairfax, VA -- well positioned for most commutes in the Northern Virginia area. Our newly renovated office spaces are first class and provide an inspirational environment.  We offer opportunities for telework and have some of the most interesting advanced IT business in the DC area. ECS has extraordinary customers who are thought and action leaders in the AI/ML field. We offer highly competitive compensation and benefits to the right person for this key position.
 ECS is seeking a technically skilled Technical Project Manager to manage and provide direction for a research and development Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) and autonomous unmanned aerial system project supporting the Joint Artificial Intelligence Center (JAIC). This project will entail the supervision of a complex environment of subcontract developers, Government partners, and customers working together to develop, test, and deliver a multi-sensor fusion & AI-processing software at the edge aboard a UAS. This role will entail the management of the creation of the DoD's first high fidelity enterprise modeling and simulation environment for autonomous single and multi-platform UAS's. The candidate will work closely with stakeholders to include the DoD and its partners, commercial AI vendors, and traditional federal contractors to translate customer requirements into formal agreements and plans that meet the customer's mission needs. The candidate will work with the customer to identify their objectives and develop a proposed solution. The candidate will lead a highly technical team in initiating, planning, controlling, and executing initiatives in support of sensitive and critical Joint Artificial Intelligence Center priorities.
ECS is a leading mid-sized provider of technology services to the United States Federal Government. We are focused on people, values and purpose. Every day, our 3000+ employees focus on providing their technical talent to support the Federal Agencies and Departments of the US Government to serve, protect and defend the American People.

title: Technology Project Manager
description:
:
The Technology Project Manager manages technology projects sponsored by Hampton Roads Transit (HRT) The position will provide technical leadership and guidance on Technology projects that may involve multiple partners including HRT staff, local planning agencies, industry partners and vendors. The selected candidate will complete project deliverables and submit proposals for current and future technology projects.
:
Duties listed are not intended to be all inclusive nor to limit duties that might reasonably be assigned:
• Make professional decisions and recommendations and provide technical and policy support to HRT.
• Supervise and coordinate activities of professional, technical and maintenance personnel engaged in managing, planning, modifying, repairing, and installing components of Intelligent Transportation Systems.
• Responsible for the successful execution and delivery of the current and future Technology projects.
• Work closely with the system/application owner and Technology owner with specific focus on managing expectations.
• Act as a liaison between the Technology department and other departments within HRT.
• Demonstrate ability in the creation of functional and technical specification documentation and RFPs.
• Gather requirements, create project plans and track project progress; adjust plan as needed and takes appropriate corrective action to address plan variances.
• Oversee the completion of Technology projects ensuring project disciplines are followed, the appropriate resources participate, review, or approve deliverables, appropriate sign-off is received and the project expectations are met.
• Provide leadership and mentoring to project team members, provide feedback to functional managers on staff, as appropriate.
• Provide technical expertise for Technology projects and applications at the agency.
• Provide expert advice, guidance, and recommendations to executive management on ITS technology.
• Represent HRT at external professional committees and groups.
 
• Develop and provide oversight of technical documents (plans, contracts, specifications, estimates, reports, assessments).
• Demonstrate leadership and consensus-building skills.
• Perform System Administration of ITS applications as needed.
• Manage records created and received in compliance with the Hampton Roads Transit Records Management Policy and Procedures.
• Responsible for maintaining a general awareness of HRT’s EMS
• Responsible for handling all related job responsibilities in accordance to HRT’s Environmental Policy, relevant EMS Standard Operating Procedures, and Emergency Management Plan
:
• Possess knowledge and progressively responsible experience with Technology Project Management; PMP or related certification desirable.
• Working knowledge of transit, Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS), traffic engineering, telecommunications, electronic/electrical devices, and infrastructure design.
• Ability to effectively convey information and work well in a structured environment.
• Ability to communicate effectively with different levels of management and within the business administrative, maintenance, functional and technical communities.
• Good critical and analytical thinking.
• Ability to troubleshoot and solve problems quickly and completely.
• Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and meet multiple deadlines.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Project Manager, IT
description:
Technology Partners is currently seeking a talented Project Manager, IT (141557). Do you have experience with IT Project Management? Let us help you make your next big career move a reality!




You will have in-depth knowledge in job discipline and basic knowledge in related disciplines. You will work independently to solve complex problems. You will also lead and has accountability for projects and provides informal leadership to less experienced colleagues. You will independently define and manage the scope and schedule of medium to large projects, ensuring projects are delivered on time and within budget. You will develop request for proposals, searches and selects appropriate and reviews vendor contracts. You will actively work with demand planning group to implement demand planning process; have deep understanding of the process for the PMO organization. You will manage project budget of medium to large projects, review and approve invoices. You will develop project cash flows, revise project budgets and forecasts as needed. You will also manage and ensure quality of medium risk/impact projects (e.G., coordinating meetings, tracking budget, following up on action items) using Waterfall project management methods. You will champion the Project Management Office (PMO) methodology and participates in methodology refresh and enhancement opportunities. You will help with logistics, problem solve and tweak processes to drive team velocity and ensure full team engagement. You will facilitate getting the work down by removing impediments by finding the right resources. You will also support determination of which project management methodology to use. You will also support customers change control process and can implement project changes. You will influence teams and stakeholders to achieve project objectives; communicate how the project drives value for the business. You will also manage stakeholder relationships to establish project expectations and priorities. You will coordinate and report on project progress and accomplishments to the project team, stakeholders, and sponsors. You will identify change approach, strategy and plan; prepare and manage all aspects of impact of project change on each stakeholder group; create change management plan and manages change throughout the life of the project; consult with change leader as needed.








If this position sounds like you, 




We realize our people are our most valuable asset, that is why we offer the following benefits:




Your better future is ready, and we want to put the right tools in your hands to get you there. Let's go!


 PMP, Change Management

-    Receive, review, log, file and distribute all incoming contractor submittals.

-    Create and continuously update separate distribution lists for each program.

-    Maintain numerous document logs, set up, oversee and maintain an extensive contractor CDRL submittal file system on SharePoint.

-    Work closely on a daily basis with Configuration Management, Contracting, Division Chiefs, program PMs and IPT members.

-    Create and oversee the ‘Document Control’ files on SharePoint, continuously archiving older files while making sure all current, working documentation is the most current and proper version.

-    Create, review, format, correct, finalize and process a multitude of documents: SOWs, Specs, PWSs, SOOs, CDRL packages, Test Reports, QA Reports, Siting Criteria, Test Plans and Procedures, Trip Reports, and Gov’t letters.

-    Must be able to conduct/Support Configuration Control Boards.

-    Must be able to generate DD1423 forms for Contract Data requirement Lists.

-    Must maintain a Data Item Description (DID) library/situational awareness of Govt Changes to DIDs for reference to generate CDRLs noted above.

 

Required Skills:

-    BA/BS degree, and 7 years of experience in the respective technical/professional discipline being performed, 3 of which must be in the DoD.

-    Must have current knowledge of iPDM software or have the ability to learn how to us and assist in the configuration of the file structure within.

-    Must have hands on Data and Configuration Management experience in a DOD Program office environment

-    Demonstrated characteristics of a self-starter who is able to work independently and effectively interact with program team members and senior leadership.

-    Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work as part of a multi-disciplined team.

-    Adept at engaging peers, management, and contractors to resolve discrepancies.

-    Must have an active US security clearance.
