title: IT Assurance Manager - PCI, HITRUST, SOC
description:
If you are an IT Assurance Manager with 5+ years experience in Public Accounting or Corporate/Public Blend, please read on!

Based in Chicago, IL our client is is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. They are a leading Public Accounting Company in the LA Area that is currently expanding it's team. 



This position is working on their growing Chicago Technology team that is focused on delivering outstanding client service while integrating in a dynamic team environment.



As part of the growing Technology group, you will be part of a collaborative team with deep specialization. They use proactive approaches and innovative assurance technology to provide high quality risk and compliance cyber security services to their clients.



Please read on for more details!
This is a fast-paced environment with a high learning curve, so we provide many resources and on-the-job training opportunities  if you are willing to learn and build your areas of expertise, you will succeed. You will be exposed to a variety of technologies in different environments and different industry standards and solutions including: Consulting and Assurance for PCI, HiTRUST, SOC and SOC for Cybersecurity.
Joining this Assurance practice as a Technical Manager is an opportunity to interact with client leadership, understand the IT environments that we are helping to transform by the way we do business today, and help provide assurance that controls are operating the way they should. You will be responsible for conducting the cybersecurity portions of our service offerings including PCI, HITRUST, SOC for Cybersecurity and SOC.

This position will perform and conduct hands-on cybersecurity focused work, as well as oversee the work of some junior level personnel. This position will work directly with other staff, senior managers, and/or executives to communicate business and technical aspects of the work being performed. The IT Assurance Manager will set performance expectations for junior level personnel and provide constructive performance feedback on a regular basis. This person may also assist the engagement economics of the projects, including budget status tracking, billing, and collection analysis.



As our Audit practice continues to focus on transformation, we are looking for innovative leaders who can help build tools and methodology to provide more efficient and effective ways to assess large networks with multiple operating systems.



- Planning, supervising staff, and executing IT Assurance engagements, Compliance Standard Assessments, and Consulting engagements as well as support business development efforts.

- Managing projects to ensure high quality delivery within the project budget and time-lines.

- Being hands-on in the delivery and execution of project tasks for complex technology environments.

- Having the ability to present and communicate status and issues to client senior management personnel. Setting performance expectations for senior staff and staff level.

- Participating in innovation sessions and tactical initiatives related to new product offerings and services.

- Developing and maintaining relationships with clients and identify new opportunities for business.

- Defining performance expectations for senior staff and staff level IT auditors and providing performance feedback.
More Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:

- BS in Cyber security, Information Systems, Computer Science, or similar discipline

- Minimum 4 years of experience in the areas of Information Security (experience in PCI and/or HITRUST a plus).

- Certified Information Systems Security Professionals (CISSP) or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) certification

- Experience within consulting or professional services, or at leading industry public companies is preferred.

- Prior experience supervising junior level resources in the areas of Information Security.

- Knowledge of networking technology.

- System and/or network administration experience on UNIX, Linux, and Microsoft Windows.

- Knowledge of security areas such as Auditing, Policy, Database Security, Firewall Design and Implementation, Risk Analysis, Identity Management, Access Management, or Web Services is very desirable.
We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package:
- Promotion Plan!

- Vacation/PTO

- Medical

- Dental

- Vision

- Relocation

- Bonus

- 401k
So, if you are a IT Assurance Manager with experience, please apply today!

title: Senior IT Project Manager
description:
Our client, a world leader in Pharmaceuticals and In-Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) tools, is seeking a 
 who will be responsible for assisting various and multiple IT projects, some of which will be large-scale in nature.
 
Reporting to the Head of the US PMO, the IT Project Manager is accountable for the   successful implementation of technical solutions via IT Project Management processes and methodologies for the IT function. Project management processes are designed to ensure IT projects are delivered on-time, within budget, adhere to high quality standards and meet customer expectations.  This position must effectively manage across global locations and time zones and be able to travel internationally, as needed.
 
• Ability to function as the leader of a virtual cross-functional team including external vendors
• Experience in project organization and resource mobilization, and management of stakeholders
• Experience dealing with stakeholder management issues on a global level (including multiple cultures)
• Experience in virtual, cross functional project team management
• Experience in Application Support / Services concepts
• Ability to work independently (i.e., minimal supervision) as the Project Manager  role
• Strong interactive and influencing skills
• Strong customer and service management focus
• Proven vendor management experience
• Proven Organizational Change Management experience
• Strong technical writing skills (project  documentation/deliverables)
• Excellent communication, organization and multi-tasking  skills
• Expertise with Project Management Methodology concepts (including waterfall and agile approaches)
• Proficiency in Google Mail and Calendar, Word, Excel, Visio, MS Project and   PowerPoint
• Strong understanding of Computer System Validation (CSV) concepts
• Understanding of Electronic Document Management System concepts
• Understanding of  IT Infrastructure concepts
• 8+ years of related experience implementing IT Projects
• PMP certification
• Certified Scrum  Master designation preferred
• Experience with the use of HP ALM (or other Application Lifecycle Management tools), Smartsheets and electronic document management tools is preferred
• Candidate must be able to travel domestically and internationally, if required. Travel will not exceed 30%.
 
 
Bachelor's degree in  Informatics,  Computer Science or equivalent
 
 
If you’re interested, please respond with your updated resume to 
 and the best time to reach you for the discussion.
 
Best Regards,
Dawar Consulting Inc.

title: IT Project Manager IV
description:
? Commission projects & mobilise project teams.
? Create detailed project plans and assign project resources.
? Manage day-to-day execution of projects. Manage delivery of agreed work products ensuring delivery to time, scope, cost & quality.
? Execute risk and issue management processes, analyse the overall project performance and initiate mitigating actions where required.
? Execute project close-down. Create final report (including lessons learnedManage transition plan into Operations.
? Effectively maintain the project scope through use of the agreed Change Control processes.
? Accountable for sprint & scrum planning and delivery ensuring the agile development team operates smoothly without any problems.
? Allow teams to self-organise and make changes quickly, in accordance with agile tools and techniques.
        
      
        
 - Identifies specific measures and mechanisms by which benefits can be measured, and plans to activate these mechanisms at the required time. Monitors benefits against what was predicted in the business case and ensures that all participants are informed and involved throughout the change programme and fully prepared to exploit the new operational business environment once it is in place. Supports operational managers to ensure all plans, work packages and deliverable are aligned to the expected benefits and leads activities required in the realization of the benefits of each part of the change programme.
? Change implementation planning and management - Ensures that there is a business perspective on how any new technical capabilities will be integrated into the business, including planning around key business cycles, selecting appropriate customers for migration, etc. Initiates the business implementation plan, including all the activities that the business needs to do to prepare for new technical components and technologies. Ensures sites deliver site implementation plans that align with the overall plan. Tracks and reports against these activities to ensure progress. Defines and manages the activities to ensure achievement of the projected business benefits after delivery. Outlines key business engagement messages that need to be communicated throughout the programme/project.
        
 - Oversees and measures the fulfillment of contractual obligations. Uses key performance indicators (KPIs) to monitor and challenge performance and identify opportunities for continuous improvement. Develops strategies to address under-performance and compliance failures, including application of contract terms. Identifies where changes are required, evaluates the impact, and advises stakeholders about the implications and consequences for the business and/or the procurement element of programmes/projects. Negotiates variations and seeks appropriate authorization. Actively supports and engages with experts and stakeholders to ensure continuous improvements are identified through review and bench marking processes. Develops and implements change management protocols.
? Project management - Takes full responsibility for the definition, documentation and successful completion of complex projects (typically with significant business, political, or high-profile impact, and high-risk dependenciesAdopts and adapts project management methods and tools, selecting
appropriately from plan-driven/predictive approaches or more adaptive (iterative and agile) approaches. Ensures that effective project control, change control, risk management and testing processes are maintained. Translates communications/stakeholder engagement strategies into specific activities and deliverable. Facilitates open communication and discussion between stakeholders, acting as a single point of contact by developing, maintaining and working to stakeholder engagement strategies and plans. Provides informed feedback to assess and promote understanding. Facilitates business decision-making processes. Captures and disseminates technical and business information.

Key Skills and Responsibilities (SFIA based):
        
 - BENM - Level 5
Identifies specific measures and mechanisms by which benefits can be measured, and plans to activate these mechanisms at the required time. Monitors benefits against what was predicted in the business case and ensures that all participants are informed and involved throughout the change programme and fully prepared to exploit the new operational business environment once it is in place. Supports operational managers to ensure that all plans, work packages and deliverables are aligned to the expected benefits and leads activities required in the realisation of the benefits of each part of the change programme.
        
 - CIPM - Level 6
Ensures that there is a business perspective on how any new technical capabilities will be integrated into the business, including planning around key business cycles, selecting appropriate customers for migration, etc. Initiates the business implementation plan, including all the activities that the business needs to do to prepare for new technical components and technologies. Ensures sites deliver site implementation plans that align with the overall plan. Tracks and reports against these activities to ensure progress. Defines and manages the activities to ensure achievement of the projected business benefits after delivery. Outlines key business engagement messages that need to be communicated throughout the programme/project.
        
- ITCM - Level 5
Oversees and measures the fulfilment of contractual obligations. Uses key performance indicators (KPIs) to monitor and challenge performance and identify opportunities for continuous improvement. Develops strategies to address under-performance and compliance failures, including application of contract terms. Identifies where changes are required, evaluates the impact, and advises stakeholders about the implications and consequences for the business and/or the procurement element of programmes/projects. Negotiates variations and seeks appropriate authorisation. Actively supports and engages with experts and stakeholders to ensure continuous improvements are identified through review and benchmarking processes. Develops and implements change management protocols.

title: IT Security Manager - Addison, TX
description:
The NTT DATA Services Information Security Manager (ISM) oversees and coordinates the information security services that NTT DATA provides to the customer. This is an individual contributor role in which the ISM acts as a trusted information security partner with the customer and works collaboratively to understand, anticipate and recommend risk mitigation while promoting the overall information security protection for the customer's information assets. You will partner with the client to align information security with the customer's business strategy, security policies and regulatory and compliance requirements resulting in increased protection and reduced risk.
**This position requires working onsite daily at our client's office in Addison, TX.
Responsibilities:
- Ensure the delivery of information security services to the customer is in compliance with the contract and any applicable standards and regulatory requirements
- Collaborate with the client in the definition and implementation of information security policies, strategies, procedures and configurations in order to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of client's environment and data
- Participate with the customer in the strategic design process to translate security and business requirements into technologies, processes and systems
- Evaluate new / emerging security products and technologies and make recommendations to customer leadership in regards to the security impact and value to the organization
- Participate in internal and external audits for the customer (e.g., PCI, SOX) and coordinate information security services activities to support the audit (i.e., defining, gathering artifacts, etc.)
- Manage and drive remediation efforts related to information security; remediation may be from incidents, penetration tests, vulnerability scans, internal/external audits and Critical Practice Assessments
- Identify information security weaknesses or potential gaps in the customer's current environment and work with the customer to bring information security operations up to standards
- Participate and represent IT Security in Delivery/Operational meetings; conduct an information security operational review meeting with account (e.g., Customer Delivery Executive) and customer (e.g., CISO) key stakeholders with topics including overall information security status and performance
- Review service management reports to ensure tickets (i.e., incidents, problems, requests, changes) related to information security, are being acknowledged, worked and Service Level Agreements are met; provide direction on ticket remediation and ensure remediation is complete
- Conduct an ongoing security awareness program for NTT DATA personnel supporting the customer ensuring individuals understand and are compliant with the relevant information security obligations in support of the customer including security topics that provide guidance on customer security policies and supporting documentation and procedures
- Cultivate trusted partner relationships with account and customer; keep consistent and open dialogue to uncover issues, challenges, risks
- Maintain an information security strategy (forward looking roadmap), for your customer, aligning services / portfolio components to the strategy
- Interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
- Monitor the threat landscape and make timely adjustments and/or recommendations to reduce risk
Basic Requirements:
- 8+ years of information security experience and/or IT risk management experience with a focus on security, performance, and reliability
- Experience with security protocols, cryptography, authentication, authorization, and security
- Experience with multi-factor authentication, single sign-on, identity management or related technologies
- Experience with network security technologies and architectures such as firewalls, IDS/IPS, DMZ architecture, Content filtering, etc.
- Experience with SIEM technologies (i.e., architecture, logging, event correlation, incident response, etc.)
- Experience with standards and regulations impacting information security and information security internal & external audits (i.e. SOX, PCI, etc.)
Preferences:
- At least one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISM, SSCP, CEH, or CSSLP
- Undergraduate or graduate degree
- Security/Consulting industry experience working in a customer facing role with customer relationship management experience

title: IT Manager (SOP Documents)
description:
IT Manager (SOP Documents) - Perm - Lyndhurst, VA- $85,000-$100,000 
The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
Seeking a IT Manager (SOP Documents) in Lyndhurst, VA. 
Role Description
* Exercise oversight to ensure that operations, new plans, policies, procedures and transition/migration plans are consistent with overall company goals and objectives
* Position includes significant help desk tasks and support
* Provide technical support for internal users, field technicians, and customer job PC's
* Configure, monitor, and analyze performance on Linux and Windows Server 2008-2012R2 systems in both physical and virtualized environments (Hyper-V)
* Document IT SOP's to provide quick and consistent support and prevent downtime
* Plan systems hardware and software needs based on load and security threats, including patching existing services where necessary
* Conduct ongoing security risk assessments, including the monitoring, investigation and reporting of security and access violations
* Oversee software and hardware configuration/installation troubleshooting, and repairs including: desktop/laptop hardware, network printers, and other peripherals
* Manage the long-term architecture & infrastructure planning and development
* Providing strategic leadership, support, and mentorship to junior IT employees
* Manage technology budget company-wide
Skills & Requirements
3-5 years of experience in a lead or management role. If they have lead experience they must be okay with the management responsibilities.
* Must be okay with handling lower level help desk tasks since it is a small team (3 people, including the IT Manager)
* Experience standardizing infrastructure processes
* Experience creating SOP documents around a company's infrastructure processes
* Strong Windows experience and exposure to Linux

title: Health Plan IT Operations Manager
description:
This community-based Health Plan in the San Francisco Bay Area is actively interviewing for an IT Operations Manager to lead its Information Technology Department. Apply today, and discover a stable work environment where you can make an actual difference in people’s lives every day.
This integrated health system has served the San Francisco community for over 50 years. The IT Operations Manager will discover an amazing team of clinical and administrative leaders with quality patient care at their very heart. The hospital facility and its satellite clinics have been recognized by The Joint Commission and by the people of the community for its high quality outcomes and superior patient care. A large part of this comes from the close connection this health system, its Health Plan, and the medical group have with the people it serves.
Today more than ever, Information Technology (IT) is absolutely crucial to the delivery and coordination of healthcare, particularly for a health system as diverse as this one. At the heart of this coordination is an exemplary team of Information Systems professionals who hold it all together. The Health Plan IT Manager, reporting to the Executive Director of Operations and Business Development, will get the opportunity to collaborate with a full spectrum of experts who are at the top of the field.
Working out of the Health Plan’s central office in San Francisco, the IT Manager will take responsibility for operational oversight, performance improvement, and strategic management of all the Health Plan’s Information Technology and Networking assets. The organization’s IT and Networking needs, driven by its product mix and delivery system integration, will be a complex balance to manage. This person should have experience with Healthcare IT optimization and efficiencies, as well as the ability to manage diverse Federal and State compliance standards.
One of the best parts about the Information Systems Manager’s role is the diversity that each day will present. As a Manager of the IT Department operations, you’ll get to apply your experience managing IT audit projects through the full cycle. Working across discipline, you’ll coordinate planning and Information System Review for general and app controls. You’ll spearhead frontline assessment and policy evaluation, and you’ll make recommendations to Health Plan and Operations leaders regarding your found results.
Of course, all this means that the IT Manager should be a very organized person, with strong leadership skills. You’ll find yourself serving as a subject matter expert to a broad range of stakeholders. The IT Operations Manager will have multiple projects underway at one time, and this person will need the ability to drive each of those projects to satisfactory resolutions. One important way to achieve this is through successfully mentoring and coaching of your department.
Those who are new to the San Francisco Bay Area and those who’ve lived there for years, each discover the same thing: it has something for everyone! No matter what direction you travel, great things await. A drive North will put the Health Plan IT Operations Manager in the middle of California Wine Country, with all the beautiful vistas and multi-colored orchards. An hour west and you’re in the heart of San Francisco, where haute cuisine, world-class theater, and all manner of nightlife await. South and East take you to long hikes, large open skies, as many outdoor activities as you could want. Nearly anywhere you settle, you’ll find some of America’s top schools, a community of compassionate neighbors, and fantastic weather.
Join this fantastic community medical center, and discover an area that bridges the gap between small town feel and big city flavor. The IT Manager will find the peace of mind that comes with a stable position in a trusted hospital system, a generous benefits package, and competitive compensation.

title: Senior Manager, Cyber Security Threat & Vulnerability Management
IT Applications Manager
description:
Westborough, MA
 Excellent!
 Our client is looking for an IT Applications Manager. This is a PERMANENT role. 
We are seeking an experienced and motivated individual to lead and manage our business application team and work a dynamic, high-tech manufacturing company. 
 
Oversee the development and implementation of corporate and department initiatives, and issue resolution. 
Manage application lifecycle management and successful delivery of projects and enhancements. Manage staff and be accountable for personnel actions, including hiring, performance and salary reviews, disciplinary action and termination. 
Be responsible for ensuring that key goals are met on a short and long-term basis by leading the IT team on crucial projects within the accepted time and resource constraints. 
Research and present new technical offerings to improve efficiency and internal controls.
Ensure a secure framework and change management process to mitigate risk. 
Review and confirm that requirements and resulting systems are documented and that all best practices and standards are followed. 
Develop and maintain relationships with business stakeholders at all levels to ensure alignment with their business objectives and strategy. 
Plan, schedule, and manage onsite technology operations. 
Develop annual goals and objectives for the function. 
Manage risks related to financial and security compliance and also risks relating to project and program delivery. 
Assist with the management of the Business Continuity program. 
Provide on-call support for the business operation. 
Experience initiating, leading, delivering and managing cross-functional projects ranging from large transformation initiatives and custom solutions to cloud offerings; experience with enterprise resource planning (ERP) and enterprise performance management (EPM). 
Proven experience working and partnering with business controls and internal & external audit reviews. 
Experience with best practice integration methods and having worked in complex integration environments using on premise and cloud infrastructure; components of integration will include Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce.com (SFDC) and various .NET platforms. 
Knowledge of database design and management. 
Knowledge of security controls and user administration. 
Experience translating business problems into IT solutions via a structured methodology. 
Thorough understanding of project management, resource management methodologies and project life cycle process. 
Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to manage, coach and train staff. 
Strong planning and organizational skills. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Strong verbal and written communications skills. Ability to work cross functionally within IT and the business. 
Mentoring and coaching skills. 
Experience working in a controlled and validated environment (Sarbanes Oxley) preferred. Knowledge of and ability to administer personnel actions, including performance and salary reviews, hiring, discipline and termination. 
Knowledge of manufacturing and operations, with preference for knowledge of accounting and finance. 
Experience with Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) processes preferred. 
Experience with one or more Development methodologies (i.e. Waterfall, Scrum, Agile) 
 Bachelor’s degree in technical field required. 
Computer science or management information systems degree preferred. 
8-12 years of relevant work experience required in the business application domain, including 3+ years in a leadership role.

title: Manager OT Cyber Security Vulnerability Detection & Management
description:
The OT Cyber Security Vulnerability Detection and Management Manager is responsible for supporting the architecture, implementation, and ongoing maintenance of the Cyber Security Vulnerability Detection and Management program, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all corporate Operational Technology assets.  This role is responsible for the design and operation of cyber security vulnerability solutions to ensure these solutions are implemented in accordance with industry standards, best practices, and Exelon Management Model governance.  This role is required to participate in the creation of and/or maintenance of policies, standards, baselines, guidelines, and procedures, as well as conduct risk and vulnerability assessments on a large array of IT/OT systems. This position requires active communication with development teams, infrastructure teams, and business areas supporting assessment requirements for core business functions, and will manage a geographically diverse team.  This position also leads, coordinates, communicates, integrates, and is accountable for the overall success of the OT Cyber Vulnerability Detection and Management program.
 
 
- Lead a geographically diverse team providing direction, management oversight, performance appraisals, and mentoring, career development; promote diversity and teamwork with other Security groups. Perform vendor management of associated Cyber Vulnerability platforms and solutions. May require travel up to 10%. 
- Develop and maintain annual vulnerability assessment schedule through interaction with business units, project management, emergent assessments and inclusion of business critical applications requiring predefined assessment requirements. Support and maintain a remediation tracking solution, enforcing accountability through final resolution. Ensure plans of actions and milestones or remediation plans are in place for vulnerabilities identified during vulnerability assessments. Management of Security Patch Management and Vulnerability Management processes and enforcement.   Measure the effectiveness of the enterprise's cybersecurity safeguards to ensure they provide the intended level of protection.
- Manage Vulnerability Threat and Industrial Control Systems notifications of emergent vulnerabilities ensuring remediation tracking.
- Oversee supporting security related functions and processes. Maintain monthly reporting to senior Security management and Business Units for all Vulnerability Management responsibilities.
- Lead and manage NERC CIP and OT Security Governance vulnerability assessment program and requirements that include active or paper based assessments, project management, adherence to reporting standards, enforcement of security compliance standards and remediation tracking. 
- Establish, maintain, and enhance relationships with business and IT partners.  Communicate status to Key stakeholders on a regular basis.
 
The Cyber Security Vulnerability Detection and Management Manager role provides direction and oversight to enterprise infrastructure and assets applying security best standards for remediation of known vulnerabilities. Deliverables for this role will be focused on identification, communication, and remediation of identified cyber security vulnerabilities. The Cyber Security Vulnerability Detection and Management Manager will also provide project management, resources, and support OT Cyber Vulnerability Assessments. This role requires collaboration across the entire enterprise/business units to support remediation efforts. This role requires close integration with other internal security teams, including the corresponding CVDM Team focused on IT assets. 
 
----
VEVRAA Federal Contractor 
 
- Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology (IT), Security Management or a related discipline, and typically 8 or more years of experience in cyber security, vulnerability management or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
- At least 3 years of demonstrated experience in the energy sector 
- Knowledge of known vulnerabilities from alerts, advisories, errata, and bulletins
- Knowledge of system life cycle management principles, including software security and usability
- Knowledge of new and emerging information technology (IT) and cybersecurity technologies
- Knowledge of host/network access control mechanisms (e.g., access control list)
- Knowledge of network protocols such as TCP/IP, Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory services
- Knowledge of penetration testing principles, tools, and techniques
- Knowledge of system and application security threats and vulnerabilities 
- Knowledge of resource management principles and techniques
- Knowledge of information security program management and project management principles and techniques
- Knowledge of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.  
- Experience managing budget development and forecasting
- Enforcement of change management techniques associated with Cyber Security Vulnerability Management enhancements
- Managing approvals of changes affecting NERC CIP infrastructure
- Demonstrated leadership ability
- Excellent oral/written communication skills and the proven ability to work effectively with all levels of IT and business management
 
- Graduate degree in cyber security or related area of expertise.
- Relevant security certifications (CISSP, GICSP, CISM or CISA; CEH or GIAC)
- At least 3 years of experience as part of an electric utility
- Demonstrated experienced in Vulnerability Management processes including remediation tracking and resolution for Industrial Control Systems / Operational Technology
- Demonstrated experience managing vulnerability assessment schedules that span across all business units, functions, and platforms 
- Demonstrated experience with standard security tools that include, but are not limited to, Nessus, Rapid7, Qualys, Metasploit, and Nipper
- Demonstrated experience managing Security Patch Management  engagements with support teams, developing risk evaluation, remediation planning, and validation
- Demonstrated experience managing recurring  vulnerability identification processes through scanning, notification, assisting with remediation requirements and validation
- Experience managing firewall risk evaluation, providing support and describing alternatives to reduce risk exposure
- Demonstrated experience managing Vulnerability Threat notification and analysis process, including daily reviews of emergent vulnerability threats that have an impact on the Exelon environment
- Demonstrated experience supporting emergent threat intelligence through the use of security scanning tools, determining applicability and impact on the infrastructure

title: CRM Database Manager
description: Our client is currently seeking a CRM Database Manager who will manage the performance of the database, along with ad-hoc reporting, and operation support. This is a full-time, permanent position.

title: IT Security Manager - Addison, TX
description:
The NTT DATA Services Information Security Manager (ISM) oversees and coordinates the information security services that NTT DATA provides to the customer. This is an individual contributor role in which the ISM acts as a trusted information security partner with the customer and works collaboratively to understand, anticipate and recommend risk mitigation while promoting the overall information security protection for the customer's information assets. You will partner with the client to align information security with the customer's business strategy, security policies and regulatory and compliance requirements resulting in increased protection and reduced risk.
**This position requires working onsite daily at our client's office in Addison, TX.
Responsibilities:
- Ensure the delivery of information security services to the customer is in compliance with the contract and any applicable standards and regulatory requirements
- Collaborate with the client in the definition and implementation of information security policies, strategies, procedures and configurations in order to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of client's environment and data
- Participate with the customer in the strategic design process to translate security and business requirements into technologies, processes and systems
- Evaluate new / emerging security products and technologies and make recommendations to customer leadership in regards to the security impact and value to the organization
- Participate in internal and external audits for the customer (e.g., PCI, SOX) and coordinate information security services activities to support the audit (i.e., defining, gathering artifacts, etc.)
- Manage and drive remediation efforts related to information security; remediation may be from incidents, penetration tests, vulnerability scans, internal/external audits and Critical Practice Assessments
- Identify information security weaknesses or potential gaps in the customer's current environment and work with the customer to bring information security operations up to standards
- Participate and represent IT Security in Delivery/Operational meetings; conduct an information security operational review meeting with account (e.g., Customer Delivery Executive) and customer (e.g., CISO) key stakeholders with topics including overall information security status and performance
- Review service management reports to ensure tickets (i.e., incidents, problems, requests, changes) related to information security, are being acknowledged, worked and Service Level Agreements are met; provide direction on ticket remediation and ensure remediation is complete
- Conduct an ongoing security awareness program for NTT DATA personnel supporting the customer ensuring individuals understand and are compliant with the relevant information security obligations in support of the customer including security topics that provide guidance on customer security policies and supporting documentation and procedures
- Cultivate trusted partner relationships with account and customer; keep consistent and open dialogue to uncover issues, challenges, risks
- Maintain an information security strategy (forward looking roadmap), for your customer, aligning services / portfolio components to the strategy
- Interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
- Monitor the threat landscape and make timely adjustments and/or recommendations to reduce risk
Basic Requirements:
- 8+ years of information security experience and/or IT risk management experience with a focus on security, performance, and reliability
- Experience with security protocols, cryptography, authentication, authorization, and security
- Experience with multi-factor authentication, single sign-on, identity management or related technologies
- Experience with network security technologies and architectures such as firewalls, IDS/IPS, DMZ architecture, Content filtering, etc.
- Experience with SIEM technologies (i.e., architecture, logging, event correlation, incident response, etc.)
- Experience with standards and regulations impacting information security and information security internal & external audits (i.e. SOX, PCI, etc.)
Preferences:
- At least one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISM, SSCP, CEH, or CSSLP
- Undergraduate or graduate degree
- Security/Consulting industry experience working in a customer facing role with customer relationship management experience

title: IT Manager (SOP Documents)
description:
IT Manager (SOP Documents) - Perm - Lyndhurst, VA- $85,000-$100,000 
The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
Seeking a IT Manager (SOP Documents) in Lyndhurst, VA. 
Role Description
* Exercise oversight to ensure that operations, new plans, policies, procedures and transition/migration plans are consistent with overall company goals and objectives
* Position includes significant help desk tasks and support
* Provide technical support for internal users, field technicians, and customer job PC's
* Configure, monitor, and analyze performance on Linux and Windows Server 2008-2012R2 systems in both physical and virtualized environments (Hyper-V)
* Document IT SOP's to provide quick and consistent support and prevent downtime
* Plan systems hardware and software needs based on load and security threats, including patching existing services where necessary
* Conduct ongoing security risk assessments, including the monitoring, investigation and reporting of security and access violations
* Oversee software and hardware configuration/installation troubleshooting, and repairs including: desktop/laptop hardware, network printers, and other peripherals
* Manage the long-term architecture & infrastructure planning and development
* Providing strategic leadership, support, and mentorship to junior IT employees
* Manage technology budget company-wide
Skills & Requirements
3-5 years of experience in a lead or management role. If they have lead experience they must be okay with the management responsibilities.
* Must be okay with handling lower level help desk tasks since it is a small team (3 people, including the IT Manager)
* Experience standardizing infrastructure processes
* Experience creating SOP documents around a company's infrastructure processes
* Strong Windows experience and exposure to Linux
Why Hays?
You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the Information Technology industry and market trends . Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there's a position you really want, you're fully prepared to get it. 
Nervous about an upcoming interview? Unsure how to write a new resume?
Visit the Hays Career Advice section to learn top tips to help you stand out from the crowd when job hunting. 
Hays is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Drug testing may be required; please contact a recruiter for more information.

title: Software Configuration Manager
description:
Responsible for ensuring proper configuration control of all software baselines while establishing software configuration management (SCM) processes and procedures and the execution of the SCM plan.
 
Develop detailed documentation including operating procedures and change management reports
Work with software engineering to establish and maintain developmental baselines
Perform SCM baseline audits and all software builds
Maintain PTC Integrity and research and establish new CM tools
Identify deliverables, work products and documents to be placed under SCM control
Ensure that Software Problem Reports, Software Design Change Notices and Software Version Reports are generated, reviewed and tracked to closure
Track nonconformance issues (corrective actions) until resolved
Perform trend analysis
Responsible for establishing and execution of software build and installation procedures
Responsible for software product builds and releases throughout the whole product life cycle
Responsible for merging and branching of software code bases
Act as SCM Librarian
Must be at assigned worksite during assigned hours 100% of time; less PTO, FML/STD/LTD
 
Chair software change  meetings
Prepare audit reports for presentation to management
Assist in training new software engineering employees
Other duties may be assigned
 
This position is responsible for Software Configuration personnel. 
Ability to maintain sensitive and confidential information as required by government standards
Ability to interact effectively with peers and supervisors
Ability to interact appropriately with the public when necessary
Ability to adhere to workplace rules
Ability to read, write and develop intelligible instructions, procedures and software development documentation
Ability to collaborate and work with a multi-functional team in a fast paced environment
Strong and pronounced problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to maintain detailed and accurate records
 
BS in Computer Science or related and a minimum of 5 years of experience, preferred; or a minimum of 8 years of experience directly related to software engineering and/or configuration management may be substituted for degree
Advanced experience with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, database management systems
Experience with the software engineering process
Experience with various software languages and software development environments
Experience with build and release management and associated tools
Experience with the software production process
Experience creating and working with detailed schedules
Visual Source Safe experience
Experience with various CM tools
Certified Configuration and Data Manager (CCDM) a plus
 
Office and production environment
Ability to stand and sit for long periods of time
Ability to perform repetitive motion (keyboarding, 10-key, phones)
Ability to lift  up to 25 pounds
Ability to travel, foreign and/or domestic
 
 
THE ABOVE STATEMENTS ARE INTENDED TO DESCRIBE THE GENERAL NATURE AND LEVEL OF WORK BEING PERFORMED BY INDIVIDUALS ASSIGNED TO THIS CLASSIFICATION. THEY ARE NOT INTENDED TO BE CONSTRUED AS AN EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES, DUTIES AND SKILLS REQUIRED OF PERSONNEL SO CLASSIFIED.
 
A REVIEW OF THIS CLASSIFICATION HAS EXCLUDED THE MARGINAL FUNCTIONS OF THE CLASSIFICATION THAT ARE INCIDENTAL TO THE PERFORMANCE OF FUNDAMENTAL JOB JUTIES. ALL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ARE ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND REQUIREMENTS AND ARE SUBJECT TO POSSIBLE MODIFICATION TO REASONABLY ACCOMMODATE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO PERFORM THIS JOB PROFICIENTLY.   THE REQUIREMENTS LISTED IN THIS DOCUMENT ARE THE MINIMUM LEVELS OF KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS OR ABILITIES.

title: Scrum Master/Project Manager
description:
Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Scrum Master/Project Manager to work in the FCAT (Fidelity Center for Applied Technology) Business Unit in Durham, NC.
We are looking for a Scrum Master/Project Manager to join our team in launching several new platforms for Workplace Investments. The role will be a core part of the team and will work closely with our multi-functional team of designers, engineers, and data scientists. We are a hardworking team of entrepreneurs and experts focused on building a new business. We thrive in ambiguous and uncertain spaces, rapidly exploring big ideas using agile methodologies. We look for people who are relentlessly curious, willing to take action, and have the skills and determination to bring a new business to life.
We offer the opportunity to work in a start-up environment, backed by the resources of Fidelity. You will grow your skills in an environment where you can do your best work and, most importantly, have impact at scale.
The Fidelity Center for Applied Technology (FCAT) supports the entire Fidelity business with a mission to catalyze innovation for Fidelity and its clients. We are a group within FCAT that is leading efforts on exploring AI technologies to disrupt business models, and provide new opportunities with new products and services.
At Fidelity, we are passionate about making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in building and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our dedication to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associate for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FTSJobs.com.

title: Manager, Applications Development (IVR)
description:
At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. Joining Delta Dental means joining a culture focused on fostering development, building genuine connections, recognizing each other’s strengths and sharing in successes. 
This position leads teams of talented and high performing developers and business analysts for multiple application areas. It is responsible and accountable to business stakeholders to deliver enhancements on a mix of initiatives and requires extensive collaboration across business and IT areas.
#LI-JS1
 Our employees are collaborative, self-aware, and ethical. It is our expectation to do the right thing and follow through on commitments.
 Our employees take ownership of developing themselves and others through coaching, mentoring and providing/being open to constructive feedback and identifying learning opportunities.
 Our employees take time to build rapport with customers, while anticipating and exceeding their needs to ensure positive outcomes.  
If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!
 
Delta Dental covers more Americans than any other dental benefits provider. As an employee you’ll take part in our mission to become the trusted health partner by collaborating with our communities and employees to reimagine and deliver new possibilities in an ever-changing environment. Our Enterprise Strategy focuses on pillars of Growth and Diversification, supported by the platforms of Culture and People, Process and Technology. Our employees take pride working for a purpose-driven organization and live our values of Trust, Service, Excellence and Innovation.
 
We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. title: Scrum Master/Project Manager
description:
Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Scrum Master/Project Manager to work in the FCAT (Fidelity Center for Applied Technology) Business Unit in Durham, NC.
We are looking for a Scrum Master/Project Manager to join our team in launching several new platforms for Workplace Investments. The role will be a core part of the team and will work closely with our multi-functional team of designers, engineers, and data scientists. We are a hardworking team of entrepreneurs and experts focused on building a new business. We thrive in ambiguous and uncertain spaces, rapidly exploring big ideas using agile methodologies. We look for people who are relentlessly curious, willing to take action, and have the skills and determination to bring a new business to life.
We offer the opportunity to work in a start-up environment, backed by the resources of Fidelity. You will grow your skills in an environment where you can do your best work and, most importantly, have impact at scale.
The Fidelity Center for Applied Technology (FCAT) supports the entire Fidelity business with a mission to catalyze innovation for Fidelity and its clients. We are a group within FCAT that is leading efforts on exploring AI technologies to disrupt business models, and provide new opportunities with new products and services.
At Fidelity, we are passionate about making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in building and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our dedication to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associate for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FTSJobs.com.
Fidelity TalentSource, formerly Veritude, is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. We recruit individuals from a variety of backgrounds, including technology and customer service, to fill assignments across Fidelity’s U.S.-based regional and investor center locations. If you would like to experience Fidelity’s diverse and inclusive workplace while expanding your skill set and developing your professional network, consider a role with Fidelity TalentSource. title: IT Applications Manager
description:
Westborough, MA
 Excellent!
 Our client is looking for an IT Applications Manager. This is a PERMANENT role. 
We are seeking an experienced and motivated individual to lead and manage our business application team and work a dynamic, high-tech manufacturing company. 
 
Oversee the development and implementation of corporate and department initiatives, and issue resolution. 
Manage application lifecycle management and successful delivery of projects and enhancements. Manage staff and be accountable for personnel actions, including hiring, performance and salary reviews, disciplinary action and termination. 
Be responsible for ensuring that key goals are met on a short and long-term basis by leading the IT team on crucial projects within the accepted time and resource constraints. 
Research and present new technical offerings to improve efficiency and internal controls.
Ensure a secure framework and change management process to mitigate risk. 
Review and confirm that requirements and resulting systems are documented and that all best practices and standards are followed. 
Develop and maintain relationships with business stakeholders at all levels to ensure alignment with their business objectives and strategy. 
Plan, schedule, and manage onsite technology operations. 
Develop annual goals and objectives for the function. 
Manage risks related to financial and security compliance and also risks relating to project and program delivery. 
Assist with the management of the Business Continuity program. 
Provide on-call support for the business operation. 
Experience initiating, leading, delivering and managing cross-functional projects ranging from large transformation initiatives and custom solutions to cloud offerings; experience with enterprise resource planning (ERP) and enterprise performance management (EPM). 
Proven experience working and partnering with business controls and internal & external audit reviews. 
Experience with best practice integration methods and having worked in complex integration environments using on premise and cloud infrastructure; components of integration will include Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce.com (SFDC) and various .NET platforms. 
Knowledge of database design and management. 
Knowledge of security controls and user administration. 
Experience translating business problems into IT solutions via a structured methodology. 
Thorough understanding of project management, resource management methodologies and project life cycle process. 
Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to manage, coach and train staff. 
Strong planning and organizational skills. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Strong verbal and written communications skills. Ability to work cross functionally within IT and the business. 
Mentoring and coaching skills. 
Experience working in a controlled and validated environment (Sarbanes Oxley) preferred. Knowledge of and ability to administer personnel actions, including performance and salary reviews, hiring, discipline and termination. 
Knowledge of manufacturing and operations, with preference for knowledge of accounting and finance. 
Experience with Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) processes preferred. 
Experience with one or more Development methodologies (i.e. Waterfall, Scrum, Agile) 
 Bachelor’s degree in technical field required. 
Computer science or management information systems degree preferred. 
8-12 years of relevant work experience required in the business application domain, including 3+ years in a leadership role.

 to work in our

title: Software Configuration Manager
description:
Responsible for ensuring proper configuration control of all software baselines while establishing software configuration management (SCM) processes and procedures and the execution of the SCM plan.
 
Develop detailed documentation including operating procedures and change management reports
Work with software engineering to establish and maintain developmental baselines
Perform SCM baseline audits and all software builds
Maintain PTC Integrity and research and establish new CM tools
Identify deliverables, work products and documents to be placed under SCM control
Ensure that Software Problem Reports, Software Design Change Notices and Software Version Reports are generated, reviewed and tracked to closure
Track nonconformance issues (corrective actions) until resolved
Perform trend analysis
Responsible for establishing and execution of software build and installation procedures
Responsible for software product builds and releases throughout the whole product life cycle
Responsible for merging and branching of software code bases
Act as SCM Librarian
Must be at assigned worksite during assigned hours 100% of time; less PTO, FML/STD/LTD
 
Chair software change  meetings
Prepare audit reports for presentation to management
Assist in training new software engineering employees
Other duties may be assigned
 
This position is responsible for Software Configuration personnel. 
Ability to maintain sensitive and confidential information as required by government standards
Ability to interact effectively with peers and supervisors
Ability to interact appropriately with the public when necessary
Ability to adhere to workplace rules
Ability to read, write and develop intelligible instructions, procedures and software development documentation
Ability to collaborate and work with a multi-functional team in a fast paced environment
Strong and pronounced problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to maintain detailed and accurate records
 
BS in Computer Science or related and a minimum of 5 years of experience, preferred; or a minimum of 8 years of experience directly related to software engineering and/or configuration management may be substituted for degree
Advanced experience with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, database management systems
Experience with the software engineering process
Experience with various software languages and software development environments
Experience with build and release management and associated tools
Experience with the software production process
Experience creating and working with detailed schedules
Visual Source Safe experience
Experience with various CM tools
Certified Configuration and Data Manager (CCDM) a plus
 
Office and production environment
Ability to stand and sit for long periods of time
Ability to perform repetitive motion (keyboarding, 10-key, phones)
Ability to lift  up to 25 pounds
Ability to travel, foreign and/or domestic

title: Manager, Applications Development (IVR)
description:
At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. Joining Delta Dental means joining a culture focused on fostering development, building genuine connections, recognizing each other’s strengths and sharing in successes. 
This position leads teams of talented and high performing developers and business analysts for multiple application areas. It is responsible and accountable to business stakeholders to deliver enhancements on a mix of initiatives and requires extensive collaboration across business and IT areas.
#LI-JS1
 Our employees are collaborative, self-aware, and ethical. It is our expectation to do the right thing and follow through on commitments.
 Our employees take ownership of developing themselves and others through coaching, mentoring and providing/being open to constructive feedback and identifying learning opportunities.
 Our employees take time to build rapport with customers, while anticipating and exceeding their needs to ensure positive outcomes.  
If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!
 
Delta Dental covers more Americans than any other dental benefits provider. As an employee you’ll take part in our mission to become the trusted health partner by collaborating with our communities and employees to reimagine and deliver new possibilities in an ever-changing environment. Our Enterprise Strategy focuses on pillars of Growth and Diversification, supported by the platforms of Culture and People, Process and Technology. Our employees take pride working for a purpose-driven organization and live our values of Trust, Service, Excellence and Innovation.
 
We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.

title: Configuration Data Manager Specialist, Journeyman - PR 1745
description:
ESSENTIAL AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY: 
All areas of responsibility listed below are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position, with reasonable accommodation, if necessary. Work responsibilities may vary, depending upon assignment. Work located on Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, OH.   
    
    
  
  
 Assist in the review of program specifications for hardware and software; review engineering drawings and conduct in-process reviews; request nomenclature and Computer Program Identification Number (CPIN) assignment for Configuration Items (CIs); ensure marking of CI/Computer Software CIs (CSCIs) and associated documentation is accurate; and ensure appropriate documentation is approved and placed on contract for establishment/update of USG controlled baselines.  
 
 Aid in the review ECPs, CCPs, RFDs for format and content requirements.  
 Assist in the resolution of discrepancies and issues between the Government and weapon system Contractor; planning and scheduling of CCBs; prepare CCB briefings and documentation; and track implementation of approved changes.   
 
 Assist with the determination of CSA data base requirements; monitor data input; track the configuration of fielded systems and equipment; and monitor changes and status of configuration baseline documentation.    
 Establish and maintain effective professional working relationships with co-workers, and customers. 
 Follow policies and procedures as described in corporate manuals and directives. 
 Attend work each day during scheduled work hours unless on approved travel or time off. 
 Perform occasional travel to contractor and customer sites, as required (see WORKING CONDITIONS below). 
 Work flexible hours, including occasional overtime. 
 Carry out other duties as may be assigned or requested.   
WORKING CONDITIONS   
 
 May be required to travel using commercial air, USG air, and other conventional modes of transportation to Outside Continental United States and Continental United States (OCONUS and CONUS) locations in support of program meetings, reviews, audits and other activities held at Government and Contractor facilities.  
 Shall travel unaccompanied and unsupervised.  
 All travel (including plans, agenda, itinerary, and dates) require prior approval by the EPASS CO for OCONUS travel or COR for CONUS travel.  
 CONUS travel requests shall be submitted no later than ten business days prior to travel.  
 Shall notify the EPASS CO or COR of the costs of air travel, and receive prior written approval when the use of other than least costly air travel is required to complete a Government-directed task.  
 Shall submit a Trip Report upon return from travel. The trip report shall be submitted within 5 business days of return from earliest date of travel. At a minimum the trip report shall include: name of employee; date(s) of trip; site visited; trip purpose; relevant observations during trip.  
 Check for additional OCONUS Travel Requirements for FAR clauses 52.228-3 and 52.228-4 that apply to OCONUS travel.   
 
 Work is performed indoors with some potential risks to safety and health hazards related to electronics.   
QUALIFICATIONS: 
Education/Certifications/Experience/Skills: 
 BA/BS with 3-8 years’ directly related experience. 
 
 possess an active Secret clearance. 
 
 be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access), Microsoft Internet Explorer, and other standard (Customer specified) applications.) 
 
 be able to transport self to various facility sites, as required. If using own motor vehicle, must possess a valid driver’s license and proof of insurance. 
Physical Skills and Abilities: 
 May require lifting up to 25 pounds. 
 Requires visual acuity to use a keyboard.

title: Project Manager - IT
description:
The Project Manager - IT manages, plans and coordinates the full life-cycle of projects for the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (PBGC). This position ensures that all project goals and objectives are accomplished as laid out in the scope of work and within the prescribed timeframe, budgetary parameters and to the customer’s satisfaction. Provides project team leadership necessary to meet defined project deliverables and maintains positive working relationships with the customer and key stakeholders. The Project Manager - IT utilizes subject matter expertise to analyze and evaluate business functions, systems and processes in order to determine the most effective business applications for meeting the needs of PBGC objectives.
Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Responsible for the integration of CNI Core Competencies into daily functions, including: commitment to integrity, knowledge / quality of work, supporting financial goals of the company, initiative / motivation, cooperation / relationships, problem analysis / discretion, accomplishing goals through organization, positive oral / written communication skills, leadership abilities, commitment to Affirmative Action, reliability / dependability, flexibility and ownership / accountability of actions taken.
Manages and communicates project expectations to team members.
Builds and maintains solid customer relationships, and assures customer satisfaction with the successful execution of the project. This position will be most successful when a high degree of organizational aptitude is present along with a high level of enthusiasm and a strong drive to achieve outcomes using indirect resources.
Interfaces with internal project teams, management, customers and subcontractors. Maintains timely communications, and develops collaborative rapport with solutions-oriented approaches.
Effectively manages the project scope, deliverables, cost, profitability, schedule, quality and resources.
Develops IT project plans in MicroSoft Project and within PBGC tools to guide the execution and control of the project, and tracks project milestones and deliverables.
Communicates IT project plans, objectives, timelines, schedules, job assignments and responsibilities.
Identifies and manages project dependencies and critical path. Proactively manages changes in project scope. Identifies and communicates potential risks with CNI and customer leadership, and devises mitigations and contingency plans.  Identifies issues and devises work-arounds.
Implements industry best practices, project management tools and methodologies.
Effectively leads tool selection and procurement for solutions to meet the business requirements in project scope.  Responsible for solution implementation planning, design, installation, modification, and operation of information systems capabilities. Ensures that the software and related products satisfy the needs and requirements of the customer.
May be required to facilitate the establishment and implementation of policies, procedures and standards and governance to ensure compliance.
Develops requirements and specifications according to professional standards and using business language familiar to core business units (
Human Resources, Finance, Operations, etc.).
Responsible for full life-cycle management of functional requirements and specifications, i.e. tracking through design to testing and implementation.
Decomposes high-level business requirements into functional requirements specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those who must base their work on the requirements.
Represents requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes or scenarios, where appropriate. 
Leads requirements analysis and verification efforts. Ensures that requirement statements conform to standards and are complete, consistent, concise, understandable, traceable, feasible, unambiguous and verifiable.  
Participates in peer reviews, inspects requirements documents and work products derived from requirements specifications. Ensures that requirements were interpreted correctly. Participates in requirements prioritization. Manages requirements and traceability information. Tracks requirements status throughout the project. 
Manages changes to baseline requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools. 
Ensures that proposed system features / requirements meet user needs and satisfy business objectives / initiatives.
Performs and coordinates User Acceptance testing, as required.
Develops training, and instructs business users on new capabilities.
Develops and executes presentations using MS PowerPoint that support the project, this may include regular Integrated Project Team (IPTs) presentations, monthly project status reports and/or executive briefings.
Plans daily activities within the guidelines of company policy, job description and supervisor’s instruction in such a way as to maximize personal output.
Responsible for aiding in own self-development by being available and receptive to all training made available by the company.
Responsible for keeping own immediate work area in a neat and orderly condition to ensure safety of self and coworkers. Will report any unsafe conditions and/or practices to the appropriate supervisor and human resources. Will immediately correct any unsafe conditions to the best of own ability.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or a related field of study and a minimum of eight (8) years’ relevant experience working with small and larger scale projects, or equivalent combination of education / experience. Must have experience with application domain knowledge. Experience with government contracting and procurement preferred.
PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification preferred
Lean/Six-Sigma certification a plus
ITIL and ISO experience a plus
Ability to plan and oversee projects through the use of project management software tools and methodologies, including MS Project, and MS Project Server
Knowledge of ServiceNow
Knowledge of Waterfall and Agile methodologies

description:
Sr. Product Manager, Technical
The Digital Product team is looking for someone passionate about changing the customer experience in the wireless industry and beyond. This role will be responsible for developing and executing on the strategy, roadmap and experiences used across T-Mobile's web and app platforms. The ideal candidate will have a customer-first mindset and be ready to bring innovation to how we interact with our customer. They will have excellent product instincts, passion for great mobile experiences, a data-centric mindset, and the willingness to do what it takes to change the industry and help us scale beyond wireless.
 The Sr. Product Manager, Technical will own the strategy, roadmap and execution of experiences for technical solutions to customer needs such as notifications, personalization, machine learning, data infrastructure, navigation, platform standards and patterns. We want you to:

title: Configuration Data Manager Specialist, Journeyman - PR 1745
description:
ESSENTIAL AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY: 
All areas of responsibility listed below are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position, with reasonable accommodation, if necessary. Work responsibilities may vary, depending upon assignment. Work located on Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, OH.   
    
    
  
  
 Assist in the review of program specifications for hardware and software; review engineering drawings and conduct in-process reviews; request nomenclature and Computer Program Identification Number (CPIN) assignment for Configuration Items (CIs); ensure marking of CI/Computer Software CIs (CSCIs) and associated documentation is accurate; and ensure appropriate documentation is approved and placed on contract for establishment/update of USG controlled baselines.  
 
 Aid in the review ECPs, CCPs, RFDs for format and content requirements.  
 Assist in the resolution of discrepancies and issues between the Government and weapon system Contractor; planning and scheduling of CCBs; prepare CCB briefings and documentation; and track implementation of approved changes.   
 
 Assist with the determination of CSA data base requirements; monitor data input; track the configuration of fielded systems and equipment; and monitor changes and status of configuration baseline documentation.    
 Establish and maintain effective professional working relationships with co-workers, and customers. 
 Follow policies and procedures as described in corporate manuals and directives. 
 Attend work each day during scheduled work hours unless on approved travel or time off. 
 Perform occasional travel to contractor and customer sites, as required (see WORKING CONDITIONS below). 
 Work flexible hours, including occasional overtime. 
 Carry out other duties as may be assigned or requested.   
WORKING CONDITIONS   
 
 May be required to travel using commercial air, USG air, and other conventional modes of transportation to Outside Continental United States and Continental United States (OCONUS and CONUS) locations in support of program meetings, reviews, audits and other activities held at Government and Contractor facilities.  
 Shall travel unaccompanied and unsupervised.  
 All travel (including plans, agenda, itinerary, and dates) require prior approval by the EPASS CO for OCONUS travel or COR for CONUS travel.  
 CONUS travel requests shall be submitted no later than ten business days prior to travel.  
 Shall notify the EPASS CO or COR of the costs of air travel, and receive prior written approval when the use of other than least costly air travel is required to complete a Government-directed task.  
 Shall submit a Trip Report upon return from travel. The trip report shall be submitted within 5 business days of return from earliest date of travel. At a minimum the trip report shall include: name of employee; date(s) of trip; site visited; trip purpose; relevant observations during trip.  
 Check for additional OCONUS Travel Requirements for FAR clauses 52.228-3 and 52.228-4 that apply to OCONUS travel.   
 
 Work is performed indoors with some potential risks to safety and health hazards related to electronics.   
QUALIFICATIONS: 
Education/Certifications/Experience/Skills: 
 BA/BS with 3-8 years’ directly related experience. 
 
 possess an active Secret clearance. 
 
 be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access), Microsoft Internet Explorer, and other standard (Customer specified) applications.) 
 
 be able to transport self to various facility sites, as required. If using own motor vehicle, must possess a valid driver’s license and proof of insurance. 
Physical Skills and Abilities: 
 May require lifting up to 25 pounds. 
 Requires visual acuity to use a keyboard.
