title: Project Manager - IT
description:
The Project Manager - IT manages, plans and coordinates the full life-cycle of projects for the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (PBGC). This position ensures that all project goals and objectives are accomplished as laid out in the scope of work and within the prescribed timeframe, budgetary parameters and to the customer’s satisfaction. Provides project team leadership necessary to meet defined project deliverables and maintains positive working relationships with the customer and key stakeholders. The Project Manager - IT utilizes subject matter expertise to analyze and evaluate business functions, systems and processes in order to determine the most effective business applications for meeting the needs of PBGC objectives.
Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Responsible for the integration of CNI Core Competencies into daily functions, including: commitment to integrity, knowledge / quality of work, supporting financial goals of the company, initiative / motivation, cooperation / relationships, problem analysis / discretion, accomplishing goals through organization, positive oral / written communication skills, leadership abilities, commitment to Affirmative Action, reliability / dependability, flexibility and ownership / accountability of actions taken.
Manages and communicates project expectations to team members.
Builds and maintains solid customer relationships, and assures customer satisfaction with the successful execution of the project. This position will be most successful when a high degree of organizational aptitude is present along with a high level of enthusiasm and a strong drive to achieve outcomes using indirect resources.
Interfaces with internal project teams, management, customers and subcontractors. Maintains timely communications, and develops collaborative rapport with solutions-oriented approaches.
Effectively manages the project scope, deliverables, cost, profitability, schedule, quality and resources.
Develops IT project plans in MicroSoft Project and within PBGC tools to guide the execution and control of the project, and tracks project milestones and deliverables.
Communicates IT project plans, objectives, timelines, schedules, job assignments and responsibilities.
Identifies and manages project dependencies and critical path. Proactively manages changes in project scope. Identifies and communicates potential risks with CNI and customer leadership, and devises mitigations and contingency plans.  Identifies issues and devises work-arounds.
Implements industry best practices, project management tools and methodologies.
Effectively leads tool selection and procurement for solutions to meet the business requirements in project scope.  Responsible for solution implementation planning, design, installation, modification, and operation of information systems capabilities. Ensures that the software and related products satisfy the needs and requirements of the customer.
May be required to facilitate the establishment and implementation of policies, procedures and standards and governance to ensure compliance.
Develops requirements and specifications according to professional standards and using business language familiar to core business units (
Human Resources, Finance, Operations, etc.).
Responsible for full life-cycle management of functional requirements and specifications, i.e. tracking through design to testing and implementation.
Decomposes high-level business requirements into functional requirements specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those who must base their work on the requirements.
Represents requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes or scenarios, where appropriate. 
Leads requirements analysis and verification efforts. Ensures that requirement statements conform to standards and are complete, consistent, concise, understandable, traceable, feasible, unambiguous and verifiable.  
Participates in peer reviews, inspects requirements documents and work products derived from requirements specifications. Ensures that requirements were interpreted correctly. Participates in requirements prioritization. Manages requirements and traceability information. Tracks requirements status throughout the project. 
Manages changes to baseline requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools. 
Ensures that proposed system features / requirements meet user needs and satisfy business objectives / initiatives.
Performs and coordinates User Acceptance testing, as required.
Develops training, and instructs business users on new capabilities.
Develops and executes presentations using MS PowerPoint that support the project, this may include regular Integrated Project Team (IPTs) presentations, monthly project status reports and/or executive briefings.
Plans daily activities within the guidelines of company policy, job description and supervisor’s instruction in such a way as to maximize personal output.
Responsible for aiding in own self-development by being available and receptive to all training made available by the company.
Responsible for keeping own immediate work area in a neat and orderly condition to ensure safety of self and coworkers. Will report any unsafe conditions and/or practices to the appropriate supervisor and human resources. Will immediately correct any unsafe conditions to the best of own ability.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or a related field of study and a minimum of eight (8) years’ relevant experience working with small and larger scale projects, or equivalent combination of education / experience. Must have experience with application domain knowledge. Experience with government contracting and procurement preferred.
PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification preferred
Lean/Six-Sigma certification a plus
ITIL and ISO experience a plus
Ability to plan and oversee projects through the use of project management software tools and methodologies, including MS Project, and MS Project Server
Knowledge of ServiceNow
Knowledge of Waterfall and Agile methodologies
Knowledge of Federal government projects and operations in a consulting environment
Knowledge of different strategies to successfully implement IT capabilities
Knowledge designing and documenting technical solutions
Knowledge of deployments of COTS products, as either a PM or a technical team member
Fluency in both technical issues and business processes, such as procurement, finance, and budget
Knowledge of configuration, reporting, query building, and common security frameworks
Knowledge of both Windows and Unix based tools preferred
Knowledge of both local and cloud-based deployments
Ability to perform many different roles, both at a detailed level and from a higher-level perspective
Ability to schedule, plan and lead meetings
Exceptional organization skills with ability to effectively manage multiple projects and priorities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with solid presentation skills
Ability to clearly and concisely communicate / explain technical information to a broad range of people with varying levels of technical expertise
Excellent customer service skills
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Knowledgeable in the analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system requirement specifications
Advanced ability in requirements gathering and elaboration, business process improvement and emerging technologies
Extremely detail-oriented with ability to quickly grasp business needs and issues
Ability to mentor and instruct others
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Skilled in facilitating teamwork and coordinating efforts for the successful achievement of goals

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

title: Sr. Mgr., Technical Accounting & Compliance
description:
SENIOR MANAGER, TECHNICAL ACCOUNTING & COMPLIANACE 
West Hills, CA 
HELP US BRING THE GIFT OF HEALTH TO LIFE. 
Working at Pharmavite is an experience like no other. With a focus on complete nutrition for all, each endeavor is urgent and everyday counts. You'll have the opportunity to work on the #1 selling national vitamin and supplement brand, Nature Made, as well as an exciting portfolio of other products that are shaping the future of the healthy living industry. Consumer-driven innovation, high quality products and a promising portfolio, all driven by a team with a shared sense of purpose -- that's Pharmavite. Join us to bring the gift of health to life. 
THE ROLE 
The Senior Manager, Technical Accounting & Compliance is responsible for the company's external financial reporting, all aspects of financial compliance and transformation of our accounting processes. This role is the right hand to the controller and will be highly visible to senior management through audit management and leadership in the redesign and strengthening of accounting processes to contribute to operational effectiveness and efficiency. Senior Manager, Technical Accounting & Compliance reports to DVP, Corporate Controller and manages a team of six.  
At Pharmavite, every employee has a stake in bringing the gift of health to life. We never shy away from disruptive innovation and tough challenges, because we're making real nutrition accessible to consumers everywhere in new and different ways. And because we know every nutriment, we make matters, we must make sure each one is just right before we make it ready for use. With this great responsibility comes the satisfaction that your contribution makes a real and significant difference. 
Critical contributions this role is counted on to deliver include: 
 
*   Identifies and implements transformational accounting process improvements and process enhancements that drive operational efficiency 
*   Responsibility for financial statement and disclosure reporting to Parent Company in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) 
*   Interpret and apply accounting guidance and literature in partnership with DVP, Corporate Controller  
*   Oversee internal and external audits 
*   Leads and develops team  
The ideal candidate is business oriented, skilled at leading projects and teams through change. You are proactive with problem identification and remediation solutions and passionate about identifying process efficiencies and improvements that are balanced with a sound control environment. 
You'll be most successful in this role if you have:  
 
*   Hands on experience analyzing and implementing new accounting standards including documenting statement of positions that were successfully audited  
*   Strong planning, project management and analytical skills 
*   Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to interact and build relationships across all levels of the organization and externally 
*   Previous experience in successfully elevating the team to become strategic thinkers and partners, and subject matter experts 
*   Deep knowledge of IFRS/GAAP and SOX/JSOX  
It's an exciting time in Pharmavite' s history. After 45 years of leading the healthy living industry with award-winning vitamins and supplements, the company has experienced great success and has gained the trust of consumers, healthcare professionals, and retailers alike. But there's more growth ahead of us than behind us, and for our employees this translates into opportunity. Our rapidly changing business enables employees to take on new challenges and transform Pharmavite for the future. 
In order to take on these challenges, you'll need to have: 
 
*   Minimum of 8 to 10 years combined experience with a public accounting firm (Big 4 highly preferred) and Corporate Accounting preferably in consumer products or a manufacturing environment  
*   Minimum three years of managerial experience 
*   Certified Public Accountant 
*   Comprehensive knowledge and practical application of GAAP/IFRS and JSOX/J-SOX 
*   Familiarity with corporate federal and multi-state tax regulations  
OUR OFFER 
Here, career paths aren't predefined, and bureaucratic limitations don't exist -- you have the opportunity to grow, learn from industry pioneers, and develop the way you want to. Pharmavite is investing more in the development of our team -- to help us deliver on our purpose and help you achieve your career aspirations. Our environment is geared to fuel curiosity, encourage experimentation, and generate learning as this is the way we develop ourselves and our organization. 
Pharmavite is committed to meeting the needs of our employees and their families with a Total Rewards package that's as comprehensive as the vitamins and supplements we deliver to consumers. With competitive compensation programs and standout benefits, we provide employees with optimal health and well-being -- as well as peace of mind. These rewards -- plus our new recognition program -- ensure employees feel supported both at work and home. 
  
Visit Pharmavite.com/careers to learn more about our mission and discover an opportunity that's right for you. Health and wellness begin with us.  
Pharmavite is an equal employment and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran or disabled status, or any protected status. We do not discriminate in employment based on race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other basis covered by applicable law. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.  
Disclaimer 
The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications of employees assigned to this job.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Infrastructure Delivery Manager
description:
We are seeking for an Infrastructure Project/Delivery Manager (DM) who is responsible for delivering high quality infrastructure build projects on time in accordance with FCA application and technology guidelines.
 
This role will be assigned to support build activities for multiple simultaneous global, strategic, cross functional projects that are complex and occasionally multi-year development projects. The DM will be responsible for assuring that best practices, tools, and infrastructure standards are being leveraged for all projects.The DM's focus is on meeting project commitments, including communications with stakeholders. The DM leads technical activities demonstrating the ability to influence outcomes. Successful DM's have the ability to adapt quickly, problem solve and demand a high level of professionalism.Delivery Managers will manage the planning of new server builds (virtual and physical), the replacement of old server hardware, installation of new hardware, server decommissions, and environment enhancements, and operating system software upgrades. Build sites include local data center and remote locations (travel to the site not required).Duties include: manage build projects and schedules, coordinate completion of all build and configuration documentation, coordinate agile and expedited builds, manage server build cutovers, oversee software upgrade projects. The Delivery Manager will ensure server build documentation is correct and assist with troubleshooting any build issues during build verification and testing. Must have the ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines.Manage vendor relationship and build task completion.Hold resources accountable for deliverables, quality, and due dates, escalating as appropriate and necessaryProactively and effectively manage project riskConflict resolution
Strong knowledge of IT Infrastructure components and how they interrelate to form a cohesive, end to end solutionExperience with building Windows/Unix serversAbility to deliver complex assignments in a fast paced, intense environment with minimal supervisionDemonstrates initiative to explore new technology, processes and methodsExcellent organizational, oral and written communication skills with an ability to interact with all levels of the organization in a professional, diplomatic and tactful mannerA consultative team player that can assess conflicting view points and opinions but has an ability to rationally assess alternatives and clearly articulate recommendations to managementProficient in MS Office, GSuite, Lotus Notes
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/universityExposure to ServiceNowExposure to Agile, SCRUMExposure to DevOps operating model
 
Interested applicants may click the apply button or you may call us at (248) 936-0649 for faster processing. Thank you.

title: Lab Tech Manager
description:
Under minimal direction, this position serves as the technical subject matter expert and is responsible for the technical oversight of laboratory services. Ensures Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) regulations are in place for the manufacturing processes including SOPs, training and competency, and error management.
Bachelor's degree required.

title: Transit Asset Management, Business Systems Manager
Technical Project Managers in Brooklyn, NY.
description:
35 hours a week
Long-term contract (Potential 5 years)
Must be U.S. Citizen OR Green Card Holder
Required to travel every day with in the five boroughs of NYC - No travel reimbursement.
Prefer candidates to provide their own laptop with Microsoft Office and also a cell phone.
Prepares definition/scope/requirements.
Plans, directs, and manages the Data / telecom circuit migration project.
Communicates effectively including presenting complex technical matters to non-technical individuals.
Creates and manages project plans and compiles input from technical resources, management and vendor to refine the project plan.
Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with a diverse workforce, community and other governmental agencies.
Assists in the development, planning, and implementation of new projects and technology in order to meet the overall strategic goals of the organization.
Conducts complex studies and surveys of management and methods in order to evaluate and recommend changes to existing projects and tasks to meet the compliance and policy objectives set forth by management.
Ensures that The Director of Enterprise Deployment & Implementation and other senior managers receive timely project status updates.
Represents the division at external meetings related to project coordination with internal resources as they apply to the delivery of technical services.
Holds standing meetings, produces agenda, meeting minutes and action items.
Documents risks, issue and problem’s, updates status and resolution to stakeholder and members of the project.
Updates appropriates projects related documents and documents findings and prepare reports.
Creates and distributes as needed project reports providing Status, risks, issues and other information needed by management and stakeholders.
Manages projects independently and prioritizes work assignments accordingly.
Multi-tasks daily in a fast paced environment.
Provides project updates to SQL/VBA database and pulls reports from Telecom Deployment and Operations database as needed.
 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be able to read, understand and apply technical standards.
Understanding of network technologies such as MDF, IDF, Router, Servers, Switches, Wireless Access Points, Fiber and Copper cabling. 
Must be able to understand, interpret, relay and conduct technical network discussions
Proficiency in the following tools (Word and Excel)
Project Management Professional Certification (PMP) is desirable
Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
6+ years of experience in the following:
Related voice/data network.
Demonstrated project management knowledge and experience in telecommunication and data industry.
5+ years of experience with the following:
Successful teamwork experience and demonstrated leadership abilities in telecom and educational industry.
Field project management of installation of IP telephone system with Mitel, NEC, etc.
Database management with updating and making edits to project management database (SQL/VBA Data Base).

title: Manager, Biostatistics, Medical Affairs
description:
Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an international biopharmaceutical company focused on improving patients’ lives by identifying, developing and commercializing meaningful products that address unmet medical needs. We are continuing to expand our commercial product portfolio and our research and development pipeline in therapeutic areas that can leverage our unique expertise.
Our therapeutic areas of focus include sleep and hematology/oncology – areas in which we have a deep understanding of the patient journey and a suite of products and product candidates to address critical needs.
We are looking for the best and brightest talent to join our team.  If you’re looking to be a part of a company with an unwavering commitment to improving patients’ lives and being a great place to work, we hope you’ll explore our career openings and get to know Jazz Pharmaceuticals. 
The 
 will be functioning as a project level statistician. The role is responsible for developing, coordinating, performing, and validating all statistical analyses in support of Medical Affairs, inclusive of overseeing the work of statistics and programming for external vendors as needed.

title: Staff Operational Capacity Planner
description:
Intuit's Customer Success team is transforming the industry with a suite of high-touch professional services powered by data-driven, technology-led operations and a distributed professional workforce. 
As a Global Sales and Operations Planning Manager, you will be the change agent to progressing Intuit’s journey from creator of best in class tax and accounting software to acknowledged leader in solving financial problems for customers and powering their prosperity by connecting people to experts.
As a Global Sales and Operations Planning Manager within Intuit Customer Success unit you will have a key focus on quickly adapting to changing business environment, being agile in managing the change, and driving cross functional alignment on the plans while leveraging machine learning and data science principles to build efficient end to end Sales and Operations Planning processes and governance model that improves process efficiency to develop optimal plans.

title: Web Content Lead/ Manager
description:
We have an urgent job opening of Web Content Strategist/ Specialist
 please check below job description and share your resume ASAP.
 
 
 
SUMMARY:
The Lead, Web Content Strategy leads the development and implementation of web content strategy, standards and best practices for the customer-facing extranet and associate-facing intranet and/or other web/digital channels. Exceptional content management and strategy, web writing and client relationship management skills required.
This individual will serve as the day-to-day Strategic Communications partner to the website Product team, Change Management and Business Owners (stakeholders) to ensure that content is high quality and effectively delivered. S/he acts as brand strategist and steward and will lead the development, maintenance and implementation of web content strategy that supports brand and business strategic goals including efforts to position the organization as a leading provider of technology solutions and services to the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association’s Federal Employee Program®.
The individual will work with cross-functional teams throughout the organization to ensure that all web-based communications goals are clearly defined and met. S/he must have the ability to work independently to manage multiple projects while keeping all stakeholders informed of progress and aware of potential problems. S/he must be able to think strategically, apply critical thinking and guide others.
 include, but are not limited to, the following:
40% Defines the brand’s web content strategy and standards, aligning to brand strategy and organizational strategic vision and goals.
Serves as brand content strategist, responsible for ensuring that web content is relevant, high quality and well-organized throughout the sites. Ensures content meets best practices for web writing and is consistent with the organizational style guide, in compliance with legal and branding regulations, and in alignment with brand and business strategies.
Mentors and coaches other Strategic Communications team members to ensure that content meets brand standards, content style guides, web writing best practices and site standards.
Creates content and/or edits content to support site updates and new pages. Understands business owner needs and balances those with brand strategy objectives, standards and site capabilities to develop effective solutions to content initiatives.
10% Collaborates with product managers, UX/UI, web content administrator, website administrator and developers to enhance the user experience and relevance of websites to ensure the right content gets to the right audience at the right time.
Participates in scrum meetings, content audits, information architecture and taxonomy projects, or other projects related to website content organization, reorganization or content publishing models. Represents brand strategy, communications and marketing perspective.
20% Supports content publishing/production efforts, working with website administrator and web producers to ensure high-quality and timely completion of content workflows. Collaborates on the development of a Quality Assurance process for web production workflows ensuring strong partnership between the Strategic Communications brand unit and Product team.
20% Utilizes client leadership skills and partners with digital teams to create consistency of content across each site and support content requirements, changes and client needs. Manages client projects, tracks and reports status, informing and engaging stakeholders throughout the process. Must be a skilled at managing client relationships and expectations, and aligning stakeholder needs with overall business and brand strategy needs to develop effective solutions.
10% Other tasks related to the development, implementation and maintenance of content strategy or brand standards for internal and customer-facing brand communication objectives, as assigned.
This role does not have direct supervisory responsibility. However, this individual will need to exhibit strong influencing and negotiating skills, be able to work collaboratively across matrixed teams, and coach and mentor less experienced members of the team.
SCOPE DATA:
This role does not have budgetary responsibility. However, this individual will be accountable to work with other members of the Strategic Communications team to positively impact brand strategy, customer experience with the organization, and stakeholder experience with our team.
Required
 
 required with a minimum of five to seven years of website content management, five years of experience in a corporate marketing setting and 3 to 5 years of progressively responsible web project management experience. Candidate should have experience in writing and editing for internal and external web audiences. Knowledge of content management systems is required. This position requires excellent organization skills and communications expertise. Also required is outstanding interpersonal skills, prioritization skills, outstanding customer service and excellent attention to detail. Knowledge of basic website development standards is desired to understand the impact content changes will have throughout the site/s.
Abilities/Skills
Must have the ability to work independently to manage multiple projects while keeping content owners informed of the progress of their general web edits and aware of any potential problems. Must be able to think globally and understand how content edits on one area of any particular web property may impact other areas of and/or related websites. The ability to communicate challenges in a non-technical manner to internal content/business owners is important.
The successful candidate is required to possess:
• Proficiency with web content management systems (Liferay, SharePoint, etc.).
• Strong experience and background with web content writing.
• Proficiency in the MS Office Suite, particularly Word and Excel.
• Excellent independent and teamwork skills.
• Must be able to effectively work in a fast-paced environment with frequently changing priorities, deadlines, and workloads that can be variable for long periods of time. Must be able to meet established deadlines and handle multiple customer service demands from internal and external customers, within set expectations for service excellence. Must be able to effectively communicate and provide positive customer service to every internal and external customer, including customers who may be demanding or otherwise challenging.
Preferred
• Exceptional writing, copyediting and proofreading skills. Proven ability to create web content that translates complex subject matter into relevant, accessible, clear and concise content.
• Expertise with web writing best practices and adhering to editorial style guides.
• Proven success developing and implementing content strategies for complex websites.
• Ability to align web content to brand and business strategy.
• Advanced knowledge of the content landscape, including but not limited to content strategy and creation, content marketing and content management.
• Ability to establish strong relationships across departments, and develop and understanding of client needs, the customer experience, marketing strategy and operational capabilities.
• Strong skills working with matrixed teams, clients or independently to complete initiatives.
• Superb client management and customer service skills, including producing clear correspondence and the ability to articulate strategies and solutions in meetings.
• Familiarity with taxonomy, web content organization, information architecture and user experience.
• Keen attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and manage a variety of tasks simultaneously; sometimes under pressure and often with tight deadlines.
• Adaptable to change and able to tackle unfamiliar tasks with positive attitude and resourcefulness.
• Ability to work comfortably under pressure and to organize, track, and manage multiple tasks and deadlines, including development of project schedules and timelines.
• Ability to learn quickly and respond quickly to changing priorities, while being dedicated to ushering work through to completion.
• History of tackling and solving complex challenges quickly and creatively.
• Confluence, JIRA or other project management software is a plus.
• Experience managing content strategy and leading the writing of all new content for full website redesigns is a plus.
• Familiarity with content operations models is a plus.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The employee is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The employee must frequently talk and hear. Weights of up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the position successfully. Requirements may be modified to accommodate individuals with disabilities.
1st – Phone, 2nd - Skype 
: Washington, DC
 
 – Lumen Solutions offers competitive compensation package as well as an array of benefits matching with current industry standard based on experience and qualifications.

Participates in scrum meetings, content audits, information architecture and taxonomy projects, or other projects related to website content organization, reorganization or content publishing models. Represents brand strategy, communications and marketing perspective.
20% Supports content publishing/production efforts, working with website administrator and web producers to ensure high-quality and timely completion of content workflows. Collaborates on the development of a Quality Assurance process for web production workflows ensuring strong partnership between the Strategic Communications brand unit and Product team.
20% Utilizes client leadership skills and partners with digital teams to create consistency of content across each site and support content requirements, changes and client needs. Manages client projects, tracks and reports status, informing and engaging stakeholders throughout the process. Must be a skilled at managing client relationships and expectations, and aligning stakeholder needs with overall business and brand strategy needs to develop effective solutions.
10% Other tasks related to the development, implementation and maintenance of content strategy or brand standards for internal and customer-facing brand communication objectives, as assigned.
This role does not have direct supervisory responsibility. However, this individual will need to exhibit strong influencing and negotiating skills, be able to work collaboratively across matrixed teams, and coach and mentor less experienced members of the team.
SCOPE DATA:
This role does not have budgetary responsibility. However, this individual will be accountable to work with other members of the Strategic Communications team to positively impact brand strategy, customer experience with the organization, and stakeholder experience with our team.
Required
 
 required with a minimum of five to seven years of website content management, five years of experience in a corporate marketing setting and 3 to 5 years of progressively responsible web project management experience. Candidate should have experience in writing and editing for internal and external web audiences. Knowledge of content management systems is required. This position requires excellent organization skills and communications expertise. Also required is outstanding interpersonal skills, prioritization skills, outstanding customer service and excellent attention to detail. Knowledge of basic website development standards is desired to understand the impact content changes will have throughout the site/s.
Abilities/Skills
Must have the ability to work independently to manage multiple projects while keeping content owners informed of the progress of their general web edits and aware of any potential problems. Must be able to think globally and understand how content edits on one area of any particular web property may impact other areas of and/or related websites. The ability to communicate challenges in a non-technical manner to internal content/business owners is important.
The successful candidate is required to possess:
• Proficiency with web content management systems (Liferay, SharePoint, etc.).
• Strong experience and background with web content writing.
• Proficiency in the MS Office Suite, particularly Word and Excel.
• Excellent independent and teamwork skills.
• Must be able to effectively work in a fast-paced environment with frequently changing priorities, deadlines, and workloads that can be variable for long periods of time. Must be able to meet established deadlines and handle multiple customer service demands from internal and external customers, within set expectations for service excellence. Must be able to effectively communicate and provide positive customer service to every internal and external customer, including customers who may be demanding or otherwise challenging.
Preferred
• Exceptional writing, copyediting and proofreading skills. Proven ability to create web content that translates complex subject matter into relevant, accessible, clear and concise content.
• Expertise with web writing best practices and adhering to editorial style guides.
• Proven success developing and implementing content strategies for complex websites.
• Ability to align web content to brand and business strategy.
• Advanced knowledge of the content landscape, including but not limited to content strategy and creation, content marketing and content management.
• Ability to establish strong relationships across departments, and develop and understanding of client needs, the customer experience, marketing strategy and operational capabilities.
• Strong skills working with matrixed teams, clients or independently to complete initiatives.
• Superb client management and customer service skills, including producing clear correspondence and the ability to articulate strategies and solutions in meetings.
• Familiarity with taxonomy, web content organization, information architecture and user experience.
• Keen attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and manage a variety of tasks simultaneously; sometimes under pressure and often with tight deadlines.
• Adaptable to change and able to tackle unfamiliar tasks with positive attitude and resourcefulness.
• Ability to work comfortably under pressure and to organize, track, and manage multiple tasks and deadlines, including development of project schedules and timelines.
• Ability to learn quickly and respond quickly to changing priorities, while being dedicated to ushering work through to completion.
• History of tackling and solving complex challenges quickly and creatively.
• Confluence, JIRA or other project management software is a plus.
• Experience managing content strategy and leading the writing of all new content for full website redesigns is a plus.
• Familiarity with content operations models is a plus.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The employee is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The employee must frequently talk and hear. Weights of up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the position successfully. Requirements may be modified to accommodate individuals with disabilities.

title: Senior IT Internal Auditor
description:
Publicly traded eCommerce company in Broward county seeking to hire a Senior IT Internal Auditor immediately due to growth. This company offers the most amazing career track and work culture. If you're looking to join a stable and exciting company, this is it!

•Plan, perform, and report on assigned audit engagements related to Cyber, Privacy, IT SOX and operational audits
•Perform interviews, conduct fieldwork, and develop audit work papers to support findings and recommendations
•Evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls and compliance with corporate policies and procedures

•Communicate with audit leaders to identify technology control risks to improve process effectiveness

title: IT Audit, Senior
description:
The CVS Health Internal Audit team prides itself on attracting talent with a broad set of expertise from prior internal and external audit, information technology, finance and other operational areas.   With a direct line to the Audit Committee, the Board of Directors and full support from Senior Leadership, our team plays a vital role in providing independent assurance over the Company’s most critical business and technology processes.  Our audit deliverables provide valuable insight to the executive management team and play a key role in improving our control posture as an organization. 
As a Senior Internal IT Auditor you would perform complex and comprehensive IT audits in conformance with professional auditing standards. In your role as IT auditor you will use advanced audit and internal control concepts and techniques to identify business and IT processes, risks, and controls. As an IT auditor, you will be responsible for assessing and reporting on the adequacy and effectiveness of CVS Health’s internal controls and the quality of performance in carrying out assigned responsibilities. Responsibilities include reviewing and evaluating: (1) the reliability and integrity of information, (2) compliance with strategic plans, policies, procedures, laws, and regulations, (3) the safeguarding of assets, (4) the economical and efficient uses of resources, (5) the accomplishment of established objectives and goals for operations or programs, and (6) the CVS Health’s IT systems to determine if they are appropriately managed, controlled, and protected.
3+ years of IT Auditing, Controls Assessment, Control Validation experience, or relevant experience.
Ability to effectively communicate IT technical issues, findings and recommendations (both written and verbal). 
Must be able to handle confidential information appropriately. 
Excellent project management skills, including the ability to routinely multi-task. 
Experience working in teams.
Experience in Big 4 Accounting, IT Audit or Management Consulting preferred.
Professional certification such as:
•Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
•Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)
•Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC)
•Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
•Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
•Certified Internal Auditor (CIA)
Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science or relevant field.
Advanced degree such as MBA or MS a plus.
 Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.
   At CVS Health, we work every day to help people on their path to better health. Never has it been more important for us to deliver on our purpose to our valued customers, patients, members, and employees. With a presence in communities across the country, CVS Health colleagues are and will continue to be a critical piece of the country’s health care solution. The health and safety of our employees, patients, customers, and members is our top priority as we face the impact of COVID-19 together. If you would like to learn about the actions we are taking as a company as we learn more about COVID-19 and its spread, we encourage you to visit our COVID-19 resource center at 
 We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.
 CVS Health is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Gender/Ethnicity/Disability/Protected Veteran – we highly value and are committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities. title: Technology Development Manager
description:
As an integral part of the University of Chicago Polsky Center’s Tech Commercialization team, the Technology Development Manager develops and manages strong relationships with faculty across the University. The Manager actively solicits and evaluates inventions and software arising from University research for intellectual property protection and commercial potential, prioritizing projects according to commercial opportunities and revenue requirements. Technology Development Managers are responsible for a diverse portfolio of technologies and work in a growing team of patent, contract, business development, and entrepreneurship specialists to protect and license inventions to existing companies and startups. New hires are expected to develop strong relationships with inventors, legal counsel, prospective and current licensees, and Polsky Center colleagues to promote the mission of the University of Chicago and its Polsky Center to catalyze ideas into impact. 
1. Promote the mission and business of the University of Chicago’s Polsky Center through the development of strong relationships with inventors (mainly faculty members), legal counsel, prospective and actual licensees, and Polsky Center colleagues.
2. Screen inventions; evaluate and decide which inventions and software to pursue.
3. Work as part of a team to manage patent prosecution for selected inventions.
4. Work with Tech Commercialization market intelligence team members to develop and execute marketing plans for inventions and software.
5. Work with Tech Commercialization business development team members to negotiate and execute intellectual property licenses and other agreements, such as confidentiality and material transfer agreements, as well as those between research institutions.
6. Work with Operations data management and compliance team members on data collection, reporting, and compliance related to invention disclosures, patents, and agreements.
7. Keep up to date on the latest regulations related to technology transfer compliance.
8. Other responsibilities as assigned. 
 
 
1. Excellent customer service and relationship skills, particularly with academic faculty members
2. Knowledge of intellectual property
3. Excellent analytical and computational skills
4. Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
5. Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communications
6. Attention to detail with clear understanding of how to prioritize workload appropriately
7. Ability to work well under pressure and manage multi-task projects
8. Ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative
9. Ability to work effectively within a team
10. Ability to maintain confidentiality
11. Proficiency with computers 
 
1. Advanced degree in chemistry, materials science, physics, biology, computer science, bioengineering, molecular engineering, chemical engineering or related discipline preferred 
1. Resume
2. Cover Letter

title: Project Manager Jobs in Warren NJ | IT Job Recruiters
Jr. Project Manager - IT Change Management, Pharma, Biotech
Project Manager Jobs in Warren NJ | IT Job Recruiters
Project Manager-Application Development
description:
EM wants to see the following:
 
 
PLUS:
Research and early development experience. Chemistry or bio therapeutics or small molecule development or translation medicine experience.. Systems and applications supporting the Laboratory equipment.
 
This is a Senior Project / Program Manager position and will be accountable for managing day to day deliverables associated with one or more projects within IT Projects and Programs, and will work closely with the IT Program Manager and Business partners. Specific activities may include: developing schedules; running project team meetings; developing and maintaining project status; organizing and leading teams to ensure deliverables and timelines are met per project objectives and schedules; and pro-actively raising key issues/risks to project stakeholders, then driving the associated follow-ups and resolutions. Individual should have strong verbal and written communication skills, be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and be able to effectively manage competing priorities.
 
 Role Description:
 * Responsible for project management, coordination, execution, and control of IT deliverables, in a rapidly changing environment
 * Work closely with business functions to: understand their needs; ensure alignment to timelines and costs; and track mutual dependencies
 * Collaborate with multi-functional and virtual teams across IT, Business functions, Vendors and Service Providers
 * Able to help identify and triage new issues for criticality and ownership
 * Schedule and facilitate meetings and or work sessions to ensure team alignment
 
 Expected Areas of Competence:
 * Ability to conceptualize Projects/Programs from start to finish to effectively manage and align to schedule while adapting to sudden changes and shifting priorities
 * Delivers cost-effective, high quality Projects or Programs on-time through application of PM guidelines and standards (best practices) and effective controls while meeting requisite compliance requirements
 * Demonstrates effective Project Management skills through the development of project plans, resource allocation, plan execution, consistent communications with project team members and stakeholders, status reviews, and delivery of agreed upon results
 * Achieves effective control on the Project or Program through management of scope, estimating, accounting, budget management, risk management and project closeout
 * Demonstrated ability to establish strong working relationships with team members, creates and motivates cross-functional & cross-departmental project teams, establishes roles and responsibilities, provides direction and fosters effective team skills to complete tasks on time
 * Ability to complete multiple, simultaneous projects with minimal supervision and prioritize incoming work appropriately
 * Ability to understand project interdependencies within a program, where relevant, and drive the project level work accordingly
 * Strong communication skills allowing the candidate to serve as a primary point of contact for communications across the groups (Biopharma IT, Business teams and any third party involved in the Project or Program), effectively communicating relevant information to key stakeholders as per the defined Communications plan
 * Demonstrates innovation, flexibility, open-mindedness, and adaptability in order to meet objectives in a rapidly changing environment with shifting priorities
 * Demonstrates the ability to effectively lead
 * Demonstrates the ability to drive results
 
 
 Desired Experience:
 * Experienced in managing Projects or Programs by leveraging standard industry Project Management frameworks (e.g. - PMBOK) and Software Development Lifecycle methodology (e.g. - Agile, Waterfall, etc.)
 * Demonstrated ability to manage project teams in a complex, changing environment to deliver value-added results to the organization
 * Demonstrated ability to work with a range of technically, culturally & geographically diverse teams in a matrixed environment, influencing them to complete deliverables, and delivering value added business results that meet high quality requirements within tight deadlines
 * Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate to a diverse audience at multiple levels within the company through various formats, such as presentations, written proposals, reports, correspondence, leading meetings, face-to-face dialogue etc.,

description:

Job Description
 
 
Location: Bellevue, WA

The client Product Team is looking for a highly skilled Senior Technical Program Manager that will be explicitly dedicated to growing client's  IoT and Emerging Product Portfolio; this individual will take explicit ownership of the end to end Software Development Lifecycle, build a path to support existing and future Product and Commercial objectives and ultimately enable client customers to successfully adopt new client technologies.
 
The ideal candidate will be very comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and will bring existing knowledge of releases across Consumer Apps / HW, Enterprise Software, and Product Performance Analytics.
 
- Understand the capabilities and value propositions of the current product and roadmap and the resulting client technical solution opportunities, and challenges.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
We are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of shipping big data and machine learning based data products into production. Are you technical? Are you passionate about helping those around you be more effective? Do you think about technology as a way to increase efficiency and change how business operates? We are looking for candidates that share our passion for tackling complexity head-on, to help build platforms that can scale through multiple orders of magnitude. As a Technical Program Manager, you will play a key role within engineering, driving huge projects that span the organization. You contribute to the technical strategy, design choices, and decisions for a product or service. You are accountable for the planning, execution, and delivery of projects from inception to completion, related to an existing technology product or program. You proactively manage the end-to-end delivery of engineering work through the Global Digital engineering organization and all dependent organizations, reporting out progress, ensuring dependencies are covered. You operate between teams and architectures overseeing the gaps between teams, processes, and systems, while removing all blocking issues leading to a successful delivery. You should be comfortable with ambiguity with a desire to create, iterate and improve.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate your technical chops, while defining and driving program initiatives and using your technical knowledge to work with the engineering teams to deliver. Thinking strategically and tactically along with being innovative, an exemplary leader, an excellent communicator, influencer, and working with a premier team will help you be successful in the role. Leading and navigating cross-functional efforts should come naturally, along with having tried and true experience partnering with marketing and engineering teams to synthesize a variety of technologies and capabilities into high quality simple products and features that customers' love. You will need to be a smart risk taker, who can deliver big ideas as well as transform them into scalable programs. This position has exposure to senior members of the organization, where you would be preparing documentation for senior executives and align roadmaps with organizational objectives.
- Accountable for managing the lifecycle for a complex cross functional body of work that has a long term positive impact on the company
- Establish collaborative and productive relationships with product management, governance, UX design, vendors and other supporting teams.
- Foster an environment of engineering excellence and innovation. Insist on designing to the edge.
- Works closely with development teams to build and launch new products, features and programs.
- Define and organize the program, outline tenets, analyze data, drive performance improvements, and influence resource allocation for all stages of execution (from ideation to delivery)
- Be the scrum master for your team. Own planning, standups, demos, retrospectives and the execution of your sprints. Removes blockers and always find the path forward in challenging situations
- Keep technical debt in check. Ensure teams are building using modern practices and tools. Recognize and act of your responsibility for driving change for the entire development community.
- Cultivate operational excellence within your teams. Understand service level agreements (SLA) and how your systems are performing in relation to them. Ensure your systems self-report breaches and understand root cause. Insist that your teams provide timely resolution of identified production defects.
- Mentor and grow your people. Create an environment of individual accountability. People grow to meet expectations. Yours should be high.
- Operate successfully in ambiguous environments.
- Communicate upward and outward
- Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline (preferably computer science) or equivalent experience
- 7 years of software engineering, systems engineering or similar experience, in addition to 3-5 years of project/program management experience and working directly with software development teams.
- 3+ years of experience organizing, planning and executing engineering to ship big data and advanced analytics solutions to production.
- Strong analytical and quantitative skills; Data driven and results-oriented
- Communication skills and experience working with technical and business management teams.
- Organizational and coordination skills along with multi-tasking capabilities to get things done in an environment.
- Ability to motivate and focus a collaboration to reach challenging goals.
- Interpersonal skills, including relationship building and collaboration within a diverse, cross-functional team.
- Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and recommendations.
- Demonstrated past experience in defining and measuring team success via data-driven metrics & reporting
- Experience delivering with an agile methodology is a must.
- Experience of building and launching a new data products rom the ground up and/or experience with customer facing production systems preferred.

title: Incident Manager
description:
Qualifications:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 
? B.S. degree in Information Technology, Business Administration or other technical discipline 
? At least 3 years of experience with current information technologies and their influence on business function 

ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS: 
? Available 24/7/365 excluding pre-approved exceptions 

DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS: 
? ITIL Foundation Certification or higher 
? Ability to work in dynamic environment with changing priorities 
? High energy, innovative individual who is motivated by challenging assignments 
? Excellent communication skills, interpersonal, oral, and written 
? Effective at managing multiple issues with conflicting priorities under tight deadlines 
? High attention to detail and accuracy 
? Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills 
? Strong customer communication skills with the ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical customers 
? Ability to organize resources across different teams to drive resolution of system critical issues 
? Ability to work well within a team to learn and share knowledge 
? Strong customer service orientation 
? Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks with little to no forewarning 
? Demonstrated ability to react quickly, lead and perform exceptionally during critical/catastrophic events 

Responsibilities: 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
? Responds to all communication inputs regarding unplanned service interruptions from customers and internal IT 
? Performs systems monitoring using multiple tools (HP Product Suites), being constantly aware of application or infrastructure issues across all production environments 
? Leads/Performs incident detection, investigation, diagnosis, support, closure and reporting 
? Leads/Performs logging, categorization and prioritization of incidents (impact + urgency) 
? Ensures that assigned incidents are managed robustly & effectively and that any customer/business impact is identified and minimized 
? Ensures all significant/business critical incidents are reported and escalated appropriately 
? Ensures standard incident management does not meet bottlenecks with escalations happening as effectively as possible 
? Ensures that incident ticket communication/documentation is accurate, timely, clear and concise 
? Provides documentation for Known Error Data Base (KEDB) or similar depository 
? Assists in Change Management process, reviewing changes to the NBC Universal production environment including implementation, test, and rollback plans, and ensuring all changes have full approval prior to implementation 
? Identifies and assists in post incident review activity to prevent repeat incidents (proactive remediation) 
? Increases communication & partnerships with IT teams and business partners in an effort to provide the best possible service 
? Identifies/develops solutions to maximize operational effectiveness and efficiency 
? Fosters a culture of teamwork, unity, accountability, responsibility and respect 

Comments/Special Instructions

title: Manager II-Data Engineering
description:
provides digital and mainstream technology staff as well as Digital Transformation Services for all American Corporations. We are currently seeking a 
 for our client in the
 domain. We value our professionals, providing comprehensive benefits and the opportunity for growth. This is a 
position and the client is looking for someone to start immediately.


Full-time


Clearwater, FL


 The 
 would need to have at least 5 years of experience. In this role, you will be responsible for management of the Enterprise Data Systems, including design, development and maintenance of the data platforms, solutions architecture and delivery. 

You will be responsible for partnering with business stakeholders to implement and manage Enterprise Datawarehouse, operational data sources and solutions to provide insights into business performance and needs and creating policies and procedures to support functional infrastructure.



- Manage existing data resources, implement new technologies and tools to further enable decision making, as well as help drive scalable data sharing practices

- Mentor and manage ETL Engineers, Data Engineers and administrators and ensure that data engineering best practices are being followed

- Work with all business areas, corporate functions and IT Leadership for driving the data management solutions that provide for insights into performance and business growth objectives as well as cost saving opportunities and efficiencies.

- Ensures that the organization achieves returns on investments in analytics that meet or exceed the needs of the business.

- Directs and manages information systems that enable timely and effective use of resources.

- Provides leadership and management for resources and tools that provide business reporting, solution strategy for information delivery, data administration, data acquisition/integration, analytics, and data management on an enterprise level.

- Leads simultaneous initiatives; coordinates the development of IT plans, projects and processes.

- Works with stakeholders to manage delivery and lead teams of data analytics resources in the design and delivery of information systems solutions.

- Assists in leveraging data as an asset throughout the organization.

- Drives the development, execution, monitoring and evaluation of the analytics strategy and delivery. 

- Maintains a long-range enterprise system plan consistent with business objectives. 

- Accountable for Enterprise Data Management and Analytics strategic planning.

- Collaborates with peers to ensure understanding of current technology trends and implement new solutions. 

- Direct analysis, development, implementation and support of data and analytics functions. 

- Design and deployment of data extraction, ETL, SQL queries, stored procedures, OLAP cubes etc.

- Responsible for advancing data architecture, database model and load processes.

- Ongoing development of technical best practices for data movement, data quality, data cleansing and other ETL activities.



- Bachelor degree in related field preferred.

- 5+ years’ experience in leading data engineering/architecture, data mining and data modeling teams.

- 7+ years of Data Warehouse experience with SQL, NoSQL technologies, advanced analytics architecture, deployment and support.

- Experience in maintaining data warehouse systems and working on large scale data transformation using Apache Spark, Hadoop or other Big Data technologies and cloud technologies like Azure, AWS etc.

- Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing

- Experience with hardware provisioning, forecasting hardware usage, and managing to a budget

- Experience with business intelligence design, tools and reporting.

- Experience implementing database administration, data management processes, procedures, data quality management and decision support.

- Knowledgeable in current technology and industry trends.

- Ability to translate complex technical topics into easily understandable concepts.

- Competent in: enterprise repository tools, data modeling tools, ETL data mapping tools, middleware services, and data profiling tools.

- Or an equivalent combination of education, training or experience.


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Information Technology or another related field or Equivalent.


Minimum 5 years


This position will not cover relocation expenses

title: Microsoft Systems Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) Administrator
Project Manager - Scrum Master
description:
VSolvit LLC is seeking to add a Project Manager to our Kansas City team to work in support of our USDA customers technical initiatives. The successful Project Manager candidate will be comfortable with multi-tasking across multiple projects and have the ability to translate requirements into team accomplishments. The Project Manager will have the technical knowledge needed to span a wide variety of technologies including new areas of subject matter. Your ability to understand what needs to be accomplished and scoped, to move projects forward or how best to surface potential risks to a projects success should be innate skills. This Project Manager will be responsible for supporting and managing software development teams across many technologies including but not limited to Java J2EE, Oracle, BI, GIS, Web, and Reporting. Experience managing software development projects from start to finish is key. The ability to lead efforts for ongoing business systems support and development is also required. Inception to release and experience in all phases the SDLC. Demonstrated ability to engage, motivate and guide team members in the development and delivery of high quality application, program or systems. The candidate we seek will have PMP Certification and ideally USDA or some other project management experience involving work with government entities and program. The worksite for this position will be at the USDA customer facility in Kansas City, MO.
    
  
    
  
    
  
    
  
United States Citizenship Required
Must be eligible to obtain and hold a Public Trust security clearance as a condition of employment
    
  
Join the VSolvit Team! Founded in 2006, VSolvit (pronounced 'We Solve It') provides geospatial and information technology consulting services and solutions to government and private section clients. VSolvit is an award winning 8(m)/EDWOSB and SBA-certified 8(a)/SDB company. We offer Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance, as well as 401K Retirement Plan options, Tuition Reimbursement, and other benefits. Our goal is to grow together and enjoy the work that we do as a team.

title: Assistant Manager Core Processing & Desktop Support
description:
Assists the department manager with the supervision of department staff and in planning, directing, and coordinating the activities of the service desk staff and the activities associated with the identification, prioritization, and resolution of reported problems. Allocates resources to ensure that all phases of help desk support are coordinated, monitored, logged, tracked, and resolved appropriately.  
Essential Job Functions 
 
      •  Supervises teammembers directly, including selection, training, performance appraisal and work allocation. Responsible for scheduling staff.  
      •  Ensures daily responsibilities of staff are completed and proper procedures are followed.  
      •  Helps establish, communicate and achieve the credit union's goals and standards, ensuring these are fully communicated to and understood by all department staff.  
      •  Identifies areas to streamline department and credit union operations. Leads efforts to implement such enhancements and other projects.  
      •  May act in the capacity of the Manager in his or her absence.  
      •  Complies with all government regulatory policies, internal policies and procedures, audit standards, remains current on and informed of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and apprises staff.  
      •  Monitors trends and technology in the credit card industry while reporting and making appropriate recommendations.  
      •  Coordinate routine checks of company equipment such as copiers, printers, scanners and AV equipment making sure the least amount of downtime is incurred escalating to service vendor as needed. 
      •  Administer the department's workflow for creating, configuring and distributing equipment to new hires including communication with management regarding deliverables. 
      •  Manage the technical service needs for other locations throughout the organization when opening or closing sites through all phases such as, purchasing to implementation. 
      •  Assist in preparing/maintaining procedures for logging and monitoring desktop configurations. 
      •  Maintain an inventory of desktops and required peripherals.  
 
      •  Conduct research on desktop products. Evaluate/recommend products for purchase.  
 
      •  Maintain minimum technical specifications for desktops and future desktop purchases.  
 
      •  Responsible for developing a rotating schedule to provide Saturday support to credit union staff (including self in rotation). 
      •  Monitor daily, monthly, quarter-end and year-end processing on a rotated schedule. 
      •  All teammembers must comply with regulatory compliance and assigned training requirements including but not limited to BSA regulations corresponding to their specific job duties. Failure to do so may result in disciplinary and other employment related actions. 
      •  Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. 
      •  Is responsible for incident escalation and companywide notifications.  
Education/Years of Experience/Certifications 
High School Diploma  
Associate's Degree or equivalent years of experience preferred 
4 - 7 years of previous related experience required 
1 - 2 years previous supervisory experience 
  
  
  
Desktop Operating Systems (PC/Mac) Support & Security    
Required

Required

Required

Required

Required

Required

Required

Preferred     
  
Supervisory Experience 
Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring and training teammembers; planning, assigning and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining teammembers; addressing complaints and resolving problems.  
Physical Demands 
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those a teammember encounters while performing the essential functions of this job in a general office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a teammember to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the teammember is regularly required to do the following:  
  
 
      •  Intermittent lifting up to and over 50 pounds 
      •  Frequent keyboarding and mouse usage  
      •  Intermittent standing, sitting, walking and neck flexing  
      •  Intermittent pushing, pulling and reaching above, at and below shoulder height  
      •  Eye/hand coordination: Performing work using both  
      •  Working with hands: seizing, holding, and grasping  
      •  Able to lift by raising or lowering an object from one level to another.  
      •  Positions within Facilities and ATM Services may be exposed to dust, gas, odors or fumes and power grasping. May be required to work from a ladder.

title: Recovery Care Manager
description:
The 
 
 
 
 
 is a leader in the field of community- based alternatives to incarceration. CCA promotes re-integrative justice and a reduced reliance on incarceration through advocacy, services and public policy development in pursuit of civil and human rights.
 Support individuals who are in recovery and who may have current/prior criminal justice experience to participate in the Syracuse Recovery Network. Utilize Recovery Coaching/Peer Mentoring skills to demystify treatment and help participants access treatment and negotiate insurance barriers. Requires occasional evening and weekend hours.
Screen individuals interested in participating in the Syracuse Recovery Network to ensure they meet eligibility requirements.
Provide referrals to community-based behavioral/physical health services and follow-up on status of referrals.
Provide individual and group Peer Recovery Support Services, including: screening participants utilizing CCA’s Intake Form, Locator Form, and the OASAS Perception of Care Survey; providing ongoing support through Recovery Coaching/Peer Mentoring; assisting participants with family health and wellness and family reunification; facilitating and following-up on referrals to community-based service provider agencies.
Monitor participants’ recovery status and ensure that recovery support services provided are helping to sustain their recovery; conduct home and community visits, and transport participants to and from appointments, as needed.
Maintain participant records, collect and enter program required data into CCA’s database (at intake and at six-month follow-up benchmark), and generate reports, as requested.
Recruit, train and support Syracuse Recovery Network members to work on community outreach projects.
Facilitate peer leadership training curriculum. Supervise peers in the delivery of services.
Assist with the coordination of affiliation activities and recreational events.
With Syracuse Recovery Network members, testify at public hearings and community forums on issues related to the goals and objectives of the Syracuse Recovery Network.
Serve as a liaison with community groups interested in recovery issues.
Attend community stakeholder meetings on behalf of the Syracuse Recovery Network, as directed by Project Director.
Attend staff meetings as directed by Project Director.
Attend training programs as assigned.
Complete required paperwork in a timely manner.
Perform other duties as assigned by Project Director, Director of Recovery Services, Deputy Director or Executive Director.
Qualified Health Professional: CASAC, LMSW, LCSW, CRC, or AAMFT required. Must demonstrate knowledge of the community resources, existing network of behavioral health providers, and confidentiality regulations. Commitment to and experience in working with adults and youth with diverse cultural backgrounds who are involved, or at risk of involvement, with the criminal/juvenile justice system, HIV/AIDS, or substance abuse. Personal experience with recovery and/or criminal justice issues strongly preferred. Strong written and oral communication, project management and supervisory skills. Computer literacy (word processing, e-mail, internet research, data entry) required. Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred. Possess a valid NYS driver’s license, a reliable vehicle able to transport participants, and appropriate level of auto insurance, as required by CCA.

title: Account Manager/Sales / BDM (IT Staffing / Recruiting )
description:

In addition, he or she must remain knowledgeable about current events pertaining to the industry.
In order to fulfill the requirements of this position, it is highly desirable for the candidate to have - years of business experience.

1. Assists executive management with overall sales strategy account development & forecasting.
2. Provides support to national account administration.
3. Works in collaboration with management to ensure a successful national program, whether owned or serviced by the AM.
