title: Project Manager - Data Center
description: Project Manager (Data Center)- 6 Months + Contract - Madison, WIClient is in the midst of migrating their Data Center from an on-premise to a co-located facility. We are looking for someone that has:•	Experience managing projects using waterfall methodology•	Skilled at communication, negotiation, and facilitation with business and technology partners•	Experienced project manager for data center migrations and proven track record of on time deliveryThese initiatives require a candidate to operate independently, critically think and provide leadership, quality assurance, alignment to vision/mission and follow-through on solutions to completion.  The ideal candidate can work effectively with demanding end-users, solicit key requirements (must-haves) and formulate feasible/cost-effective solutions to meet the needs.CRITICAL QUALIFICATIONSThis assignments minimally requires:1.	Education and experience with waterfall approaches to project management 2.	Collaboration, team building and communications/follow-through skills.3.	Experience being the primary project manager for a data center migration with a proven track record of on time deliveryBasic Qualifications (Must-Haves to be successful):1.	Strong knowledge of Project Management methodologies2.	Ability to manage resources in a matrix environment.3.	Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are essential.4.	Well-developed skills with Visio, MS-Project, Excel, PowerPoint and Word.5.	Experienced working in a deadline-driven environment, handling and prioritizing multiple tasks.6.	Demonstrated track record of successful project delivery.7.	Excellent conceptual, problem solving, and analytical skills.8.	Ability to work independently or as a member of a team on complex tasks. 9.	Demonstrated competency in documenting solutions for both technical and functional audiences.10.	Strong technical background of IT infrastructure including servers, storage, networks, databases and backups.11.	Proficient in data center setups including racks, floor plans, patch panels, HVAC, redundant power, cabling, etc.12.	Experience working with 3rd party vendors.Duties and Responsibilities•	Responsible for the project planning and execution of the migration of infrastructure (servers, storage, networking and appliances) and applications from one data center to another.•	Facilitate and/or create relevant project related documents. Keep all project documentation updated and archived.•	Develop, manage and control the project plan and schedule.•	Facilitate meetings, provide meeting notes, and provide weekly status reports to both the project team and management.•	Manage risks and issues, with the ability to understand the impacts and probabilities, and offer different solutions to the challenges.•	Manage cross project dependencies and work well with other project managers.•	Works collectively with technical leads and leadership to manage project budget and resources.•	Gather key, understandable requirements to meet project activities.•	Communicate with appropriate parties on project needs, progress, issues, risks and outcomes.•	Manage, foster and develop team relationships.•	Be an advocate for project management and help educate others on the processes and benefits/•	Be a collaborative and transparent team member.Desired Proactive Behaviors •	Display energy and initiative in solving problems.•	Follow all possible avenues to get the job done.•	Adaptable - undertake a variety of tasks willingly. •	Ability to switch from complex to routine tasks when required. •	Work effectively with a variety of personalities and work styles. •	Quality - demonstrate appropriate quality and thoroughness in the work. •	Decisive - ability to make decisions quickly when faced with multiple options. •	Ability to influence others in decided course of action. •	Integrity - act with personal integrity at all times. •	Professional - work within your team's processes. •	Confront problems, propose solutions and take ownership through to resolution or ensure a clear hand-off. •	Have a positive can-do approach to work.•	Demonstrate a commitment and promote the behaviors aligned with the values of Madison College (excellence, respect, commitment to students and diverse communities and making higher education available to all) as well as the values that Technology Services (TS) has adopted to increase its effectivenessEducation and Qualifications•	5 - 10 years of skills as a Project Manager using waterfall methodology•	Demonstrable skills in use of Microsoft Project•	Experience being the primary project manager for a data center migration

title: Supervisor II - Technology
description:
This position provides supervision of technology related to security, including but not limited to
networks, auxiliary systems, client testing and new initiatives; and provides security
management of firewalls, access controls, policies, filters, antiviruses, and system updates.
 
MAIN JOB TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
 Provides supervision of technology related to security, including but not limited to
networks, auxiliary systems, client testing and new initiatives.
 Provides security management of firewalls, access controls, policies, filters, antiviruses,
and system updates.
 Manages a complex multipath segmented network with diverse BGP connections
through multiple ISPs.
 Provides oversight of school-owned fiber that is shared with the County government.
 Supports technology of auxiliary systems including print, copy, door lock, intercom,
VoIP, HVAC, media retrieval, and broadcast.
 Manages online testing implementation, compliance, and support.
 Assists other departments in creating standards, policy, and procedures for their new
technology initiatives.
 Provides training on the purpose and use of existing technology along with best security
practices.
 Supervises an engineering team that designs, implements, and manages multiple
concurrent projects.
 Manages information security incident prevention, response, remediation, and
restoration.
 Designs and implements security policies and procedure that protect each level of the
information infrastructure.
 Serves as a technology subject matter expert consultation for other department
projects.
 Provides oversight of joint projects with multiple outside organizations.
 Provides management of wide area network comprised of over 50 miles of fiber
supporting the infrastructure of both the school district and county government.
 Champions new technology initiatives including broadcasting, media retrieval, video
conferencing, and VoIP.
 Ensures compliance with technology regulations and special funding source
requirements.
 Provides technology and security training.
 Assists with after-hours technology on-call support.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
 Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university, in a related field.
 Five (5) years of successful work related experience.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
 Knowledge of Novell and Apple operating environments.
 Ability to create specifications for appropriate systems and devices over a broad range
of educationally related environments to include instructional and administrative needs.
 Ability to supervise and facilitate the development and implementation of
comprehensive plans to ensure the delivery of high quality technology services
throughout the School Division.
 Ability to conduct analysis of systems and programs using various software based tools.
 Ability to demonstrate the leadership qualities and personal characteristics necessary
for working effectively with students, teachers, and administrative staff.
 Ability to demonstrate appropriate use of written and verbal communication; thorough
knowledge of English grammar and usage.
 Ability to demonstrate effective time management and organizational skills.
 Ability to assess individual needs and performance.
Starting Salary  $86,534.00

title: IT Assurance Manager - PCI, HITRUST, CISSP
description:
If you are an IT Assurance Manager with 5+ years experience in Public Accounting or Corporate/Public Blend, please read on!

Based in Sherman Oaks, CA our client is is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. They are a leading Public Accounting Company in the LA Area that is currently expanding it's team. 



This position is working on their growing Sherman Oaks Technology team that is focused on delivering outstanding client service while integrating in a dynamic team environment.



As part of the growing Technology group, you will be part of a collaborative team with deep specialization. They use proactive approaches and innovative assurance technology to provide high quality risk and compliance cyber security services to their clients.



Please read on for more details!
This is a fast-paced environment with a high learning curve, so we provide many resources and on-the-job training opportunities  if you are willing to learn and build your areas of expertise, you will succeed. You will be exposed to a variety of technologies in different environments and different industry standards and solutions including: Consulting and Assurance for PCI, HiTRUST, SOC and SOC for Cybersecurity.
Joining this Assurance practice as a Technical Manager is an opportunity to interact with client leadership, understand the IT environments that we are helping to transform by the way we do business today, and help provide assurance that controls are operating the way they should. You will be responsible for conducting the cybersecurity portions of our service offerings including PCI, HITRUST, SOC for Cybersecurity and SOC.

This position will perform and conduct hands-on cybersecurity focused work, as well as oversee the work of some junior level personnel. This position will work directly with other staff, senior managers, and/or executives to communicate business and technical aspects of the work being performed. The IT Assurance Manager will set performance expectations for junior level personnel and provide constructive performance feedback on a regular basis. This person may also assist the engagement economics of the projects, including budget status tracking, billing, and collection analysis.



As our Audit practice continues to focus on transformation, we are looking for innovative leaders who can help build tools and methodology to provide more efficient and effective ways to assess large networks with multiple operating systems.



- Planning, supervising staff, and executing IT Assurance engagements, Compliance Standard Assessments, and Consulting engagements as well as support business development efforts.

- Managing projects to ensure high quality delivery within the project budget and time-lines.

- Being hands-on in the delivery and execution of project tasks for complex technology environments.

- Having the ability to present and communicate status and issues to client senior management personnel. Setting performance expectations for senior staff and staff level.

- Participating in innovation sessions and tactical initiatives related to new product offerings and services.

- Developing and maintaining relationships with clients and identify new opportunities for business.

- Defining performance expectations for senior staff and staff level IT auditors and providing performance feedback.
More Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:

- BS in Cyber security, Information Systems, Computer Science, or similar discipline

- Minimum 4 years of experience in the areas of Information Security (experience in PCI and/or HITRUST a plus).

- Certified Information Systems Security Professionals (CISSP) or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) certification

- Experience within consulting or professional services, or at leading industry public companies is preferred.

- Prior experience supervising junior level resources in the areas of Information Security.

- Knowledge of networking technology.

- System and/or network administration experience on UNIX, Linux, and Microsoft Windows.

- Knowledge of security areas such as Auditing, Policy, Database Security, Firewall Design and Implementation, Risk Analysis, Identity Management, Access Management, or Web Services is very desirable.
We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package:
- Promotion Plan!

- Vacation/PTO

- Medical

- Dental

- Vision

- Relocation

- Bonus

- 401k
So, if you are a IT Assurance Manager with experience, please apply today!

title: Program Manager - Enterprise Data Storage
description:
Core Data Product, how enterprise data product assets.
Portfolio and program management.
Looking at how data flows through the systems for BI reporting and analytics.  Client wants to create a new platform.
Create slide decks for different audiences, need Jira, need to understand about teams backlogs, some degree background in Data warehouse and data integration space.
Note: The small team will probably have small tech at the beginning, building some of the components, rest of team, working with SMEs to bring content together.
Why this level? Program, much better high level communication to work across a large set of stake holders. Working with Senior Directors, but also content more relevant for technical teams. In this situation, almost features being defined, Report on the overall state of those features and how they all tie back together.
Majority of teams are data engineering teams, some work with infrastructure and the data governance organization will tie in; so the Program Manager will need to work with risk engineers, data stake holders.
Role requires a good amount of analysis: example: making sure the 40 features that need to be delivered fit together. No way to get an overall picture of key features. Make sure it is all aligned correctly.

title: IT Manager, SAP Finance Applications
description:
•             Manage applications that support our global Finance & Controllership business partners
•             People lead for BSA’s and developers in the organization
•             Drive application and process innovation
•             Develop relationships that will position IT as a trusted business partner
•             Work with the Finance & Controllership teams to identify, plan and build business cases for application projects
•             Collaborate with representatives of other IT/functional areas to ensure end to end process integration and consistency
•             Identify opportunities to standardize processes and system configuration globally and ensure compliance across all implementation to these standards
•             Ensure business application systems are developed in a way that complies with established standards, methodologies and best practices
•             Advise management of the project status and problems, or potential problems, on a regular basis
•             Manage vendor relationships, contracts and budgets related to financial applications and services
•             Perform special projects as required
•             Responsibility for support related to FICO Applications
•             Responsible for related audit controls
•             Oversee on-time/on-budget delivery of projects that deliver anticipated results and agreed upon SLA KPI targets
•             Develop and maintain an appropriate global IT organizational structure that supports the needs of the business
•             Assist in the creation, management and delivery of IT departmental goals, objectives, and operating procedures, including championing and driving adherence to IT global policies and standards
•             Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Information Systems or related field; Master’s degree or MBA is desirable.
•             10+ years working in a business environment with a focus on business process and IT / Business strategy
•             8+ years of SAP ERP experience, with specific experience in SAP FICO
•             2+ years of direct people leadership experience including managing ERP teams
•             Current SAP configuration and module working knowledge in FI and CO such as General Ledger, Accounts Payables and Receivables, Fixed Assets accounting, Cost Center Accounting, Profit Center accounting, Product Costing and COPA
•             3+ full cycle implementations including: Scoping and Planning, Process Design, Configuration, Testing, Deployment, and Post Go-Live Support
•             Business process analysis and redesign experience: strong business analysis skills; process mapping; business process redesign and implementation
•             Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support
•             Ability and experience managing employee based globally distributed teams
•             Extensive experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
•             Excellent written and oral communications skills
•             Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to coach and lead others to deliver business results
•             Experience with large multi-national company
•             Experience within Consumer Package Goods industry

title: IT Executive Support Manager
description:
The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?
This is a highly visible role functioning as the global manager of IT Support for Executives. The work environment is dynamic, robust, and highly demanding of quality results through proven problem and time management. With access to special escalation matrices, tools, technologies, and resources, the IT Support Manager is enabled to drive quality results promptly to maintain down-time at a minimum. Your greater team is agile, dispersed globally, and hyper-focused on customer experience excellence. Real-time collaboration and knowledge sharing is pinnacle for being successful. The Executive Services IT Support Manager reports to the Global Executive Services Leader.
Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

title: Senior Manager, Cyber Security Threat & Vulnerability Management
Hospital Information Technology Manager
description:
An acute care community hospital in Wyoming is seeking an Information Technology Manager to join their industrious IT multi-disciplinary team.
This community hospital is comprised of 80+ beds and is a leader in the healthcare field who utilizes the latest advanced technology and resources to provide high quality care to the community that surrounds them. Some of the services provided at this facility include but are not limited to:
The Hospital IT Manager will be responsible for managing the Application Systems for the acute care facility. The IT manager will develop, support and maintain the clinical applications that the hospital runs. Other responsibilities will include: Electronic Medical Record EMR management, budget and fiscal planning for the department as well as ensuring policies and procedures are being followed.
The Information Technology Applications Manager will work alongside the Infrastructure Manager in the department. Together, they will report directly to the Director of Information Systems. The Applications Manager should be prepared to evaluate and solve technical problems, and provide high quality customer service when appropriate.
This region of Wyoming is located within a beautiful part of the mountain region. With a number of affordable housing options all throughout the town, this location is highly desirable for all those ever thinking about relocating or for those who are already lucky enough to live in such a beautiful part of the county. Either way, this area makes for a great quality of life!
The medical facility is prepared to offer the Hospital Information Technology IT Manager a comprehensive salary and excellent benefits package to compliment this leadership opportunity.

title: IT Enterprise Systems Manager (SCCM)
description:
Laulima Government Solutions, LLC of the Alaka'ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) has an immediate need for an  
 to provide onsite enterprise/domain level administration support services to a customer in Honolulu, HI.
 
    
  
 
The  
  will  support and adhere to the Army Golden Master (AGM) server and workstation standards; manage, monitor and sustain: Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager; Structured Query Language (SQL); and Microsoft System Center Operations Manager (SCOM); provide Change Management (CM) and Enterprise Services Management System; and perform daily monitoring to ensure consistent, optimal performance.  
 
    
  
 
    
  
Designs, builds, configures and administers SCCM infrastructure to ensure system is available for operating system deployment (OSD), package deployments, application catalog and client policy updates.
Ensure SCCM is current with latest system builds, hotfixes, server operating systems, admin consoles and client updates using the Change Management process and/or documenting in ticketing system.
Manages all SCCM hierarchy configurations and supports all site system roles such as distribution points, application catalog, and database and SQL Reporting services.
Performs patching of server and appliance systems, by planning, testing, deploying, and monitoring system availability after patching is complete.
Ensure infrastructure servers are current with the most recent Microsoft and 3rd party patches using department's Change Management process and/or documenting results in ticketing system.
Create documentation for both technical and non-technical staff detailing standards, guidelines, communications and procedures required to operate and maintain network infrastructure patching responsibilities.
 
        
      
Designs, builds, configures and administers the enterprise SCOM test and production platforms.
Ensure SCOM is current with latest system builds, hotfixes, server operating systems, admin consoles and client updates using Department's Change Management process and/or documenting in ticketing system.
Provides application support for the SCOM platforms.
Creates and maintains monitoring and notification rules to meet infrastructure and business needs.
Document process and procedures for proper administration of the SCOM platforms.
 
        
      
Must be a U.S. Citizen.
Must possess a DoD Secret Clearance with Tier 5 or a Top Secret Clearance.
Must be IAT-III qualified in accordance with DoD Directive 8570.01 - (CISSP, CASP CE, CCNP-Security, CISA, GCED, or GCIH.
Must obtain MCSA: Server 2012 R2 within six months after hire.
 
        
      
5-7 years progressively responsible experience in  windows server administration, Microsoft operating systems.
Enterprise System Administration experience on Microsoft Windows platform; an understanding of a wide array of server grade applications to include DNS, IIS, Apache, SharePoint, SAN/NAS, SCCM/SCOM, VM, Patch Management, and LDAP.
Extensive knowledge and understanding of TCP/IP network architecture and implementation; and the fundamentals of network protocols, architecture and management.
Extensive knowledge and understanding of the associated IA principles and framework applied to ensure information assurance and security of those services.
 
        
      
B.S. in computer science / information systems or equivalent combination of education and experience.
MCSA: Server 2012 R2
SCCM training or certification.
SCOM training.
Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE).
Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP).
Orchestra Training.

description:

description:

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
Kratos is seeking a proven Content Marketing leader who can plan and grow thought leadership programs for the space and satellite industry, including podcast, blog, newsletter, and other media channels. Will work with subject matter experts to develop stories and programs for delivering them. Strategy and planning skills are keys to success, and strong writing/interviewing/research skills are essential. 
 
• Content direction for podcast, blog, web and other channels
• Developing articles for contribution to industry magazines about hot button industry and technology issues
• Work on inventive content communication projects such as infographics and videos
• Contribute to other social media programs
At least three years experience in marketing communications, science/tech journalism or digital marketing required. Experience in the space or satellite industries is very strongly desired, but must be familiar with marketing or writing about technology solutions for the IT, communications or similar industries. This is a great opportunity for the ambitious, creative, self-motivated person interested in building channels and content products for an exciting and growing market on technology’s cutting edge. Bachelor's degree is required.

title: Network Project Manager - II
description:
Description
Responsible for project managing all aspects of the Core Network growth of the Intelligent Edge network in support of the ULH & OTN the migration of our legacy platforms to these new platforms. Will work closely with their Sr manger, our internal engineering, PM & operation teams as well the third party vendors engaged to do portions of the program. Drive projects and programs to achieve targeted and measured business goals and objectives. Responsible for managing a high volume of work and specifically driving , tracking and clearing major obstacles in the remediation and fiber characterizing of our new ULH routes.
Coordinate and schedule resources across multiple organizations to align project requirements with business goals and objectives. Identify, monitor, report and escalate project-related issues to achieve timely resolution. Develop and implement corrective action plans to mitigate impact to project schedules and overall business objectives. Utilize project tracking tools and systems to accurately document milestones completions, project issues, corrective action plans, project jeopardies, and overall project completions. Maintain excellent communication with Functional Team Members and Direct Management to ensure early identification of issues a timely reporting of status.
What we are looking for....
• Extensive knowledge in managing projects involving fiber splicing, fiber remediation & characterization
• Strong technical and project management knowledge
• Minimal 5 years of Project Management experience
• Experience managing 3rd path vendors
• Excellent knowledge of PC and software application including Windows and MS Office
Ideally, you'll also have:
• PMP certification and / or Military experience desired
• VLSS Black Belt experience with proven track record preferred
• Engineering, Planning, and/or Operations knowledge, especially with Local and Long-Haul Telecommunications networks
• Experience with SRM/SAP as well as expense and/or capital budgets
• Excellent verbal and written skills for inter-organizational communications to both internal & external partners
• Strong organization skills and demonstrated ability to manage multiple, often conflicting priorities to successful completion.
Experience making independent decisions based on policies, practices and project requirements
Associates Degree is Required.
PM Certification is not required , but nice to have.

title: BXB Digital: Implementation Manager, IoT
description:
• This position can be based in Orlando or Alpharetta
    
  
    
    
BXB Digital is seeking an individual to deliver BXB Digital asset tracking solutions in America’s supply chain. The ideal candidate is someone who has analytical and software application background, decent knowledge about industrial and retail supply chain network, and rich experience in project management. 
    
  
    
    
• 
 – Partner with business users to understand detail business requirements, provide mapping requirements and solutions, provide assistance for implementations and analysis, conduct system setup and customized configurations, document results of applications, review and evaluate technical issues and processes. 
• 
 – Serve as major interface and liaison with business users throughout the solution delivery and post mortem session. 
• 
 – Manage pilots, projects, create staged plans and milestones, risk assessment and mitigation actions, drive results, hands on to trouble shoot, report out to project sponsors on a needed basis 
• Customer Service - On-board user training and support (to all digitization stakeholders) 
• 
 – Work with in-house team to conduct user acceptance testing to ensure the end to end solution is reliable and repeatable on all user cases 
• 
 – Ensure all operations are compliance with Zero Harm framework with all Zero Harm policies and action plans are fully implemented
    
  
    
    
• Expertise of asset tracking solution and application to various business cases 
• Maximize, constantly review and increase standard application usage  
• Customer expectation/satisfaction  
• Effective cross functional communication
• Solution ease of use, reliability and repeatable usability 
• Responsiveness
    
  
    
    
Product team, Physical Operations, Hardware and Software teams, Brambles BU Leadership, Supply Chain, Digitalization Stakeholders and Key Users
    
  
External:    
Brambles customer if required to co-interface with business users 
    
  
    
    
• Bachelor of Science degree in computer science/computer engineering
• Knowledge/Experience in deploying web applications 
• Work experience as software consultant is a plus
• Rich project Management experience and/or certification
• Knowledge/Experience in FMCG and Retail supply chain would be preferred 
• ~30% travel 
    
  
    
    
• 3+ year experience of software solution delivery and implementation
• Rich project leadership and project management experience
• # of Business cases/projects managed and executed with customers 
• Knowledge of industrial supply chain network is strongly preferred
• Knowledge in IoT digital solution is strongly preferred
• Cross functional experience and effective communication 
• Working experience in a global and diversed cultural organization 
    
  
    
    
Technical Skill: Python, HTML, JavaScript, Excel, SQL
Cloud Platform: Amazon Web Services 
    
  
Personal: energetic, proactive, effective communicator, solution driven, customer focused, independent, self-disciplined, hands-on, analytical, result oriented, relationship builder, team leader, team player, strategic & critical thinker, quick learner, collaborative
    
  
    
    
English     
Desirable:  Spanish and/or German, nice to have

title: IT Asset Management Administrator
description:
IT Asset Management Administrator
This position responsible for IT Asset and Stock Related activities .
 
Resource will be an integral part HCL Team and interfacing client whenever needed
 
Main Responsibilities includes but not limited to:
 
·         Update AMDB for HCL  BAU Activities
·         Check POD till Closures and update AMDB respectively.
·         Complete Ad-hoc/Monthly Audit Checks.
·         Complete on Stock Management Reporting
·         IT Asset Utilization Management
·         IT Asset Stock Availability Management
·         IT Asset Stock Demand & Forecasting Management
·         Work with HCL DLM Team on Spot Checks/Discrepancies.
·         Work with HCL Logistics Team to ensure kit is booked in and rationalise Part no.
·         Work with HCL Asset Management team in India as required
·         Assist with Disposals preparation/collection.
·         Work with Projects Team as needed
·         Work with ITAM Team  in maintaining stock Usage levels against demand,
·         Ensuring the required Bad Stock is tested and reported.
·         Input to the Monthly Peripheral usage/requirements to maintain Stock levels.
·         Flexibility and teamwork and performs other duties as assigned by your reporting manager
 
Technical Skills:
 
§  Understanding of different types of end user IT Infrastructure – Desktops, Laptops, Printers, Handhelds, Smartphone etc.
§  Good understanding of using IT Applications i.e MS Excel, Service Now and Outlook, MS Visio
§  Good understanding of Service NOW
 
Business Skills:
 
§  Must have 4-5 Years of corporate experience
§  Must be good in client’s presentation
§  Ability to interact with HCL Leadership and client  so as to ensure that the service is polite, efficient and responsive
§  A self-starter with ability to work on their own initiative
§  To work through issues analytically to a successful conclusion
§  Ability to provide consistent, excellent support to entire staff, representing a variety of personalities and management levels
§  Strong written and verbal communication skills (English and  local language)
§  Must be detail oriented and self-motivating

title: Senior Global IT Auditor - 2
description:
One of our top global pharmaceutical clients is looking to add an Senior Global IT Auditor.
The Senior IT Global Auditor will report to the Global IT Audit Manager and have responsibility for planning, executing and reporting on assigined internal audit and 3rd party audits.
The IT Senior Auditor will spent 2-3 years in a Leadership Rotation Program and then move on with in the company.
Travel will be about 40% domestic and internationally
Audit Planning, Execution & Reporting 
In collaboration with the rest of the IA  team, assist in the development and execution of a comprehensive risk-based global internal audit program through proactive involvement and research of industry and profession best practices.
Directly manage and perform multiple IT internal audits simultaneously with the objective of assessing the design and operating effectiveness of risk management practices and internal controls across multiple IT domains (e.g. application controls, project management, cyber risks, third party, etc.), assessing the efficiency of operations, compliance with corporate policies and procedures and alignment with global control frameworks (e.g. NIST, COBIT, COSO).
Provide management with valuable recommendations and insights to strengthen the control environment.
Manage internal projects and process improvement initiatives, including opportunities to expand use of analytics and automation.
Maintain the highest standards of professionalism and independence in the execution of duties.
Coach and mentor audit staff.
Proactively liaise with various business and corporate functions management providing counsel and input on risk and control issues facing their functions.
Manage and perform key departmental process improvement initiatives including internal quality assurance; assist with audit issue trend analysis and reporting.
Manage and perform special projects including providing controls consulting expertise to the business.
Assist with preparation of quarterly Leadership presentations, as needed
Bachelors Degree required.
3-6 years of IT Audit experience from a big 4 firm or a top tier public accounting firm or a top consulting firm.
Experience must come for a big 4 or top tier public firm or consulting/advisory firm.
CISA, CISSP or CISM preferred.

title: Chief Engineer, IT Cyber Security and Risk Management
description:
The Master Technologist, IT Cyber Security and Risk Management will interface heavily with the Enterprise Architecture team and be the overall voice for Infrastructure Projects, Security Operations and Incident Response. 
This new position will report directly to the Vice President of Security Strategy & Operations with a dotted line to the Group Vice President, IT Security with daily interactions with the Executive Management Team, Cross Function Team & Se. Management Leaders throughout the organization. 
In doing so, The Master Technologist role will use advanced expertise in multiple technical disciplines (eto advance security initiatives and work with other technologists and architects across the organization.
Master’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, MIS or related field or equivalent work experience
15 plus years experience designing or configuring systems and/or applications
10 plus years Relational Database Design and Maintenance
Experience working in Telecommunications industry
Office environment

title: Manager 2 Data and Analytics
description: Intuit is seeking a Senior Manager of Analytics to lead the TurboTax Expert Services analytics area and manage a small team of business data analysts over time. We have an exciting opportunity to help shape how we use data and technology to drive our tax expert services portion of our TurboTax Live lineup. This role will focus on our tax experts’ products, productivity, and practice management. This role will partner closely with data scientists, platform engineers, and product managers, and will balance individual contribution with direct management of a small team.

title: Manager, Systems & Capital Planning
description:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree in planning, engineering, economics, public/business administration, or a related field. 
          
        
Minimum of eight (8) years of progressively responsible experience in transportation planning, public transportation, project management, and/or public transportation advocacy is required.  Previous managerial or supervisory experience is required.
In lieu of degree, a minimum of twelve (12) years of experience in transportation planning, public transportation, project management, and/or public transportation advocacy. Previous managerial or supervisory experience is required.
          
        
Master’s degree
          
        
Satisfactorily complete the medical examination for this position, if required.  The incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of this position either with or without reasonable accommodations.
          
        
This is a senior-level supervisory position that requires a high level of technical fluency and leadership in public transportation planning, development and policy. The incumbent overseas, directs, and develops strategic plans and complex studies for Metro’s system development and capital planning with a focus on mid and long-terms.  The incumbent is responsible for developing Metrorail and Metrobus ridership forecasts, transit network, fleet and operating plans, executing advanced corridor feasibility studies and environmental impact studies, and leading Metro’s constrained long range plans to project financial expenditures and revenues of the system’s operating and capital requirements.  The incumbent stewards close collaboration between the Office of Planning (PLAN) and Metro’s operations, engineering, and financing functions as well as state, regional and local stakeholders.  Substantial judgment and initiative are essential for resolving problems and making recommendations with regard to various projects.
          
        
Serves as a systems and capital planning program manager. Directs the development and preparation of major inputs to the annual work plan including identification of program goals, determination of staffing and consultant needs, and initiation of projects and studies that support the program goals and the overall mission, goals and objectives of the Authority to expand and improve transit services and facilities.
Supports the Authority’s vision of WMATA being the region’s transit leader by demonstrating leadership in promoting regional transit expansion and utilization and enhancing transit mobility and accessibility.
Exercises project management responsibilities in support of WMATA’s administration of Federal Transit Administration funded projects and the related grant responsibilities and reporting requirements.
Develops technical and policy recommendations on Metro’s systems development and capital planning for considerations by the Chief Operating Officer, Chief Financial Officer, and the General Manager (GM) that address core capacity, fleet and facilities, networks and corridors, and system financial requirements.
Directs assigned transit planning programs, projects, and initiatives to include defining and advancing a shared vision for transit development that is integrated, effective and conducive for the region's growth through the middle of the 21st century.
Manages Metrorail system core capacity plans, including rail lines and stations, to identify operating, engineering and architectural improvements, expand core capacity, eliminate infrastructural and operational deficiency and enhance passenger experience.  Participates in the review and development federal policies pertinent to the State-of-Good Repair (SGR) and core capacity.
Manages Metro’s Constrained Long Range Plan (CLRP) update and advocates for Metro’s capital and operating/maintenance requirements in the regional forum in collaboration with the Transportation Planning Board and DOTs in the District of Columbia, Maryland, and Virginia. Participates in regional and metropolitan transportation on planning activities to provide technical advice for Metro and the Transportation Planning Board (TPB) on transit ridership forecasts and collaborates on long-range system planning activities.
Manages advanced feasibility studies of new Metrorail and Metrobus corridors to evaluate planning, operating and financial requirements as well cost and benefit analysis.  Collaborates with Engineering Services on Metro’s Compact hearing and National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) projects focusing on planning, transportation impact analysis and transit operations. Serves as technical managers for reimbursable corridor projects that are requested by the jurisdictions for advanced feasibility studies.
Leads Metrorail operating plan development and system fleet assignment to reflect network changes, passenger demand, operating conditions and fleet and facility provisions.
Leads Metrobus network strategic studies to identify Metrobus market opportunities, recommend long-term network restructuring and improve operational efficiency and service effectiveness.
Collaborates with Offices of Bus and Rail Operations in the development of Metrorail and Metrobus fleet and facility management plans to identify rehabilitation, replacement and expansion needs, recommend capital improvements to the Metro management and Compact jurisdictions, and meet the Federal Transit Administration’s (FTA) funding requirements.
Responsible and accountable for developing and submitting a realistic and reasonable project budget and for issuing appropriate progress reports as required to record the project’s advancements or delays. The report shall include a register of completed tasks, all payments issued and any problems causing delays, redirection of focus or that impacts project delivery timeline or strategy. A progress report will be provided to OMBS as well as the program’s front office (Department Chief) as required.
Prepares and presents oral/written reports/recommendations within areas of assigned responsibility.

title: Sr. Technical Project Manager Jobs in Nashville TN | IT Job Recruiters
Clinical IT Project Manager (Veeva)
description:
Clinical IT Project Manager (Veeva) - Contract or CTP - Wilmington or Raleigh, NC 
The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
A Pharmaceutical Company is seeking a Clinical IT Project Manager (Veeva) in Wilmington or Raleigh, NC. 
Role Description
Works cross-functionally to deliver IT project solutions within the constraints of scope, quality, time and cost. Manages or coordinates multiple IT projects from initiation through delivery. Serves as the liaison between IT and the business line customer to ensure that all targets and deliverables are met. PMP certification is preferable.
* Manages allocated projects according to timelines, budget and quality standards. Coordinates activities of multiple cross-functional IT systems/application teams and works with various technology and business unit staff to ensure project dependencies are identified and communicated.
* Provides oversight and direction to allocated project team members to ensure quality and timely delivery of project requirements.
* Develops and reviews detailed project plans; assesses Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), resource loading, dependencies, and milestones.
* Plans and manages budgets associated with technology projects. Evaluates percentage complete, tracks actuals to budget and mitigates overspend, tunes resource model to adhere to budget guidelines.
* Provides detailed information to management to ensure risks/issues are surfaced and mitigated, provides tracking to budget and timeline.
* Analyzes cross-project interdependencies in order to avoid potential impacts and to identify optimizations regarding scope, schedule, budget, and resource utilization.
* Works under general supervision with major functional area leads and senior peers to identify and evaluate fundamental issues on the project.
* Reviews data on complex issues, makes good business decisions, and ensures solutions are implemented.
Skills & Requirements
* 7+ years as a Project Manager a background in clinical or pharma is a PLUS.
* Strong financial acumen
* Veeva platform, Quality docs, QMS.
* Will support a cloud base solution implementation.
* PMP required.
* Need to have experience with Agile.
* Must have experience with data migrations- this person isn't technical and doing the migrations, but they need to be able to understand the technical side and communication work. They are moving data into the various clinical software systems and implementing new solutions.
Why Hays?
You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the Information Technology industry and market trends . Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there's a position you really want, you're fully prepared to get it. 
Additionally, this position is a contract role where Hays offers you the opportunity to enroll in full medical, dental or vision benefits.
Medical 
Dental 
Vision 
401K 
Life Insurance ($20,000 benefit)
Nervous about an upcoming interview? Unsure how to write a new resume?
Visit the Hays Career Advice section to learn top tips to help you stand out from the crowd when job hunting. 
Hays is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Drug testing may be required; please contact a recruiter for more information.

title: Jr. Project Manager - IT Change Management, Pharma, Biotech
Project Manager-Application Development
description:
EM wants to see the following:
 
 
PLUS:
Research and early development experience. Chemistry or bio therapeutics or small molecule development or translation medicine experience.. Systems and applications supporting the Laboratory equipment.
 
This is a Senior Project / Program Manager position and will be accountable for managing day to day deliverables associated with one or more projects within IT Projects and Programs, and will work closely with the IT Program Manager and Business partners. Specific activities may include: developing schedules; running project team meetings; developing and maintaining project status; organizing and leading teams to ensure deliverables and timelines are met per project objectives and schedules; and pro-actively raising key issues/risks to project stakeholders, then driving the associated follow-ups and resolutions. Individual should have strong verbal and written communication skills, be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and be able to effectively manage competing priorities.
 
 Role Description:
 * Responsible for project management, coordination, execution, and control of IT deliverables, in a rapidly changing environment
 * Work closely with business functions to: understand their needs; ensure alignment to timelines and costs; and track mutual dependencies
 * Collaborate with multi-functional and virtual teams across IT, Business functions, Vendors and Service Providers
 * Able to help identify and triage new issues for criticality and ownership
 * Schedule and facilitate meetings and or work sessions to ensure team alignment
 
 Expected Areas of Competence:
 * Ability to conceptualize Projects/Programs from start to finish to effectively manage and align to schedule while adapting to sudden changes and shifting priorities
 * Delivers cost-effective, high quality Projects or Programs on-time through application of PM guidelines and standards (best practices) and effective controls while meeting requisite compliance requirements
 * Demonstrates effective Project Management skills through the development of project plans, resource allocation, plan execution, consistent communications with project team members and stakeholders, status reviews, and delivery of agreed upon results
 * Achieves effective control on the Project or Program through management of scope, estimating, accounting, budget management, risk management and project closeout
 * Demonstrated ability to establish strong working relationships with team members, creates and motivates cross-functional & cross-departmental project teams, establishes roles and responsibilities, provides direction and fosters effective team skills to complete tasks on time
 * Ability to complete multiple, simultaneous projects with minimal supervision and prioritize incoming work appropriately
 * Ability to understand project interdependencies within a program, where relevant, and drive the project level work accordingly
 * Strong communication skills allowing the candidate to serve as a primary point of contact for communications across the groups (Biopharma IT, Business teams and any third party involved in the Project or Program), effectively communicating relevant information to key stakeholders as per the defined Communications plan
 * Demonstrates innovation, flexibility, open-mindedness, and adaptability in order to meet objectives in a rapidly changing environment with shifting priorities
 * Demonstrates the ability to effectively lead
 * Demonstrates the ability to drive results
 
 
 Desired Experience:
 * Experienced in managing Projects or Programs by leveraging standard industry Project Management frameworks (e.g. - PMBOK) and Software Development Lifecycle methodology (e.g. - Agile, Waterfall, etc.)
 * Demonstrated ability to manage project teams in a complex, changing environment to deliver value-added results to the organization
 * Demonstrated ability to work with a range of technically, culturally & geographically diverse teams in a matrixed environment, influencing them to complete deliverables, and delivering value added business results that meet high quality requirements within tight deadlines
 * Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate to a diverse audience at multiple levels within the company through various formats, such as presentations, written proposals, reports, correspondence, leading meetings, face-to-face dialogue etc.,

title: : Senior Technical Program Manager, SyncUP PETS
description:
Location: Bellevue, WA
Industry:  IT
Duration: 12 Months
 
Job Description
 
 
Location: Bellevue, WA
Duration: 12 Months
 
The client Product Team is looking for a highly skilled Senior Technical Program Manager that will be explicitly dedicated to growing client's  IoT and Emerging Product Portfolio; this individual will take explicit ownership of the end to end Software Development Lifecycle, build a path to support existing and future Product and Commercial objectives and ultimately enable client customers to successfully adopt new client technologies.
 
The ideal candidate will be very comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and will bring existing knowledge of releases across Consumer Apps / HW, Enterprise Software, and Product Performance Analytics.
 
- Understand the capabilities and value propositions of the current product and roadmap and the resulting client technical solution opportunities, and challenges.
- Manage the program software life-cycle for SyncUP PETS, including release management, day to day operations, and triage of issues. 1 to 1 Partnership with the Product Manager. Responsible for delivery, schedule, etc.
- Dive into the data to understand shortcomings of the product, track down the issues, and drive resolution across multiple teams.
 
- 10+ years of Program or Project Management experience.
- 5+ years working in a technical capacity, preferably related to mobile apps, cloud computing, and IoT.
- Demonstrated ability to learn fast in a dynamic environment.
- Strong analytical skills, a passion for analytics technology, and creativity in defining how new technologies can help customers reduce costs, improve profitability, gain efficiency and gain a competitive advantage
- Ability to communicate with customers and partners effectively and professionally
- Strong communication, data synthesis, presentation, and leadership skills
- Comfort interacting with senior business executives
- Adaptable work-style - functioning well both as a member of the team and as a self-directed, independent worker
- Ability to work effectively in a start-up environment and excel at managing complex cross-organizations projects where success is predicated on influencing team members without having direct authority over them
- Strong understanding of program management skills as a discipline
- Business consulting experience is highly desired
- Experience in one or more Consumer or Enterprise Product segments (Android / iOS Apps, Enterprise Software or IoT Solutions) is mandatory
- Client to provide equipment.
As an equal opportunity employer, ICONMA prides itself on creating an employment environment that supports and encourages the abilities of all persons regardless of race, color, gender, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, or disability.

title: DMV Application Development Project Manager
description:
ODOT is following the direction of the Governor's Office to help slow and prevent the spread of COVID-19. We are recruiting for agency critical positions at this time using virtual tools and processes such as video and phone interviewing to support social or physical distancing. We are also continuing to evaluate the situation and may extend or place recruitments on hold as appropriate. Current applicants for affected positions will be notified. Visit our COVID-19 web page for more information. For information about the statewide response, visit the Governor's COVID-19 web page.
We are reopening the job posting for this position. We briefly paused our recruiting for this position due to business reasons, but it has now been re-opened, as this position provides critical work to the agency.
Bring your information systems project management expertise to the DMV Application Development team!
In this role, the successful candidate will be responsible for management, oversight, progress and delivery of IT projects for large-size, high risk projects or systems that are complex and that could span multiple divisions.
We invite members of all diverse communities to join our workforce as we endeavor to best serve Oregonians from every background. ODOT values diversity and inclusion because they are good for Oregon. We believe that by welcoming differences, encouraging new ideas and views, listening to and learning from each other, and providing opportunities for professional enrichment we are better able to serve those around us. We thank you for considering this employment opportunity.
To request a copy of the position description, which includes all duties and working conditions, please email Sr. Recruitment Consultant Janelle Brown.
You will be required to use a vehicle to conduct business. You must possess and maintain a valid driver license and acceptable driving record. Your license does not have to be issued in Oregon to be considered.
If you have these attributes, let us know! It’s how we will choose whom to move forward!

title: Biostatistics Manager #20516.649
description:
Amgen Inc.

Biostatistics Manager Thousand Oaks, CA: Ensure all statistical aspects of documentation pertaining to clinical activates meet required standards and are statistically correct, influencing study design, defending statistical approaches internally and externally and leading one complex or multiple less complex studies/projects. Conducting clinical trial study protocol including: Hypotheses, Endpoints, and Statistical Section; Statistical Analysis Plan; Efficacy and safety monitoring plan for phase II studies; independent data monitoring plan for phase III studies; and clinical study report; Analyzing biostatistical data based on various statistical methodologies and interpreting and presenting statistical results; Utilizing statistical software such as R and SAS to validate statistical analyses and enhance clinical trial design elements by simulation; and Analyzing clinical trials, such as study designs and sample size calculation; Utilizing Bayesian analysis to conduct simulation studies to evaluate the operational characteristics of the design parameters. 40 hours per week.

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.

title: IT Program Manager w/ Procurement (4991)
description:
The Procurement COE Transformation Lead will be responsible for delivery and implementation of th procurement operating model transformation and Procurement Ways of Working deliverables, transforming the way GREFP & TBS Procurement operates. The focus of the role global, covering all GREFP Procurement locations. The role will own the project management of the Ways of Working program, and will be collaborating with Procurement & TBS stakeholders to drive the execution of Ways of Working priorities around...
Streamline the end to end P2P process, with a focus on creating a seamless user experience and strengthening analytics
Implement the Procurement threshold limit change from 0.1 OY to 0.25 OY globally and rollout the new procurement policy by August 2020
Implement e-Invoicing and P-Cards
Key objectives include:
Implement and drive Ways of Working transformation to agreed scope across the enterprise
Implement and connect all relevant project workstreams, ensuring full alignment and accountability for their effective execution (CoE, Ways of Working, Clinical Contracting, BPR-I, P2P Taskforce)
Establish and drive local centric strategic approach for Ways of Working solutions readiness, transition timelines, change impact assessment, continuous improvement mindset and innovation culture.
Develop trusted relationships with the key Procurement stakeholders, through anticipating and understanding key business needs and requirements, to deliver on their and Ways of Working strategy.
Partner with different TBS towers (i.e. Process Excellence & Innovation, TBS Strategy and Relationship Management, Data, Reporting and Analytics) to ensure alignment across all agendas.
Accountabilities:
Develop and deliver a robust yet flexible Procurement transformation/implementation plan which aligns with Ways of Working, PE&I, LEO, BPRI, Integration & Divestiture Office, etc.
Accountable for the end to end program management of all Procurement Ways of Working transitions; leveraging GREFP and TBS procurement capabilities to ensure transitions and projects are run in a structured manner.
Ensure change management and communication plans are fit for purpose and implemented effectively.
Lead the pre-transition planning and work with workstream leads, FLT, and Systems and Operations Lead to ensure readiness for transitions. Manage a robust go/no go governance framework.
Strong stakeholder management skills.
Continous Improvement capability and challenging the status quo
Extensive Procurement experience from both the business as well as global shared services operations.
Extensive experience in delivering multiple transitions and business transformation initiatives in a complex global environment
Ability to facilitate alignment without compromising principles
Strategic change and project management skills
Strong cultural awareness
Technical:
Proven track record in a Senior Procurement role with strategic and operational experience
Extensive experience in leading Procurement transition / business transformation and change programs.
In depth knowledge of process analysis and business simplification
In depth knowledge of transition methodology
Very good understanding of Procurement business processes
Leadership:
Strong strategic thinking and decision making
Ability to form strong working relationships across a matrix environment with ability to influence executive level leadership
Excellent communication, listening and influencing skills; ability to listen, anticipate customer needs and influence solutions
Demonstrated success leading global project teams
Strong stakeholder and relationship management
Act as a change agent, drive GREFP culture and mindset
Technically strong with proven ability to make sound decisions and lead projects to successful completion
Solutions oriented, with the ability to structure ambigiuous problems and develop qualitative and quantative approaches / methodologies for identifying and assessing various options to provide solutions
Strong business acumen with ability to understand the business implications of decisions
Result oriented - drives to pragmatic solutions and balances the ideal with the practical in order to deliver best value to the organization
Makes timely decisions and translates strategy into action. Ensures impact is quantified, tracker and realized
Interaction
Establishes credibility and earns respect with a diverse set of stakeholders within a complex region including senior executives, functional representatives and external partners. Able to facilitate alignment without compromising principles
A partner to the Regional and Country Finance Leads, Country Managers, TBS LT and other Takeda Corporate Functions
Engage with the business to understand current and anticipate future requirements
Innovation
Challenges the status quo to drive a greater value and growth for the business
Drive innovation and continuous improvement activities while ensuring business continuity and minimal business disruptions
Ensures sharing knowledge and best practices
Applies digital environment knowledge to create better solutions and insights
Complexity
Operating in a complex, R&D centric heavily regulated environment
Demonstrated capability to direct matrixed resources and manage a complex cross functional environment driving the execution of Finance transition plans and teams
Drives the changes at sites, has the combination of process, project and change management
Working within international / global remit and within and across other cultures
Desirable: Master's in Business Administration
Required: Bachelor's degree in Procurement or Supply Chain (or related)
Proven experience in delivering multiple Procurement transformation / change transformation programs.
High degree of integrity, confidence and self-awareness
Confident and persuasive with strong influencing skills; able to win internal support for new ideas and initiatives
Appreciates, understands and effectively negotiates within and across other cultures
Customer centric and solutions orientated aptitude with demonstrable experience in providing solutions based on customer needs.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with evident relationship building with professionals of all organizational levels.
Excellent organizational skills with proven success in a highly matrixed, fast paced and challenging business environment.
Ability to lead effectively and work concurrently across multiple priorities in a goal-oriented timeline-driven, and dynamic work environment, with quality and accuracy.
Problem-solving and entrepreneurial mind-set - driven to create and innovate
Proven ability to create success and thrive in an ambiguous environment. Must be comfortable with ambiguity, adept at change management; be very adaptable, and capable of working in cross-functional teams
Energetic and assertive; personality with strength in remaining goal focused; persistence to produce the highest quality of work at all times, regardless of size or scope of project
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Flexibility in working hours due to global nature (different time-zones) and demands of the role and organisation
TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:
Flexibility for an extensive global travel required

title: Technical Product Manager-Cloud Security
description:
Join the next wave of innovation that is happening at T-Mobile. Work on projects that challenge your intellect, passion, drive and curiosity. We are looking for a great Technical Product Manager to raise the bar for a high-performing team that delivers large scale solutions on the cloud. If you are looking to work on projects that are top organizational priority for the company, provide compelling end-user experiences and improve customer satisfaction, look no further!
Every product at T-Mobile is envisioned and created to achieve a specific business purpose or set of business results. The Product Manager, Technical is ultimately accountable, responsible, and has ownership of T-Mobile's internal and external products, platforms, services, experiences envisioned and created to achieve the specific business purpose or business results. At a high level this means identifying the intersection of customer problems/unmet needs (an opportunity), technical feasibility, business objectives, securing funding, and leading a cross-functional business and technical team, as well as key stakeholders to deliver against the opportunity.
 
 We are looking for a Cloud Security Product Manager with hands on product/program management experience who has an ability to develop technical recommendations. You will be leading the Cloud Security Product team focused on analyzing, designing and developing cloud security capabilities, implementing COTS security products and operations of these platforms and tools. You will be managing team's backlog as well as finding innovative new ways to protect our cloud footprint in the future. You'll use your leadership skills to give guidance, best practice advice and support across all our business and technology groups. You'll deploy best practices, new policies, and emerging trends to strengthen our strategic roadmap.
Vision, Strategy, and Analysis
 Product Execution & Technical Delivery
 Relationship & People, Professional Development
 
 
 Additional Requirements
 As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

title: Technical Accounting Manager for High-Growth Center City Organization!
description:
Top Client of Randstad is actively seeking an Accounting Manager for their growing organization! Working in gorgeous offices in Center City, the Technical Accounting Manager will report to the VP of External Reporting and will primarily be responsible for all technical accounting research and conclusions on complex areas of accounting. This role will have heavy exposure to Senior Management including the development and maintenance of policies and practices in technical accounting compliance. This a great opportunity to join a global organization with extensive growth opportunities in the department!
Responsibilities:
•Lead technical accounting policy efforts for the Company, including development and maintenance of policies and practices and education of the finance organization on technical accounting compliance.
•Provide technical accounting support for major transactions 
•Assist team with Financial Reporting processes and executing controls around Financial Reporting in a timely and diligent manner to comply with SOX requirements.
•Conduct research and document conclusions on specific US GAAP, and SEC disclosure and reporting developments
•Provide input and quality control for SEC filings, quarterly Earnings Releases, lender presentations and other ad hoc external reporting requirements including investor relation presentations.
Requirements:
•Bachelors Degree in Accounting 
•CPA Required 
•Big 4 or Strong Technical Accounting Experience Required 
•Knowledge of accounting principles, financial disclosure requirements and techniques, including US GAAP and SEC rules and regulations
•Ability to work effectively in a team environment in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment.

title: Senior Development Manager -   Design System
description:
The Design System team unites product, design, and, engineering teams around a common visual and brand language with which to work more efficiently and consistently across platforms and applications. We provide comprehensive documentation, code, and UI toolkits that set the standard for styles, components, and accessibility best practices, which in turn, allow our teams across CVS and Aetna to focus more on evolving a cohesive user experience.
The Senior Manager, Design Systems will drive a team that develops and manages design system components that sit as a foundation to our product design efforts. The ideal candidate will help establish process, gather design requirements, build and manage web components, and provide guidance for other product designers on the team.  Additionally, it is a great plus if the candidate is able to demonstrate strong story telling skills, a command of best practices and in-depth experience with the creation and management of design systems. As a part of the day to day responsibilities, Sr Manager, Design Systems will be working closely with design partners to gather the requirements and convert these design specifications into Front End re-usable Components for Web and Mobile Web Applications. This role will be responsible for Managing, evangelizing and growing the consumption and integration of these components across the organization in Web and Mobile App Platforms.
An ideal candidate should have:
• Minimum six years (6) of experience in Front End Technologies (Web or Mobile App related front end development)
• Minimum four (4) years of recent experience as a Technical manager leading teams in the development of Web and/or Mobile App Applications using Front End Technologies.
• Strong Knowledge of Responsive and Adaptive Designs.
• Knowledge of Web/re-usable component Concepts.
• Solid understanding of accessibility and inclusive design.
• Experience working in a flexible, adaptable, and empathetic way, understanding that each team and individual contributor will have unique work styles, and each project will vary in its specific process needs 
• A team-player; always bringing a smile and a limitless determination to succeed and grow 
• Experience with working cross-functionally, especially with product and engineering teams 
• A leader who is accountable for design quality and cohesion across all product teams, and who actively engages other designers to help maintain consistency.
• An understanding of product design, design research, and content strategy 
• Exceptionally organized with a desire to streamline and organize complex systems.
• An appreciation towards current industry product design systems 
• A clear, structured, and proactive communication skills, both written and verbal 
• Attentive to the details and capturing the big picture to achieve product goals
• Create efficiencies via reusable tools and frameworks to foster consistency and reduce duplication 
• The visual know-how and desire to delight the user and deliver a world-class experience
• An appetite for cross-platform collaboration
• An ability to advocate for, and be a strong representative of design
• Excellent communication and writing skills
• Ability to juggle multiple priorities and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
• Experience working with customers and product managers to translate high level requirements and use cases into detailed product designs and UI components.
• Collaborative and works with the larger product team to define and maintain UI/UX standards that will ensure uniformity across all the systems
Experience leading, building, and/or maintaining a design system. 
Experience working with UI frameworks like Angular and React is a plus.
Experience producing designs for large-scale, enterprise products in an agile environment.
Skills in generative and evaluative research methods to uncover user insights.
Experience working with InVision DSM and StoryBook.
Solid understanding of accessibility and inclusive design.
Knowledge or certification in SAFe.
High School diploma required.
Bachelor's/Master's Degree in Design or related field of study preferred.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Senior Manager
description:
CVS Health is looking for a talented and agile leader to enhance our understanding of the consumer as well as the effectiveness of marketing on our business.  As the Marketing Analytics Senior Manager, you will join an Enterprise Analytics team that enhances the corporate understanding of the CVS Pharmacy® retail customer and measures marketing initiatives across the retail front store, pharmacy and clinic.  In this role, you will be responsible for leading a small team of analysts in measuring media effectiveness and in understanding online and offline customer behavior.  You will have an advanced analytics background with experience in data science and/or customer analytics.  
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
•Lead and develop a small team of analysts in supporting the organization’s understanding of marketing effectiveness and consumer behavior
•Devise robust marketing measurement plans in collaboration with Marketing, Media and our agency partners
•Analyze social, digital and search data to help develop benchmarks, optimization strategies and recommendations
•Partner with business stakeholders to evaluate business questions and propose analytical solutions that provide actionable insights on customer behavior and/or marketing efficacy 
•Recommend and execute analytic solutions that enable a more complete understanding of customer retention and value
• Develop consistent approaches to evaluating customer behavior over time in a changing environment
• Create and deliver impactful presentations for mid-level and senior-level audiences
• Oversee the development of reporting that enables enhanced decision making by internal teams
• This role is based in Woonsocket, RI.
•6+ years of analytical experience or combination of PhD and 1+ years of related experience
•8+ years of related experience
•Strong leadership experience
•Experience with advanced analytic techniques, such as marketing mix, predictive modeling, multivariate 
regression analysis and ROI measurement
•Expertise using data analysis and visualization tools such as SAS, SPSS, R, Python, SQL, and Tableau
•Ability to handle multiple, complex projects in a deadline-driven environment
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science  or related field with 6+ years working in analytics with a track record of delivering insights and business impact; *Master’s degree or equivalent in analytic discipline and 3+ years of relevant experience; or a PhD and 1+ years of relevant experience
*CVS will sponsor for this position.
 Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.
   At CVS Health, we work every day to help people on their path to better health. Never has it been more important for us to deliver on our purpose to our valued customers, patients, members, and employees. With a presence in communities across the country, CVS Health colleagues are and will continue to be a critical piece of the country’s health care solution. The health and safety of our employees, patients, customers, and members is our top priority as we face the impact of COVID-19 together.
